loans.name: Paska Gulu

texts.en:
Paska Gulu is 26 years old and is married with one child; the child is enrolled in school. She has been in this business for three years, and works alone. 

She has embraced her business with high hopes that it would uplift the living standards of her family. She is organized, and the goods are well handled; this creates confidence and loyalty in her customers. 

Paska Gulu has successfully paid three loans on time with Finance (SS) Limited. 

She intends to use the loan to increase the stock of  her business.

loans.use: To pay for cooking oil, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Medelena Asalah

texts.en: Medelena Asalah is thirty six years old and is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She has been in this business for more than three years and has not employed anyone. She understands her customers very well and has diversified the range of her stock to avoid the risk of low sales. She has serviced three loans with Finance (SS) Limited and paid on time. She plans to stock her shop in anticipation for the Christmas boom.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, soap, salt and biscuits.

loans.name: Maurina Anthony

texts.en:
Maurina Anthony is 35 years old and is married with four children. Three of her children attend school.

Maurina Anthony sells a popular brand of fish - smoked Tilapia - that is more appealing to the customers. She has been in this business for more than 3 years and she works alone. The highway travelers to Juba create a pool of customers for fish that guarantees revenue. 

Maurina Anthony has serviced three loans with Finance (SS) Limited and has paid on time. She intends to use the loan proceeds to buy more fish.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of fish.

loans.name: Peter Setimo

texts.en: He is 41 years old and is married with six children, all of whom attend school. He has been in this business for more than five years. He solely aims to expand his bar to create a branch. There are many suppliers to rely on and this improves his chances of negotiating for a good price. He has serviced four loans with Finance (SS) Limited and has been one of the best payers. He intends to expand his bar to eventually become a hotel.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Agnes Fred

texts.en:
Agnes intends to improve the restaurant and make it attractive for customers. She intends to buy food like flour, cooking oil, additional dishes and pans for the restaurant. 

The previous loan enabled her to expand services and that has facilitated employment of three additional staff. She has been able to pay medical bills and school fees for the children and expand her business, and that is helping improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: To buy more food and improve the restaurant.

loans.name: Amuna Magret

texts.en:
With increased capital, Amuna Magret intends to capture a large share of the market for beans by increasing her supplies. She wants to buy more beans and other food like cassava chips and flour. 

She has been able to pay school fees for the children and provide the basic needs of the family including food and other amenities. From her business, she is now able to save some money and the family now has access to food on a regular basis. She intends to become a wholeseller.

loans.use: To buy items like beans, rice, flour and dry cassava chips.

loans.name: Mary Lupai

texts.en:
Mary Lupai is taking another loan to expand her business. She intends to buy more tomatoes, onions, and bananas. 

The previous loan enabled her to source supplies from distant markets like Yei, and this helped her generate a lot of income from the business. 

She has been able to construct a semi-permanent house for the family, and pay school fees for the children with the income from her business

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, sweet bananas, etc. for her food store.

loans.name: Mary Henry

texts.en:
Mary Henry is 40 years old and is married with four children; all of whom attend school. She has been in the grocery business for three years and operates alone. Her shop is located in a residential area where there are not many competing sellers. She is educated and has good management skills. She plans before she executes. 

She has serviced two loans with Finance (SS) Limited and paid on time. With this new funding, she will be able to increase her stock to meet increasing demand for drinks and basic goods like sugar.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, sugar and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Laki Robert

texts.en: Laki Robert is 25 years old and is married with one child, who is not yet enrolled in school. He has been in business for at least two years. His business is his only source of employment, and this makes him work hard. His business is in a strategic location and is more likely to attract a lot of customers once stock levels increase. He has serviced one loan with Finance (SS) Limited and paid on time. He would like to buy more cooking oil, baking flour and cosmetics.

loans.use: To pay for cosmetics, cooking oil and baking flour.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph intends to increase stock in his ladies clothing collections in anticipation of the festive season. With the previous loan, he was able to bring supplies from Kampala, Uganda, for sale in Yei. The business has grown, and he sometimes receives orders in advance via telephone from loyal customers. This has enabled his turnover to increase. He has been able to use income generated from his business to invest in farming.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
The man in the photograph is Habil. He works as a taxi driver. He transports people along the different routes depending on order. Habil is 43 years old. He is married with two children. Their son is in the military service and their daughter lives with them.
 
For 2 years, he has been transporting people from one point to another. This is not his only source of income. He also has a tractor and he tills soil in the summer for money.

Currently, Habil's car is broken and urgently needs to be repaired. He does not have the money to repair his automobile. He is in need of a loan to buy car repair parts and return to work.

loans.use: to purchase car parts to repair his car.

loans.name: Chiwanza

texts.en:
Chiwanza is a 29-year-old woman who lives in the Copperbelt province of Zambia.  She lives with her parents and seven siblings.  She has a Certificate in Information Technology from the University of Zambia.  Chiwanza’s parents are retired so she helps them by paying utility bills and buying groceries for the family.  

One thing Chiwanza enjoys the most about managing a mobile money transfer business is all the people in her community she is able to meet by providing the service.  Many people are looking for cheap and safe ways to send and receive money.  She works diligently at providing the best service for her customers.  

This loan will help Chiwanza increase her working capital in order to service more customers efficiently.  With the additional profit from growing her business, Chiwanza would like to go back to school and earn her degree in Information Technology studies.

loans.use: To have more capital available to transfer money for her customers

loans.name: Owen

texts.en:
Owen is a 27-year-old micro-entrepreneur. He operates his own Zoona mobile money-transfer business. Upon completing school in 2009, Owen began working as a teller for a Zoona mobile money outlet. During this time he was able to learn the business well and through time grew the desire to start one on his own. Because of his dedication as a teller for four years, the mobile money owner decided to help Owen start his own outlet. He provided an initial investment of $1,000, and now Owen is successfully operating his own Zoona mobile money shop. With his increased income he has been able to pay for his younger sisters' school fees as well.  

Owen is requesting a loan from Kiva because he wants to expand his business and open another mobile money outlet in the town centre. He has seen an increase in demand for a secure way to transfer money from his customers. With the loan, Owen will purchase a trading booth and new phone technology, which will enable him to serve more customers.  

Owen’s dream is to attend university and study business administration. He sees his mobile money business as a good first step in becoming a successful businessman.

loans.use: To purchase a new booth to expand his mobile money business to serve more customers in need of sending or receiving money.

loans.name: Gwendoline

texts.en:
Gwendoline operates a small mobile money business that provides a service for her community to safely transfer money throughout Zambia. She is 22 years old and has a four month old son. This will be Gwendoline’s second loan.

Gwendoline used her first loan to add working capital to her outlet so she could serve more customers.  With her increased profit, she reinvested to open an additional shop in a nearby residential area in Lusaka.  Owning and operating two shops has made Gwendoline very happy.
  
The reason for Gwendoline’s second loan is to improve the service at her second shop. The shop has the potential to service more customers but she needs additional working capital to meet the increased demand for her mobile money service. Gwendonline is always striving to grow her business so she can earn more profit and provide for her growing baby.

loans.use: to grow her mobile money transfer business and serve more customers in need of financial services.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 44-year-old Iraqi woman who is married and a mother of five children.

She has 15 years of experience herding and raising cows to sell. The more young animals she can buy at the same time and raise simultaneously, the more income she can generate, as there is a high demand for the cows for their meat. She is taking a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to be able to purchase more young animals.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase more young animals.

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
Tri runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. Tri lives in Jakarta. Tri is single.

Tri began working with Ruma six months ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. He feels really excited about expanding his business. For the last three months, he made around $100 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, he took out a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 26 years old, and married with two children. He has a library shop in Ibanda town. His main challenges are high rent costs, competition around town, and people who borrow the films and don’t return them. He applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to start up a mobile money business to have a side income. This will help him get more income and he hopes to construct his own permanent home for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for the float for his mobile money business

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a widower with three children. All his children go to school. He deals in agriculture primarily in banana-selling. He applied for a loan of UGX.1,200,000 to help him buy straw and manure for mulching his banana plantation. By mulching his plantation, he hopes to get better yields and get more income to look after his children to a better standard and provide good education for them. He also hopes to construct a good shelter for the family. His major challenge is weather, especially during the dry season, when the place becomes dry and some times the rains come with strong winds and hail storms and destroy the plantations.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius lives in a rural area in Kanywambogo parish. He is a married man with four children. He deals in the sale of dry cereals. He mainly sells coffee beans and dry cassava. His customers are people from Ibanda town. He transports the produce twice a week and finds it a challenge because of high transport costs. He requested a loan of UGX.1,000,000 to help him buy more stock of dry coffee beans to add to his business since it is the season and before other people come into business. He will use the rest of the money to pay tuition for his children.

Despite the challenges he has, Julius is a very hard-working man, looking forward to providing a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy dry coffee

loans.name: Ibanda Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Doreen deals in second hand shoes. She is a widow who lost her husband in 2009 and lives with her six children who are all in school. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). She wants to use the money to buy more stock of second hand clothes to add to her business such that she can beat the competition and get more customers and use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children. Doreen is a very hard working and honest woman who struggles singlehandedly to provide a good education for her children such that they can be better in future. 
Her major challenges are inadequate capital to expand her business and high operational costs like rent which affect her cashflow.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 39 years old and married with six children and two dependants who she is taking care of after the death of their father. Agnes deals in cattle fattening in her region. She has managed to help her family financially by providing the basic necessities. Along with cattle fattening, she also deals in milk sales and a health clinic for her husband. They have managed to construct a permanent house through income from selling milk and to pay tuition for the children.

Agnes is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more cows for fattening as it will enable her to raise enough profit to meet the needs of the family for all the basic necessities of life and to construct a dam for water collection. The dam will provide her with enough water during the dry season.
Her major challenge is inadequate pastures to feed the cows, especially in the dry season when some of her animals even die due to the prolonged drought.

Her dream is to own a large farm in the region with at least 500 cows. Agnes is resilient and hard working.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Andri

texts.en:
Andri runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and bill payments. Andri lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area three hours from Jakarta.  Andri is married.

Andri began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and serving bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last  month, he has around $ 15 - 20 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, he took a loan to get a printer from KIVA to support his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payment (household electricity payment).

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en:
Awatef is a true role model for Iraqi women, a great entrepreneur driving positive change in conservative communities. She built her business in a simple, honest, step-by-step process, gaining the respect of her family and her community, showing an attainable business model to many.

Awatef is the owner of a beauty salon, a hair dresser and beautician, a wife, and a mother of two children. She is 48 years old and has faced many challenges. She not only tackled them but also made the best of them. When safety and security issues were putting many families in danger in Iraq, Awatef and her family had left the country to stay in neighboring for Syria and Lebanon for a while. While out of the country, she decided to continue her education and gained knowledge of various beautician techniques unavailable in Iraq. This knowledge gave a little advantage, but she certainly had to walk her career path step-by-step.

At first she worked in a beauty salon, where she worked for a wage for about 4 years. She then decided to work on her own and start to slowly build up her own clientele working from home. After about 2 years of working out of her home she was able to open a Salon on her own. The Beauty Salon has now been in operation for 4 years. Awatef provides a range of services to her female customers, who - in addition to receiving their hair and beauty treatments - can also see and experience first hand how a woman can grow a business, and how a woman can grow in the eyes of society. 

Managing a beauty salon may not seem like a unique task or a world changing endeavor, but it is indeed. Because behind the walls of the salon there are many opportunities, behind the walls is a hard working women, behind the walls is place where women have a chance to learn from each other, behind the walls is a role model for opportunities to grow.    

Awatef is now ready for her next step and further growth as she started to expand her business, and she already started the construction works on the new room to be added as an area for new services: a special area for brides to get ready, a corner for facial peeling, and even some fitness equipment. 

Awatef's growing business and her positive attitude qualified her to participate in the WLIFT program and her business is taking a SME loan in the amount of 14,000 for the expansion works and interior finishes.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: for the expansion of the salon and its interior finishes.

loans.name: Théophile Christian

texts.fr: Théophile est un homme de 35 ans célibataire et père d'un enfant 5 ans qui va à l'école. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans où il vend la friperie es vêtements des jeunes, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les vêtements qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour agrandir saboutique de vêtements.
texts.en: Théophile is a 35-year-old man who is unmarried and the father of a 5-year-old attending school. For ten years, Théophile has been a merchant at a local market, where he sells secondhand clothing for youngsters, men, and women (according to the season and the bale). Due to his meager capital, he is compelled to go to the unpacking each weekend to purchase retail the clothing he displays at his stall. This is not very profitable, thus the importance of loans for his business, since he could then purchase a mixed bale. He will save the profits this loan will bring in for expanding his clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothing

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: Solange est une femme de 44 ans, veuve et mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une parfumerie dans un marché de la place depuis un an. son activité fonctionne bien grace à son acceuil et la bonne qualité de ses produits. Elle sollicite de crédit pour augmenter son stock des produits cosmétiques et mèches. ceci augmentera ses ventes ainsi que ses bénéfices. bénéfice qui sera réinvesti en partiedans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Solange is a 44-year-old widow and mother. She is a merchant and about a year ago opened a perfume shop at a local market. Her business is doing well thanks to her kind reception and the good quality of her products.

She is requesting a credit loan to increase her supply of cosmetics and hair extensions. This will increase her sales as well as her profits, part of which will be reinvested in her business, and the rest will enable her to support her family.

loans.use: increase her stock supply of cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Alphonsine Solange

texts.fr: Alphonsine est une dame âgée de 30 ans, fiancée et mère de 02 enfants de 5 et 6 ans tous deuxenfants vont  à l'école. Comme activité, elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la ville de 03 ans environ. Elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boisson. Cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice et lui permettra aussi d'être en règle dans son commerce. Les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en: Alphonsine is a 30-year old woman, who is engaged and mother to two children, who are five and six years respectively and both at school. For the past three years, she has been running a takeaway business in a district of the town. She has good experience in this field and with this loan would like to increase the quantity of crates of drink. This will lead to an increase in turnover and profit and will put her business in good order. The income she generates will also enable her to provide better for her family's needs. Her ambition is to become a wholesale drinks vendor.

loans.use: to increase her stock of crates of drinks.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is aged 38, married with 4 children aged 18,16,13 and 12 respectively. He pays school fees for 3 children.  

He works in agriculture mainly coffee and cattle keeping and maize. Moses has been doing this since 1988 in order to support his family.

Moses has approached UGAFODE for a loan of 2m after taking 1.5 million initial loan.  He wants the money to buy coffee now that the demand is up and hopes to pay back the money without difficulty. 

His main challenge is lack of enough capital to buy in bulk, a reason why he needs funding from UGAFODE.

loans.use: to buy rice, Irish potatoes and corn.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 38 years old and married with seven children. She owns a retail shop and also engages in cattle fattening as another source of income. She has earned a lot from this business. For example, she has been able to pay school fees for five of her children and also construct a house for her family.

Asiya is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy cows for fattening as it will enable her to support her family financially. Her major challenge is the seasonality of her business. There are times when she sometimes fetches little profits which do not help in providing all the basic needs for her family or allow her to plow back into the business. 

Asiya is honest and hardworking. She hopes that when the cattle business booms, she will be able to invest in a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.en:
Jose Alfredo established his business, CMJ Painting and Refinishing, over 15 years ago in Anaheim. However, he has been working as re-furnisher for about 30 years. His expertise is apparent in his beautifully crafted work. He can make an old cabinet look new with only a few hours work, but Jose puts in a lot of hours in his work. He works about 70 hours a week. When asked how he manages to work so hard, he responded, "I work for my family; for my wife and my son. My wife is blind and cannot work. She has many medical bills, so I work very hard to provide for her."

With the economic downturn in 2008, Jose saw his sales go down and the last few years have been very tough. Now that things have gotten a bit better, he is eager to get sales back up, but he needs to purchase and upgrade his equipment to maintain the quality of his work. He is also looking to increase the marketing of his business by attending Home and Garden trade shows.

With this $7,000 loan from KIVA, he will be able to market his business and get the equipment he needs to continue operating.

loans.use: To pay for Home and Garden trade show fees and to purchase equipment

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 49 years old and is single. She lives with her son in a rented apartment, and she sells second hand clothing door-to-door. Because of this business, Gladys earns a daily income for her expenses. 

She is requesting a loan of GHS 1,500 to invest in her small business, buying a variety of ladies clothing to sell to customers. Through this, she hopes to earn a better income to continue increasing her products, and improving her financial situation bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ladies clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Yehowa No Group

texts.en:
The "Yehowa No" group comprises nine women from one of Accra's suburbs. In the past, these women used to interact with one another through weekly savings groups' meetings which allowed them to self-finance and support their income-generating activities. 

With the aim of strengthening the economic power of women, the group has recently entered into partnership with ID-Ghana, Kiva's partner, whose mission is to help them to better manage their activities in a professional way and get more profits. "Yehowa No" is therefore a credit group consisting of women who live in the same neighborhood and are involved in different trading including sales of provisions, detergent, cooking oil, noodles, materials, jeans, shirts, bags, etc. 

The group's representative is named Matilda. She is a married woman who has been selling jeans and shirts for two years. Matilda works from 9 AM until 4 PM every day. With the profits that she makes from her business, she is able to contribute to the daily expenses of the family and save part with microfinance. 

Matilda is a member of one of the local branches of ID-Ghana and she is requesting a loan to buy jeans and shirts for resale. Through this loan, she is hoping to see an increase in her profits. She would also like to contribute to the improvement of her family's food conditions. Her goal is to save some money and, in the future, to open her own shop.

loans.use: To buy jeans and shirts for resale.

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Dede is a 38-year-old single mother of two children. She has a business selling smoked fish, which she has been running for one year. Dede has applied for her sixth loan from ID-Ghana, Kiva's partner, to enable her to purchase two cartons of fish and smoke to sell to customers. With the anticipated profit, she plans to use part to pay her children's school fees and part to save with ID-Ghana.

In the near future, Dede hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase two cartons of fish and smoke

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old and single, the mother of two children. 

She has a business selling cooking utensils, which she has been running for 10 years.  

Mary has applied for her seventh loan, from ID-Ghana, Kiva's partner, to enable her to buy more cooking utensils and ice chests to sell toher customers. 

With the anticipated profit, she plans to use part to pay her children's school fees and part to save with ID-Ghana. In the near future, Mary hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils and ice chests to sell to her customers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is an artisan from El Salvador who specializes in cotton apparel. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of cotton fabric, as well as in keeping all current artisans in the workshop employed.

Judith has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is her story:

"I was born in El Salvador to a large family of seven children and parents who were farmers. They taught us the value of hard work, discipline, and honesty. 

"When I was 16, I got married and I had my first daughter at the age of 17. Several years later, my dear Aunt Adelfa patiently began teaching me to sew and embroider; she was a true artist.  I perfected my skills and techniques and I developed my own style. 

"I've taught many people since then, mostly women such as single mothers, who have been able to support their children with these skills. 

"I began in 1973 and, today, I've built up a family workshop. My husband is the administrator and helps with delivering orders. My son takes care of planning, sales, and marketing. I do the designing and look after the production, from start to finish. 

"Our main material is cotton fabric, woven by hand in a nearby town. I'm passionate about this art. It is closely related to the history and traditions of our country. My designs use many motifs representative of Maya art.

"I am grateful for the opportunity to receive this microcredit to invest in my workshop. Thank you so much for your support of artisans like me."

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of cotton fabric for her apparel.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 25 years old and married with three children and one dependent who they look after due to her old age. Nicholas is an agriculturalist who specializes in coffee growing and owns about two acres of coffee plantations in his region. He also operates a retail shop where he generates additional income. He makes local brew (waragi) as another source of income.
 
From the income realized from coffee and local gin sales, he has managed to look after his family and mostly provide the basic necessities. However Nicholas’ biggest challenge is inadequate income to pay tuition for his children plus the seasonal changes that affect his earnings as most of his coffee was hit by sunshine and dried up.

He is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation. He hopes this will increase the productivity of the coffee and bananas in the near future, increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Vitarino

texts.en:
Vitarino is a married man with eight children, some of whom are in school. Coffee farming and coffee trade are his source of income. He gets his customers from fellow villagers and produces 30 bags of coffee every season. 

Vitarino has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX to help him buy fertilizer and pesticizeds for his coffee plantation and to pay tuition for his children. 

Vitarino is a very hard working and honest man. His main challenges are pests and diseases, which affect his coffee in the field. He hopes these will soon be overcome when he sprays the coffee to help the plants grow better. He thanks Kiva lenders for show interest in a poor fellow like him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en:
Gladys, who is in her late thirties, is married with four children who are all in school. For three years now, Gladys has been selling plates. Gladys works from 08:00 am to 05:00pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

This will be her 3rd loan from ID- Ghana, a Kiva partner. She used her previous loans to improve her business. Gladys used her business profits to pay for her house building costs, covered school fees, household expenses and reinvested the remainder back into her business. She will use this loan to buy more plates to resell. She dreams of opening a successful business which could make her even life better.

Gladys will take this loan with two other members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more plates to resell.

loans.name: Boneconceal

texts.en:
Boneconceal is a married woman with eight children who are all in school. She is hard working woman and self motivated. She earns her income from coffee farming and coffee trading. She gets her customers from the neighboring villages. She has applied for a loan to help her purchase farmland with coffee in it and use the rest of the money to buy coffee for trade. 

Her major challenge is thieves who steal her coffee when its still in the garden and also her children fall sick, which reduces labor on her farm.

loans.use: to purchase land for farming.

loans.name: Ryakatiri Twetungure Group

texts.en:
Grace is a single mother who divorced her husband due to family wrangles. She was left with six children and also takes care of her parents who are now too old to do anything for themselves.

 She runs a small retail shop with the meager working capital of UGX 300,000 where she earns income to look after the family. Besides that, she also has a piggery project where she earns additional income to support her family. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 UGX to buy building materials like timber and cement to construct an improved sty for her pigs. She will use the balance to add more stock to her retail shop. Her customers are neighbors and a few outsiders. Her major challenge is diseases. Grace is a very hardworking and honest woman.

loans.use: To buy building materials for an improved pig sty.

loans.name: Jorge Agustín

texts.en: Jorge, a small farmer in Morelos, has been significantly impacted by the rising price of fossil fuel based liquefied petroleum gas, also known as propane. He and his family, like most rural Mexicans, rely on the "gas LP" for the majority of their energy needs, using it to heat bathwater and to cook. Jorge is investing in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because he wants energy independence. He saw a functioning Biobolsa in his state and realized it doesn't make sense for him to continue spending as much as he does on "gas LP" if he can produce his own free, renewable biogas using animal waste he already has plenty of. He will use the biogas produced by his digester to displace his current, non-renewable energy source and our technicians predict that he will see savings of at least 80% and may actually be able to completely replace his LP gas purchases once the system starts generating biogas. This loan represents 25% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is a second-time borrower client of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI), applying for a loan of UGX 500,000. She is a single lady with two children.

She rents in a trading centre outside Kampala city, where she runs a small beauty salon for ladies in the same house. This has enabled her to get a small income and look after her children by providing school fees and other necessities.

Aidah says her salon is doing fairly well in terms of sales, and she also expects more in the coming months due to Christmas season.  However, she is let down by inadequate capital to buy more salon items and thus is applying for a loan to boost it. 

Further she says she has plans to educate her children, pay off her loan well as usual, and maintain good relations with her financial institution.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin, age 56, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Mahdiya

texts.en:
Mahdiya is a 21-year-old single lady. She started a beauty parlor in her home a year ago. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through doing her best at providing services, she became very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her second loan. She needs a loan of 30,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en: Hanifan is a 53-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people in her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to complete the orders of her customers on time. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Safie

texts.en:
Safie is 45 and has two school-aged children and they all live in the rural south-central area in a village with very rough terrain; the weather is harsh and there are plenty of difficulties to get there, due to the unpaved roads. She is requesting a loan to use for medical reasons; this will be her first loan. 

“Sometimes the inadequate vision gets in my way and prevents me from doing things I would do. And growing older my vision has gotten worse. I want to have a surgery done with this money and hopefully lenders will understand my needs and lend to me,” said Safie.

For the past seven years, Safie has been selling dairy products from her own animals at the local market of a little nearby town.

loans.use: to cover her medical expenses

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: A USD 1,000 loan is offered to Clara to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2007 through her own work. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like toothbrushes, soap, candles, soy sauce, soy sour, cards, books, pencils, noodles, cigarettes, salt, sugar, coffee, soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), water, and eggs. She is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy toothbrushes, soap, candles, soy sauce, soy sour, cards, books, pencils, noodles, cigarettes, salt, sugar, coffee, soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), water, and eggs

loans.name: Anina

texts.en:
Anina is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married and she has one child. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such shirts, trousers, shorts, women's clothing and handbags. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $100. 

Anina is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) Program that offers loans to poor people to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy  shirts, trousers, shorts, women's clothing and handbags.

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en:
A $ 1,000 loan is being offered to Joaninha to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $ 100.  She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like body lotion, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits, water, oil and slippers. 

Joaninha is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.  She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.  She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy body loosen,noodles,cigarettes,coffee,sugar,salt,milk,biscuit, water,oil and slippers

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as cigarettes, noodles, soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer) and 'body loosen,'   biscuits, water, cards and slippers. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Rosalia is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, noodles, soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer) and 'body loosen', biscuits, water, cards and slippers

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 30 years and married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. 

She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and she is now applying for her second loan of USD 1,000. 

She will buy additional stocks to keep in her store, such as noodles, body lotion, cigarettes, soft drinks, beer, biscuits, coffee, and sugar. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy noodles, body lotion, cigarettes, soft drinks, beer, biscuits, coffee, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.en:
Crecencia is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 27 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, water, biscuits, pencils, books and fish canes. She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Crecencia is living in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, water, biscuits, pencils, books and fish canes.

loans.name: Teresinha

texts.en: Teresinha is requesting a loan for $1,000 to improve her business, which she has run since 2006, by buying more used clothing items, such as trousers, shorts, and skirts, to sell to her customers. She is generating a good income from her business, which she opened after working in this field for several years. She lives in the town of Dili with her family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, and skirts.

loans.name: Jukita

texts.en:
Jukita is married, and she has three children. She is running a secondhand store that helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her secondhand store a year ago with her own working capital of 200 USD. 

Jukita is taking a loan of 1,000 USD to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as trousers, shorts, short sleeves, long sleeves and sleepers. Jukita is a hard working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, short sleeves, long sleeves and sleepers.

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
Vjollca is a 48-year-old Egyptian married mother of two school aged children; she had previously immigrated to Greece with her family, and when the economy in their neighbor country went down, they all came back to their home city. They reside in a main city in southeastern Albania, where the majority of their community lives. 

Initially, Vjollca bought a female pig, and at the moment she has four of them; this is her little activity where she generates an income. She and her son, Ledjan, in the photo, are in the business together.

Vjollca and her family are indeed poor, as you can tell by their photograph. 

She is requesting a loan to add one more room to their one-room family home, which houses six people.

loans.use: to add one more room to their one-room family house for six people

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 38 years old and she runs a small shop in front of her house.  

Florencia will use this loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as beef, chicken, pork, vegetables, and rice. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. Florencia lives in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use: To buy beef, chicken, pork, vegetables, and rice

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
A USD $1,000 loan is offered to Yuliana to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store like noodles, cigarettes, books, pencils, coffee, sugar, salt and water. She is generating a good income from selling.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy noodles,cigarettes, books, pencils, coffee, sugar, salt and water

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
A USD 600 loan is offered to Ana to improve her business. She is married and she has five children.

Ana has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as sewing machine tools, as well as tools for frying banana fritters. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Ana independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine tools, as well as tools for frying banana fritters.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small shop with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. They offer laces, ribbons, spools of threads in various colors, etc. to the people of their locality and make a good amount of money through this business. Farhat is motivated to provide her three children with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more spools of thread along with packs of laces and needles. It will help them to increase their sales. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads along with packs of laces and needles.

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en: Surriya is a 47-year-old married woman, and a mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Surriya’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Surriya has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. Surriya is hopeful that this loan will be a useful one for her husband and that it will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 22-year-old married woman and mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Razia’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Razia has applied for her second loan of PKR 30,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Razia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad, age 48, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to support her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two baby goats.

loans.name: Nazima

texts.en: Nazima is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is 43 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for twelve years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When she was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Due to limited resources none of their four children were sent to school. Khalida felt it necessary to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. She is a brave woman and hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she was having difficulty in fulfilling big orders. Khalida has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors. She dreams of expanding her business and wants to use part of profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of one child. She has been running a tailoring business at home for the last 5 years. She manages her household activities as well while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. She wants to expand her business and has therefore contacted Kashf Foundation. Samina has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase one sewing machine and cloth to expand her business. In this way she will be able to meet with the increasing demands of her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of having a quality lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase one sewing machine and cloth to expand her business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 48-year-old married lady and the mother of five children. She has been running a small general store in her community for the past 15 years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, Nasreen has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 which she will use to buy pulses, rice, flour, and other eatables from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. It’s her second loan with Kashf Foundation and her payment record is good. Nasreen wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy pulses, rice, flour, and other eatables from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 37-year-old married, vigorous lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for the past ten years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. She is the mother of five children and is trying hard to provide them with good quality food, health and education. For the improvement of her business, Rehana contacted Kashf Foundation and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a hardworking married woman and the mother of six children. She has been running a business of animal purchase and resale for the past seven years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices and brings them up, and then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She wants to provide her family with good quality food, health, and education. Irshad has requested a loan of 30,000 Rs. to purchase two more calves. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in the business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four children.  She has been successfully running a general store with her husband, who is also shown in the photo.  

Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough profit to meet the expenses of their household.  Currently, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at the store.  Shamim is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a 27-year-old vigorous lady.  She is a very hardworking woman and has been in the business of hand embroidery for the past two years.  She makes beautiful patterns with stones and sequins and is earning enough to contribute to the family income.  She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong, but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day.  

Kiran has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demands of her customers.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing basic necessities of life to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been doing a business of quilt stitching for the past nine years. She has established a good clientele list over the years and people admire her work, so demand for her work is continually rising. 

She wants to expand her business to fulfill the customer demands regularly and on time. Nasira has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistani Rupees) to buy one more machine with some spools of thread. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more machine with some spools of thread.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 22-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past four years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of  20,000 PKR (Pakistani Rupees) from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 25-year-old married woman. She sells clothes to contribute to the family income. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani Rupees) from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.  She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Ghulam

texts.en:
Ghulam is 52 years old and married, the mother of three. 

She is involved in work of manufacturing "neel" powder, which is used in laundry for whitening the clothes.  She has been doing it with the support of her husband (the man in the picture) for the past six years.  By this time she has become famous in her community for providing best-quality neel. Her husband assists her, selling it door to door.  

Ghulam wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy good-quality raw materials, such as blue dye and mineral stones. It will help her to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy good-quality raw materials, such as blue dye and mineral stone.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been manufacturing carpets for the last two years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 34-year-old married woman. Bushra buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a loan of PKR 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been running business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Zuhra requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 54-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 59 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for seven years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When she was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family so she started her business to contribute to the family income.  

She is a brave woman and her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. So she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 10,000 to purchase spools of thread along with packs of buttons and laces in various colors. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread along with packs of buttons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 28-year-old hard working woman. She deals in a business of milk sales. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with good food, health and clothing. 

To cope with the increasing demands of her customers she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to have an increase in her capacity to produce mile which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en:
Asima is a 27-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Asima wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Soniya

texts.en:
Soniya is a 20-year-old lady. She has been running a business of tailoring to contribute to the family income. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. She also deals in selling work clothes to generate an extra amount of profit.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons etc. to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Kanizan

texts.en:
Kanizan, age 57, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila, age 27, is a married woman. She had a difficult time after her husband’s business failure so she began stitching work in her house five years ago. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has borrowed PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials such as spools of threads along with packs of zippers, buttons and laces in various colors. It will help her to stitch more dresses on time. She is currently in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of threads along with packs of zippers, buttons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is 46 years old, a vigorous, married woman and a mother of five children. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past six years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Perveen’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best-earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to complete the orders of her customers on time. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been running a business selling clothes for the past two years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Khalida requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Zanib

texts.en:
Zanib, age 51, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her part of household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase two calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two calves.

loans.name: Aneeta

texts.en:
Aneeta is a 19-year-old single lady. She runs a beauty parlor and offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. This is why she applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 through Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is 38 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for five years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When she was not earning her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family; due to limited resources none of their four children were sent to school. 

Munira felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. She is a brave woman and her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but now she was having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. She has requested PKR 15,000 and her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread. She is currently in her third loan cycle and has shown a good repayment history in the past. She dreams of providing a quality lifestyle to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been running a business making and selling snacks for the past year. She is expert in making good tasting snacks like samosas and pakoras (a traditional dish made from vegetables, chicken and corn flour and then deep fried) and earns enough through this business to contribute to the family income. 

In order to inflate her sales Sajida has contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase a stock of corn flour with packets of oil, salt and spices. She is in her second loan cycle and has a good credit repayment history. She wishes to spend part of revenue on providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of corn flour with packets of oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Sayida Razia

texts.en:
Sayida Razia is a 48-year-old married woman and is running a general store in her community with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. They have been doing it together for many years and make enough to meet their daily household expenses. Over time they have become famous due to their good behavior and how they deal with their customers. 

To stock their store fully, Sayida Razia has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy rice, sugar and flour etc. from the market at lower rates. In this way they will be able to meet the increasing demands of customers consistently. She dreams of providing a quality lifestyle to her family by contributing to the family income.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house for the last year.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Kubran's Group

texts.en: Kubran, a 34-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Pakistan with her husband and four children. Her husband is a tailor by profession. He wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. Kubran is a member of two persons lending group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a poor but hardworking woman, age 39, and living in Lahore, Pakistan. The living standard of her house is not good. She wants to change the living standard for her family and provide them with quality of education. She always keeps in thoughts how to grow income and what would be the reasonable source for getting more income. Due to lack of capital, she is unable to make her plans come true.
 
Her husband has only a single source of income, which is sheltering services, and she wants to invest all her savings for the establishment of the business. Her husband wants to buy planks and pillars to provide sheltering services. Therefore, she requested a loan for investing more money in current business of her husband.

She hopes that through the loan amount, her husband would be able to buy pillars and wooden planks and can get more profit.
Naseem praises and thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sheltering materials, such as pillars and wooden planks, to provide sheltering services.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is taking a loan to buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for embroidery work at home. She has been doing embroidery for many years, and feeding her children. She is a responsible mother; she knows about her duties and responsibilities towards her children very well. She always keeps busy and ready to provide the better facilities to her dear children.

She is the age of 56 and the mother of eight children. Her husband does work in a small firm at very low daily wages and comes home very late at night. She has to pick up and drop off her children herself, manage routine work, and complete her tasks for embroidery as well. 

Her dream is to expand her house according to the population of her children, and for this purpose she is making savings.

Kalsoom is very happy and relaxed after taking this loan because this loan will be the cause of increased monthly income and savings as well.

loans.use: to buy sequins, pearls, and thread of various colors for embroidery.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 43-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two daughters and two sons. 
She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. Her husband is a shoe-maker by profession. He makes shoes by hand, and his hand-made shoes are very famous in his hometown. 

Many manufacturers like to give him orders for making shoes and remain on the waiting list. Earlier, he has been providing only services to his clients for shoe making, but now he has gotten a lot of market experience and wants to buy materials on his own for shoe making so that he can earn better than past.
 
She wants to construct her house, provide better education to her children, and establish the business for her husband.
Farzana is thankful to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as rexine, thread, nails, and sole for making shoes to sell.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 55-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days, his rickshaw has not been properly working and, therefore, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Zarina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Zarina is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en:
Shanaz is a 43-year-old mother of four children. Her husband owns a small crockery store selling items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glasses, jugs, mugs and buckets. The family's sole income provider, he has to pay the utility bills, his children's school fees, and the household expenses. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living comfortably.

Shanaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can increase both his inventory and his earnings. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy crockery items for resale.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 36 years old, a married woman and a mother of three. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past 13 years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Kousar has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of zippers, buttons etc. She is currently in her third loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation and has shown a good credit repayment behavior in the past. In addition to expanding her business she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Iqra

texts.en:
