Iqra is a 23-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been involved in a tailoring business for three years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household as well as the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now Iqra has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, laces etc. In this way she will be able to meet with the increasing demand of her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Currently, she is in her fourth loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation and has shown a good repayment behavior in the past. 

Iqra hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 32-year-old married woman, and a mother of five children. She has been running a business of animal purchase and sales for the past two years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them in the market at higher prices. Her husband is a laborer, and has a very small income on daily wages. 

Naseem wants to provide a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing to her children. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs.30,000 to purchase two more calves. 

She is currently in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Manzoran

texts.en:
Manzoran is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has had a business of animal trade for the past two years. Currently she has two cows. 

She purchases calves, and when they mature, sells them to the people of her community or in the local animal market. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She has nine family members in her house, and she is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing. 

Manzoran has requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to purchase two more calves. She is currently in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation, and has shown good credit repayment behavior in the past. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 46-year-old vigorous lady, and a mother of two children. She has been sewing clothes for the past eight years. She sews in her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons.

She will use this to increase revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 37 years old; she has been working from home as a tailor for many years, and is proud to be contributing to her household income. 

When she was not working, her family was going through a severe financial crisis which compelled her to use her sewing skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family; due to limited resources, none of their four children were sent to school. Zahida felt obligated to change her family’s living standards, and started working from home. 

She is a brave woman, and her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but now she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. 

Zahida has now requesting a loan for PKR 25,000; it will be used to purchase a new sewing machine, with some spools of thread in different colors. 

She dreams of providing a good and standard lifestyle to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, with some spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen has expertise in embroidery, and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over ten years. She started this line of work at a very young age; during the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. 

Today she is proud to be famous in her community for being the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. 

To cope with the increasing, timely demand of her customers, she has requested another loan for Rs. 35,000 to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of the latest beads and pearls in various colors. 

She says the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time, and satisfying them is a challenge that she has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of the latest beads and pearls in various colors.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 42-year-old married woman, and a mother of seven children. She is a vigorous lady, and for past eight years has been running a business selling clothing with her husband (the man shown in the picture). They buy clothing of different fabrics from the wholesale market at lower rates, and then sell them to the people of their community. They have a varied customer base, and are able to earn enough through this business. 

Shehnaz is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs to attract more customers. 

She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and plans to spend the part of profits on the betterment of family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 39-year-old married woman; she has been doing a business of goat purchase and sales on a small scale for the past four years. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life, and her business is good enough to lead a decent life. 

She is a mother of three children; all are school-going, and she is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing.  This is her fourth year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business through its support. 

Robina has requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy three more baby goats. 

She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in the business.

loans.use: to buy three more baby goats.

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en:
Saleema is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (the man shown in the photo), who assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. 

Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and make enough to meet their household expenses. 

Currently, Saleema has requested a loan of Rs. 50,000 to buy a stock of rice, flour, and grains to meet the increasing demand of customers. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, flour, and grains.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is a 27-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Zubaida is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Zameeda Group

texts.en:
Since 2009, Zameeda has operated her fruit shop with her husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 30 years old and lives with her three sons and one daughter.  

As part of a three-person lending group, Zameeda has requested a loan from KIVA's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a separate fruit shop for her husband. 

With the loan amount she will buy another fruit shop in the central bazaar for her husband.  It will allow her to offer a more confident life to her family and increase her sales and income.

She is very hard-working and honest woman, and she is confident about her family’s bright future.

loans.use: to buy a fruit shop for her husband

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is a 55-year-old widowed woman.
 
Her daughter has been doing embroidery work through machine at home to support her family. In fact her sons are doing jobs in different firms but their incomes are not sufficient to afford the household expenses. Her daughter has become expert in embroidery through machine but a few days ago her machine became out of order due to her continuous working. Now her daughter wants to buy a new embroidery machine to continue her business. Therefore, Bilqees requested a loan to buy an embroidery machine so that her daughter could sew more embroidered dresses to sell and grow income.
 
She is a mother of two daughters and four sons and is motivated to provide good clothes and education for her family. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Fehmida's Group

texts.en:
Fehmida is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and equally responsible for all of them. 

She belongs to the ultra poor family that is why she cannot afford the educational expenses of all her children. One of her sons goes to the primary school. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides the services of welding. He also provides door to door services to his customers. Due to increase in the iron’s prices he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods etc to carry on his business.
To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise he needs some capital to buy welding material.  

Fehmida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to buy welding material to carry on his business. 

She is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy welding material for manufacturing.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 47-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been sewing clothes at home for the past 5 years to support her family. Her husband does work away from home and does not come back home for months, so she has to wait for the cash to meet household expenses. Her brother lives with her to look after her family; her brother is doing a job of sewing clothes in a garment factory. Her brother has been bringing some clothes to home for her, so that she could sew clothes and earn some money. Few days ago her sewing machine broke down. Now she does not have a sewing machine to sew the clothes.

She is a mother of eight children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with household expenses, she requested a loan to purchase a machine for sewing clothes. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide quality education for her children.
She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for tailoring business.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling welding materials 8 years ago. 

Tahira is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods, and welding rods, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Tahira hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods, and welding rods.

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya is a 53-year-old, married woman, living with her eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, with good education, food and clothing.

Her husband performs his all duties regarding milk selling very well. He uses a part of the unsold milk for making yogurt, butter and cheese, and for his family's consumption. He has a few head of cattle that provide him with milk, which he sells to earn money. He needs the loan to purchase another dairy cow, which will increase milk production and increase profits for his family. Inflation is increasing day by day and his family's needs, too.

Therefore, Suriya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will provide the loan funds to her husband, so that he could buy a cow for getting more milk to sell. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in the lives of their beloved family members. Suriya says "thank you," to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a 46-year-old, married woman, who lives with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a general store at home; he has allotted a portion of his house for the general store. One of his drawing rooms opens toward the front side of the street, and he is using that room for general store. He offers many items, such as rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. He has been running this business for many years and feeding his family in a good manner. 

His shop is situated under the street, and this is the reason only a few customers are attracted toward the shop. Because of this, he decided to move the general store toward the market. His children are growing up, but there is not enough space left at home for their privacy, so the store needs to leave that drawing room. But he does not have funds to hire a shop, to open the general store in another place.

Therefore, Azra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will provide the loan funds to her husband, to enable him to hire the new shop, for moving the general store toward the market. She praises for this cooperation, and says thanks to, Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To hire a shop and move the general store out of her house and closer to the market

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran, age 35, is a housewife. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is a barber by profession. He owns a barber shop in the market. This business is the only source of income for the family.

Nazeeran is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase things for the barber shop, including combs, hair coloring, a chair, and a mirror. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Nazeeran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders, and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase things for the barber shop, including combs, hair coloring, a chair, and a mirror.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 49-year-old, married woman, living alongside her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, with good education, food and clothing.

Since many years her husband has been successfully running a business of milk selling, in his locality. Over time, he has become well-known in the area, for providing good-quality milk. He also sells butter and cheese, to generate an extra amount of profit. He has to spend the maximum part of his income for fodder to feed his cattle. He gets milk two times in a day. He has three buffaloes at home, which are very few for getting enough milk to sell.
 
For the growth of the business, Razia wants to buy another buffalo for getting more milk to sell. But she does not have enough money to buy a buffalo. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan for her husband to buy another buffalo, for getting more milk. Razia hopes to get an increase in the production of milk, which ultimately will help in generating more money. Razia says "thank you," to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo, for getting more milk to sell.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is a 36-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Shabana has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable price. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 48; she is married, living with her husband and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. She owns a small business of clothing at home. She purchases clothes from the market at low price and sells at high price in her community. The ladies of town like her garments collection and selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her for her efforts. Now that the winter season is going to start, she wants to buy the clothes of winter season to sell. But she does not have funds due to household expenses.  

She requested a loan so that she could buy clothes of winter season to fulfill client demand. She wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream is to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy winter weather clothing to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 54 years old. She lives with her spouse and eight children in her own home. For the past 15 years she has had a business selling grocery items at home. She started the business at the prompting of her husband. She manages the store, where they sell various household accessories. She is very busy with their business. She charges fair prices for the merchandise. As with any business it is necessary to invest in merchandise so that the store is well stocked and attracts customers. For this reason she would like to stock her store. This is her first loan, and she is thankful for the financial support that she receives in order to get ahead. She promises to make her payments on time. She is requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can buy inventory for her general store.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima belongs to an ultra poor family. She got married more than 5 years ago. At the time of getting married, her husband did not have an occupation that earned enough to afford the responsibility of a single family. Her husband has been manufacturing for many years and now has become an experienced person in his profession. He started a blacksmith business. He had enough funds to cover raw materials, but the welding plant is still remaining to be purchased.
 
One member of BRAC lives in Saima's neighborhood. This neighbor suggested that Saima join and referred her to take a loan from BRAC. Saima contacted BRAC Pakistan for financial support. She took her first loan for her husband. She hopes that this business will work successfully. Her husband will purchase the reaming welding plant so that he can run his business smoothly. 

Saima says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new welding plant for manufacturing.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses. Now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shumaila has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and provide some engine maintenance needed for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services for his passengers. 

Shumaila is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tires and to pay for engine maintenance of her Auto Rickshaw.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly and he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he is finding it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Kaneez has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Kaneez is so thankful to Kiva!

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Nadia Araceli

texts.en:
Nadia is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story. Nadia is 35 years old. She has been divorced for several years and has one small child who is her greatest priority.  She has been a merchant for the last 6 years.  Several years ago she decided to become independent from her husband so she opened a gym.  At her gym she teaches Zumba dance and sells merchandise such as sportswear. She believes that through her project it is possible to help people to find physical and mental health.  

Nadia will use this loan to purchase merchandise such as mesotherapy cream and tennis shoes.  She likes to make her payments on time because she knows that if she is responsible she will have more loan opportunities in the future. Nadia has generated enough resources to raise her child. She thinks that this loan is an opportunity to grow her business and to obtain new clients and financial stability. Her biggest accomplishments in life are to obtain the love and respect of her child, to own a car, to have a lot of clients and to maintain her valued friendships.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as mesotherapy cream and tennis shoes that she will sell at her gym.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Rosa Maria is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story. 

Rosa Maria has 49 years old and has been working for the last 25 years. She only completed elementary school. She started selling different items such as shoes and clothes door to door. Four years ago, she decided to open a food stall were she sells what she calls giant tortas (sandwiches). Rosa Maria says that her biggest accomplishments have been sending her kids to school, buying a piece of land and building a home.

loans.use: to buy and refurbish appliances for her food stall

loans.name: Radjendre

texts.en:
Radjendre is 57 years old and lives with his wife and a school-going child. His three elder children already left home and are well settled. 

Radjendre works as a watchman at night, and during the day, he works for rice farmers with his tractor, which he bought with a loan from Seva MFI. Recently he repaid this loan back to Seva. Now, he decided to cultivate rice as well. For that he needs a loan of 8,000 SRD [Surinam dollars] to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. He hopes to save enough to build his own house and live a decent life with his wife and child.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Wellington

texts.en:
Wellington lives and works in Shimba Hills, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers  in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families. 

Wellington is married, and has six children. His wife and he have been farming for twenty-three years, and are currently growing mangoes and oranges on their land. Wellington is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because his bees will help pollinate his crops, increasing their quality and yield. 

This is Wellington’s first loan, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to buy even more hives. His hope for the future is “to train the youth in beekeeping.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony lives and works in a town called Lunga Lunga, close to the Tanzanian border. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Anthony is married and has five children. Both he and his wife have been farming for thirty-six years, and are currently growing passion fruit on their land. Anthony is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper, as his hives will receive dedicated service and allow him to gather income from their honey. 

This is Anthony’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to help build a family house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari lives and works in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Omari is married, and has five children. He farms their family land, while his wife works as a teacher in a local school. Omari has been farming for nine years, and is currently tending to an orange plantation on their land. 

This is Omari’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to invest some of the income from his beehives in a motorcycle that will allow him and his family to get around the area easier. Omari’s hope for the future is to save up enough money to build a new family house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfall makes farming difficult and contributes to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food -- wild mangrove forests and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives. 

Josephine is married and has two children. Her husband works as a poultry farmer, raising quail, while she tends to their home and raises their children. Josephine has been farming for nine years and is currently growing oranges and maize on their land. She is happy to start beekeeping because it will give her family honey to eat, which will help their health. 

This is Josephine’s first loan with Kiva and she plans to use the income from her hives to expand the cultivated land on her farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson lives in a town called Lunga Lunga, close to the Tanzanian border. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Jackson is married and has six children. Both he and his wife have been farming for 25 years, and are currently growing maize and passion fruit on their land. Jackson thinks beekeeping is a smart business because it “is good utilization of natural forest.” 

This is Jackson’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to invest the income generated by his beehives in a bigger passion fruit plantation.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Atia

texts.en:
Atia is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a painter by profession. He belongs to a poor family. 

Atia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to purchase variety of paints, brushes, and whitewash etc. This is very important for him to continue his work. Atia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of paints, brushes, and whitewash etc.

loans.name: Selmith

texts.en:
Selmith is 26 years old and comes from Mbeere. She is a single mother of two and has been a committed volunteer in maternal health with her community, organized by a local religious organization. She also sells water in order to supplement her daily needs. Selmith is keen to see that health information reaches as many people as possible in her dry and remote area of Mbeere.  She is also passionate to see that her children have food and will not miss the chance to go to school due to poverty.  Selmith is keen to see that she generates some income in order to perform her community calling to the best of her capacity.  “Once I get the loan from Kiva, I plan to buy a motorcycle which I will use for my community outreach work and also as a taxi in order to generate income for my two children,” says Muthoni. 

She also plans to mobilize other single mothers into social groups for ease of accessing support for their income generating activities and to create a forum for discussing health and self-empowerment opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to support community health work

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es una señora muy emprendedora de 54 años de edad, casada, y madre de  7 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, ella vive con su esposo, uno de sus hijos, la nuera y su pequeña nieta. Ella actualmente está cursando su primer año de escuela siente la necesidad de hacerlo ya que en su niñez no pudo estudiar porque sus padres no contaban con los recursos económicos para apoyarla en su educación.
Dora desde hace 25 años  se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo al cultivo de café, maíz y frijoles por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia en esta actividad. Todas las mañanas junto a su esposo recorren 20 minutos en una cuatrimoto que con mucho esfuerzo adquirieron para llegar a  su finca ya que son carreteras que en esta época se deterioran por la lluvia. Juntos trabajan con muchas ganas y distribuyen su tiempo para preparar su terreno y sembrar las plantas de café que planean comprar con el financiamiento que solicitan, también abonan y cuidan la parte cultivada de café que ya tienen, con el afán de obtener una excelente cosecha y poder vender a los intermediarios que llegan a la localidad donde está ubicada su finca.
Por lo que  ella necesita financiamiento para la compra de 4,500 plantas de café para resembrar una parte de su finca que está deteriorada y pagar mano de obra para tener su finca en excelentes condiciones.
Dora sueña en un futuro que su finca sea sostenible ya que ella y su esposo son personas adultas y necesitan mejorar la economía de su hogar, por lo que siguen luchando para hacer crecer su finca sembrando y cultivando café de calidad, dándole el mantenimiento adecuado.
Además a su edad anhela cursar al menos la primaria completa ya que las circunstancias no se lo permitieron en su niñez y así sentirse orgullosa y un día contarles a sus nietos que en la vida todo es posible si se lucha por lo que una desea.
texts.en:
Dora is a very enterprising 54-year-old woman. She is married and has seven adult children. She lives with her husband, one of her sons, her daughter in law, and her little granddaughter. She is currently attending her first year of school. She feels a need to do so because she wasn't able to go to school as a child, since her parents didn't have the financial resources to support her in her education.

Dora has been farming with her husband for 25 years. They grow coffee, corn, and beans, so she has a lot of experience in this business. Every morning she and her husband travel to their land, a twenty-minute ride away, on the quad the acquired with much effort, because in in this time of year the roads are deteriorated by the rain. They put a lot of effort into their work and dedicate time to prepare their land and plant the coffee plants they plan to purchase  with the loan they are requesting. They also fertilize and tend to the coffee plants that are already growing, in hopes of obtaining an excellent harvest to sell to the distributors that come to the town where their farm is located.

She needs this loan to buy 4,500 coffee plants to replant a damaged area of their farm and to pay for labor to keep her farm in excellent condition.

Dora's dream is for her farm to be sustainable, because she and her husband are older and need to improve their household finances. That is why they keep fighting to expand their farm by planting and growing quality coffee, and properly tending to their plants.

In spite of her age she wants to complete at least primary school, because circumstances didn't allow her to do so in her childhood. This would make her feel proud and enable her to one day tell her grandchildren that everything is possible in life when you fight for what you want.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants for her farm.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una señora muy trabajadora de 59 años de edad, soltera y madre de  9 hijos, ella vive con su hija menor que depende económicamente de ella, un hijo y su esposa. El grado educativo de su hija menor es secundaria, no ha podido continuar sus estudios porque sus ingresos no alcanzan para seguir apoyándola. En su hogar todos trabajan juntos en la misma actividad del café.
Antonia desde hace 35 años se dedica a la agricultura, ella aprendió de sus padres ya que ellos fueron quienes le enseñaron esta actividad, luego continuo con su compañero de hogar trabajando en la agricultura y ahora ella tiene 6 años de hacerlo independientemente por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia en esta actividad. Muy cerca de su hogar a escasos 10 minutos todas las mañanas en compañía de sus  hijos y su nuera trabajan arduamente para cuidar y limpiar sus cultivos por lo que se sienten muy contentos de trabajar juntos y así evitar los costos de mano de obra, juntos se esfuerzan y esperan vender a un excelente precio su cosecha a los intermediarios que llegan a su localidad y tiene la confianza que su condición de vida mejore. 
Por lo que  ella necesita financiamiento para la compra de 3,500 plantas de café para sembrar una manzana de su finca que no está cultivada y que no lo han hecho por falta de capital de trabajo.
Antonia sueña en un futuro ampliar su finca, cultivando todo el terreno que con mucho esfuerzo ha adquirido para sacar adelante a su hija que todavía no ha culminado sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos ya que ella como madre anhela que su hija termine la universidad. Además espera que mejore la condición de vida de su hogar que hasta el momento ha sido de mucha carencia y limitaciones.
texts.en:
Antonia is a hardworking 59 year old woman.  She is single and the mother of 9 children.  She lives with with her younger daughter who is dependent on her economically, her son and his wife.  

Her younger daughter has reached secondary education but could not continue her studies because their income did not allow for further support. In the home, they all work together growing coffee.  Since she was 35 years old, Antonia has worked in agriculture.  She learned from her parents because they introduced her to the activity.  Later, she continued working with her life partner, and now she has done this independently for 6 years.  She has a lot of experience in this area.  

With the company of her children, she goes 10 minutes away every morning to work hard taking care of and cleaning the crops.  They are very happy to work together and in this way they can avoid labor costs.  Together they hope to sell their crops at an excellent price to the intermediaries that come to their area.  She has confidence that her lifestyle will improve.  

For this, she needs a loan to buy 3,500 coffee plants.  She will sow one part of the farm that was not already cultivated, because they did not have enough working capital. 

Her dream is to expand her farm, cultivating all the land that they acquired with a great deal of effort, and to help her daughter culminate her studies. She hopes that her daughter can finish college as a result of more economic resources. She also hopes to improve the condition of life in her home because so far it has been limited.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants to plant on her farm

loans.name: Mujeres Del Triunfo (Women Of Victory) Group

texts.en:
The nine women of this group live in the small village of El Triunfo in the municipality of San Antonio Suchitepéquez, Guatemala.  This is a very poor part of the country, where 70% of the people live in poverty and about 25% live in extreme poverty.  The village got its name years ago when the indigenous inhabitants triumphed over foreign investors who wanted to take their land.

This group was formed when the women heard about Namaste Guatemaya from a former client and contacted them to ask for support with their businesses.  With Namaste they receive business education and are aided by a business adviser who helps them develop and follow a business plan.  The Mujeres del Triunfo are excited about this opportunity to improve their businesses, their lives, and the lives of their families.

One of these hard-working women is Josefa (3rd from right).  She is 36 years old, and is married with three children.  Her business is selling clothing that she sews.  When she started the business she had some money to invest.  Since then she has had some difficulties; she has been robbed of a substantial sum of money, has been injured, and has had some serious health issues.  Her medical care used up all her family's resources and she and her husband ended up in debt to a loan shark.  

Now her business is on a solid footing and she is paying off the debt.  She plans to use her loan to bulk buy fabric and materials for the clothing she makes.  Currently she works 300 hours a month and has a monthly profit of about Q7,890 (US $1024).  She hopes at the end of her nine months with Namaste to increase her profit to Q9,223 (US $1197).

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials in bulk to make and sell clothing

location.town: El Triunfo, San Antonio Suchitepequez, Suchitepequ

loans.name: Dadirai

texts.en:
Dadirai is 30 years old and married with three children. She lives in Chikomba West district. Dadirai volunteers in schools as a Cama Community Health Trainer spreading health information to school children and her community members. She is currently running a market gardening business which she started in 2012 after she realised that it just wasn’t enough to teach people about health. She wanted to help them eat healthy foods and live healthy lives as well. 

The business has also allowed her to pay school fees for two of her children and provide food for her family. She sells various types of vegetables such as 'covo', rape, onions, tomatoes, spinach, cassava, sweet potatoes and carrots in her community. 

Dadirai sees a good opportunity to grow her business. There are no fruit and vegetable shops in her area, so she dreams of opening her own shop to meet the needs of her community.  She even hopes to hire employees.  This Kiva loan will give her a chance to  take her enterprise to the next level.

loans.use: to purchase more inputs for her garden

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is a 29 year old woman and a mother of one. She is married and currently lives in the Binga District of Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a Community Health Development Officer. She is a passionate woman who cares about the health and welfare of her community. Beauty is currently operating her own clothing shop where she  sells men’s and women’s clothes, such as T-shirts, jeans, shirts, jackets and jerseys at a flea market at Siansundu business centre. She started this business in 2012 because she wanted to provide for her child and improve her living standards. She did not want to depend solely on her husband, and for this reason she decided to start buying small bales of second hand clothes and selling them to the rural community at an affordable price.  Now she sells new clothes at a local flea market. 

Beauty intends to use the Kiva loan to increase her stock of T-shirts, jeans, shirts, jackets, jerseys and shoes. She has employed one sales person to assist her in her business because her hope is to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for shop

loans.name: Delta

texts.en:
Delta is 35 years old and lives in Chikomba West district in Zimbabwe. She is married with three children. She is a committed volunteer in her community, actively helping to keep children in school. 

She runs a family business she started with her husband in 2011. She raises chickens and sells them to the community. She is currently producing about 200 broiler chickens every six weeks. She loves her business and hopes to expand it. 

The Kiva loan will assist her in purchasing chicken feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will help her to increase profits to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed and increase her poultry production

loans.name: Bvumai

texts.en:
Bvumai is a 29 year-old widow and a mother of three. She lives in  the Nyami-nyami District of northern Zimbabe. Bvumai is a Cama Community Health Trainer devoted to helping her community fight against HIV and AIDS as well as poverty. She is renting a stall at a flea market where she sells shoes, skirts, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, jeans and lady’s tops. She has been running the business for four years and has managed to support her family. Bvumai started the business when her husband died. He had been the bread winner in the family. The business has enabled her to provide for her children’s needs as well as pay for school fees for two of her children. 

With the Kiva loan, Bvumai plans on increasing her stock of clothing to increase her sales volumes. An improvement in the business means she will be able to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 31 year old young woman. She is married with two children.  She lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe.  She is a Cama Community Health Trainer working with schools in her community.  Over the last two years, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 200 broiler birds every 6 weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2011 when her family started facing financial difficulties.  

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Sylvia would very much like to increase her sales volumes and become a supplier to major super markets such as TM and Spar. Sylvia will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for her two children and her two cousins and put them through school.

loans.use: To purchase chick feed and increase her poultry production

loans.name: Dadirai

texts.en:
Dadirai lives in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She is 21 years old and married with one child. 

She is a committed leader and was elected as the Cama District chairperson to represent young women in her rural community as they seek economic empowerment.  

Dadirai is currently renting a stall at a local flea market and selling products such as second-hand shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, baby clothes, and floor polish to the community. She has been running this business for 18 months now, and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Dadirai plans to purchase a bale of clothes from Mozambique to increase her stock. 

Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to secure her child’s education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Marble

texts.en:
Marble is a 23-year-old single young woman. She currently lives in  the Mashonaland Central District of Zimbabwe  where she runs a dressmaking business. She makes and sells a variety of products such as uniforms, duvet covers, clothes, toilet sets and drapery in Chifombo. She studied fashion and fabrics at school and how she could turn her knowledge and skills into a business after she finished school. She is very passionate about the business and determined to expand it. 

With the Kiva loan, Marble will expand her business and open her own clothing shop.  She intends to use the loan to purchase materials such as fabric, sewing needles for her machine, a mannequin and thread. She is passionate about creating employment in her rural community. By improving her business she will be able to provide for her family and improve their living standard.

loans.use: To purchase more inputs for dressmaking

loans.name: Shumirai

texts.en:
Shumirai is 29 years old and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is married with one child. Shumirai is a Cama Community Health Trainer working with schools in her community to improve children’s wellbeing. She sells both new and second-hand clothes for a living. She sells mainly shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets at the local market. She started the business in 2011 after her child was born. She really loves her business and would like to increase her sales volume and expand the business. 

Shumirai is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase a large bale of clothes and shoes to increase her stock. She intends to use the proceeds to improve her living standards and through the expansion of the business, create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a large bale of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Pesacla

texts.en:
Pesacla is a 24-year-old business woman and the mother of one child. She lives in Mbire district, Zimbabwe. Pesacla is a well-known volunteer in her community who works to keep children in school. 

She owns and runs a flea market stand at the local business centre, where she sells clothing accessories and shoes. She started the business in 2010 when she was married and started facing financial difficulties.  Currently, Pescala’s profits barely meet her family’s needs.  

With a Kiva loan, Pescala can purchase large bales of clothing to increase her stock and expand her business and profits. This will enable her to provide for her child’s needs as well as for herself. 

She hopes to someday be able grow the business and create employment in her community.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothing

loans.name: Sibongumusa

texts.en:
Sibongumusa is a 24-year-old young business woman. She is a single mother of one child, and lives in the Umguza district of Zimbabwe. She currently buys and sells new and second-hand clothes. She sells clothing, such as jackets, shirts, and shoes at her local flea market. She started the business when she finished high school, and it enabled her to assist her family when they encountered financial difficulties. 

Sibongumusa plans to use Kiva loan to purchase a bale of clothes. This will boost her business tremendously and increase her clientele, since purchasing a bale means she will have a variety of products to offer.

She loves her business and dreams of opening a boutique. The business has enabled her to support her two-year-old child, as well as two cousins and two nieces. She intends to use the profits to pay for her dependent's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Oomnath

texts.en: Oomnath has been cultivating rice since his youth. He has a family with three children and his father to care for. Rice cultivation is their only source of income. Oomnath received several loans from Seva MFI that were all well repaid. With the profits of last season, he bought a secondhand tractor to produce more efficiently. He needs a new loan of 10,000 SRD [Surinam dollars] to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Mahendre

texts.en: Mahendre is 31 years old and lives with his aging parents. Mahendre works as a part-time bus driver for a company that transports schoolchildren. The income from this job is not enough to take good care of himself and his parents. His parents are retired and Mahendre inherited their rice areas. With the support of Seva MFI, he started cultivating rice. He became a dedicated farmer and to date has repaid his loans fully. He hopes to save enough to start a family in the near future. He asks for a new loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Satiesh

texts.en:
Satiesh is a 31-year-old and has a family with two children. He is a rice farmer on land that he leased from others. 

In order to take good care of his family, he needed to earn more income; that’s why he increased his rice areas with the support of Seva MFI. He has already repaid the money he borrowed from Seva MFI. 

Satiesh recently inherited a residential plot from his grandfather and wants to build a house on it through the profits from his rice production. He asked Seva MFI to support his rice production and applied for a loan of SRD 8,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Manodj

texts.en:
Manodj works as a part-time truck driver, and besides that he does rice cultivation on leased land. To make ends meet, he even works on the rice farms of others. 

Manodj has to work hard for his four children to enable them to finish school and to give them a good future. For this, with the support of Seva MFI, he has expanded his rice areas and repaid his loans on time. 

He applied for a new loan of SRD 10,000 (Surinamese dollars) to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Soekhdew

texts.en:
Soekhdew is 39 years old and has a family with three children. He works hard and does rice cultivation. To make ends meet for his family, he also works for other rice farmers as a field worker and occasionally even does fishing. 

With the support of Seva MFI, he bought his tractor and expanded his rice areas. His loans are repaid fully. 

He applied for a new loan of SRD 10,000 (Surinamese dollars) to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Manoedj

texts.en:
Manoedj is 23 years old, married and has one childr. He lives with his parents. His whole family is involved in rice cultivation, the only source of income for the whole family. He plants independently on leased land

Manoedj is requesting another loan from of Seva MFI for 11,000 SRD,which he will use to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice production.  In the future, he would like to save for his own house and rice plots.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Marvelous

texts.en: Marvellous is 25 years old, married and the mother of two children. In her community in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe, she runs a general store where she sell various products such as clothes, groceries and farming equipment. She is also the National Chairperson of the Cama network, which serves all of Zimbabwe. She started her business in 2008 after finishing high school, and it has allowed her to provide for her family and pay her children’s school fees. Marvellous is requesting this loan to expand the stock of clothes, groceries and farming equipment she has to sell. She hopes to secure a stable source of income to sustain her family and ensure that her children complete school because she appreciates the value of education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Shambadzirai

texts.en:
Shambadzirai is 29 years old and a mother of three. She lives in the Gokwe North District of Zimabwe.  Through her affiliation with the Cama network, she volunteers as a Community Health Trainer and works with at-risk children in school. She helps the children to stay healthy and encourages them to complete their education. In addition, she provides for her family through buying and selling of different products, such as clothes, hair relaxers, shoes, soap, rice and salt. She sells her products from her home, but sometimes she also sells from door-to-door.  Shambadzirai dreams of opening her own store. 

She intends to use the Kiva loan to open the store and to stock it up with products, such as clothes, hair relaxers, shoes, soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, bread, shoe polish, snacks and cotton wool. The shop will be the only one in her area, and it will mean an increase in business. This will enable her to enroll her three children in a good school and to improve their current living standard.

loans.use: To purchase more general store inventory

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 35 years old, married and a mother of three. She lives in the Chalala fishing camp in Nyami-nyami District on the Zambezi River in Zimbabwe. Sheila is an entrepreneur working with other young women in her rural community, encouraging them to be economically independent. She supports her family by selling fish such as dried kapenta (a small, sardine-like fish) and dried bream in nearby towns.  She started her business in 2006 when she started facing financial difficulties and it has enabled her to support her family and provide for their basic needs. 

Sheila knows there is a high demand for the fish she sells. With this Kiva loan, she plans to purchase additional stock of fish in bulk from fisheries. This will help boost her profits and will help her to raise enough money to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Tinyiko

texts.en:
Tinyiko is single, 28 years old and lives in Mwenezi district of Zimbabwe. Tinyiko is an enthusiastic volunteer in her community who helps to mentor young women in entrepreneurship. She has been running businesses since 2005. From her rented stall in the local village, she sells shirts, shorts and ladies' tops, as well as shoes. 

With this Kiva loan, Tinyiko plans to expand the size and range of merchandise to expand her business and increase her profits. She hopes to open her own shop. The additional income will help her to support four children who are dependent upon her, including paying for her their school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Nohlahla

texts.en:
Nohlahla is a 24-year-old single young woman living in the Umguza District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community as both a Cama Community Health Trainer and an entrepreneur. She started her poultry business in 2011 after noticing an increase in demand for Rhode Island chickens with lean meat. She currently produces about 120 chickens every 6 weeks and sells them to the local customers.  

Nohlahla knows that she could sell more chickens each month, but because all of her income is needed to provide for two children who are dependent upon her, she is unable to spend her current profits to expand her business. With this Kiva loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks, chick feed and organic manure to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her two dependents and keep them in school.

loans.use: To purchase chick feed and increase poultry production

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is a 24-year-old businesswoman, married and living in Lupane. She owns a grocery shop, where she sells foodstuffs such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba, biscuits, sweets and stationery. Queen inspires young women in her community, as both a Cama Community Health Trainer and an entrepreneur.  She has been running her business for four years and has managed to employ two people during that time. 

Queen would like to use this Kiva loan to expand her business, by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability, to better provide for her family’s needs and provide for other, vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Ntombiyomusa

texts.en:
Ntombiyomusa is a 28-year-old single mother of one, currently living in Esigodini, an area in Umzigwane.  She sells cosmetic accessories, jackets, panties, shirts, and shoes at the Mawabeni business centre. 

Ntombiyomusa inspires young women in her community, as both a community health trainer and as an entrepreneur. She started the business in 2012 when she started facing financial difficulties, so that she can provide for her child. 

She intends on using the loan to purchase cosmetic accessories, jackets, panties, shirts, and shoes to increase her stock levels. 

An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Eustine

texts.en: Eustine is 32 years old and married with three children. She currently lives in Hitler Hunzvi, an area in Chikomba West. She has her own stall at a flea market in Hitler Hunzvi. She sells duvet covers, sofa covers, shoes, skirts, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, jeans and lady’s tops.  Eustine inspires school children in her community as a community health trainer and young women as an entrepreneur who is self-reliant and economically independent.  She has been running her business for seven years and has managed to support her family and two other dependents. With the loan, she plans to increase her stock of duvet covers, sofa covers, shoes, skirts, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, jeans and lady’s tops, which will increase her sales volumes. This will allow her to pay school fees for four dependents.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Ulither

texts.en: Ulither is 30 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives in Rochdale, an area in Nyanga district. She earns a living by selling cell phones, electrical appliances, and shoes. Ulither inspires young women in her community as a community health trainer who volunteers in rural schools in her district disseminating health information. She started her business in 2003 after having worked for her friend and realized that she could start her own business. She really loves her business and would love to expand it. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase more cell phones and electrical appliances such as radios, DVDs, and heaters. The proceeds from the business will help her support her family and put her 2 children through school.

loans.use: to purchase more cell phones and electrical products to sell.

loans.name: Spiwe

texts.en:
Spiwe is a 31-year-old woman who lives in the town of Nyanga. She volunteers at a community hostel for girls who walk long distances to school. She is also a community health trainer who has been volunteering in schools disseminating health information to school children for the past 7 years. 

Spiwe also runs a flea market where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She started her business in 2004 in order to support her 10 siblings, since she is the bread winner. She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business and would like to expand it. The loan will allow her to stock up on jackets, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue with her education and continue to support her ten siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Moddie

texts.en: Moddie is a 24-year-old young woman who lives in the town of Murambinda in Buhera district. She is a single mother of one and an aspiring entrepreneur. She is running a home-based hair salon. She started this business when she was 22 years old when her child was born. She acquired training and experience from working in her friend’s hair salon at Murambinda growth point. She wanted to be financially independent in order to support herself and her child. She inspires young women in her community as both a community health trainer and an entrepreneur. She would like to move the business to the growth point and increase her clientele base. The loan will enable her to open her own hair salon and purchase a hair dryer, rollers, Seramic iron or tongs, and hair products needed in her salon. Her hope is to provide for her family and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 24 years old, married with 2 children. She currently lives in Nyamutora, a township in Hurungwe. She operates a small barber shop in the township which she started in 2003 with her husband. She offers services such as hair plaiting and haircuts, but also sells hair products such as weaves, braids, hairs oils, hair sprays, dyes, hair nutrients and hair pins. The business has enabled her to support 2 dependents. With her passion for her work and a growing number of clients, she would like to expand her business. She has become a role model in a her community in that young women look up to her for support in starting small businesses and encouragement. She intends to use the loan to purchase weaves, braids, hairs oils, hair sprays, dyes, hair nutrients and hair pins to increase her stocks, as well as electric scissors, a sterilizer and shampoo. This will enable her to improve her current standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more hair products for her salon

loans.name: Fungisai

texts.en:
Fungisai is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives in Siyakobvu, an area in Nyami-nyami, where she buys and sells eggs, dried kapenta (fish), fruits, and vegetables.  She  also volunteers in schools in her village as a Community Health Trainer. 

She wants to increase her sales volume and expand her business. The loan will enable her to purchase more eggs, dried kapenta, fruit, and vegetables from the local fisheries and farms to increase her sales. She hopes to enroll her children in a good school and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Angella

texts.en: Angela is a 28-year-old single mother with two children aged 7 and 3.  She works hard to provide not only for them, but also for her parents and siblings. She sells adult and children’s clothing (jackets, shoes, and underwear) out of her home to her community members. Angela inspires young women in her community as both a community health trainer and an entrepreneur. She started the business in 2012 and hopes to get the loan so as to expand her business. She intends to use the loan to rent a shop in Harare city centre. This will increase her clientele base and give her business a fixed location since it is currently a mobile business. Additional profits will help her meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: To rent a shop in town

loans.name: Esnath

texts.en:
Esnath is a 25-year-old farmer currently living in Marondera. She is married and the mother of one child. 

She started her business when she got married, and it has been running for two years. Her husband owns a small plot of land where she farms potatoes and sells them in Marondera and in Harare. 

Esnath inspires young women in her community to take up farming as a business. She is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase farming equipment, such as irrigation pipes, a pump, potato seeds, and herbicides. 

She really loves farming and hopes to become a well-established and recognised supplier of potatoes. When the business expands, she will use the returns to cater to her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment and supplies

loans.name: Sibusisiwe

texts.en:
Sibusisiwe lives in Maphisa, a village in Matobo district. She is married with 1 child and 2 dependents. She is currently engaged in market gardening, providing a wide range and steady supply of fresh produce such as vegetables, tomatoes and onions throughout the local growing season. She sells her produce at the Maphisa growth point. She has been running this business for 8 months and has managed to employ 1 person. This business has enabled her to support her family.  She intends to purchase inputs for her business such as seeds, herbicide, pesticide and manure. Her hope is to grow the business and open a fruit and vegetable shop and improve her current living standards. 

Sibusisiwe also volunteers as a Community Health Trainer who disseminates health information to school children and remote communities.

loans.use: To purchase more inputs such as seeds, herbicide, pesticide and manure.

loans.name: Perpetual S

texts.en:
Perpetual is a 32-year-old mother of one. She currently lives in Mt Darwin where she operates her sewing business. She makes throw-overs, duvet covers, curtains and chair covers. She started her business when she realized that she was pregnant and had to raise her child alone and she thought that it was better doing something she loved to earn a living. Her business has been running for three years. She sells these to her local community near Karuyana Primary School. 

Perpetual has inspired many young single mothers in her community to see that it is possible to take care of yourself and your child on your own and not cry and wallow in self pity because the father of the child is refusing to take up his responsibility and support his child. She intends to use the loan to purchase sewing material and one overlocking sewing machine. She hopes to expand her business and open a shop to showcase and sell her products. She wants to use the proceeds from the business to pay for school fees for her sister’s daughter, who she is currently taking care of, as well as save for the education of her own daughter.

loans.use: To purchase sewing material and one overlocking sewing machine

loans.name: Privilege

texts.en:
Privilege is 22 years old and married; she lives in Mt. Darwin. 

She has a business where she sells clothing and accessories, such as jackets, shirts, shorts, skirts, jerseys, and trousers, in Mt. Darwin township. She has managed to satisfy her family’s needs during the 10 months she has been running the business. 

The loan will enable her to increase her stock and thus expand her business. An increase in profits would see her business expanding, making her desire to create employment in her community a reality.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothing

loans.name: Chipo F

texts.en:
Chipo is 28 years-old, and married with one child. She is currently a teacher at Gumbonzvanda High School in Wedza District, Zimbabwe. 

Chipo desires to supplement her income and help provide for her child. She raises chickens and sells them to fellow teachers and community members. She started the business in 2011 when she realised that poultry production is a lucrative business opportunity. She loves her business so much that she wants to expand it and supply boarding schools in her community with fresh chickens. 

She inspires young women in her community as both a community health trainer and an entrepreneur. She intends to use the loan to purchase baby chicks and chick feed. She hopes to improve her current living standards and enrol her child in a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more feed and stock.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 30-year-old widow and a mother of one. She lives in Nyanga where she is currently operating a clothing shop in Nyamhuka. She sells T-shirts, blouses, shorts, trousers, dresses, lady’s suits and shoes to provide for herself and her child. She started the business in 2008 when her husband died. He was the breadwinner in the family and when he passed away, she started facing financial difficulties. She acquired a piece of land from her in-laws, which she is now using for her business. This business has enabled her to enroll her child in a good school and care for her old parents. She hopes to increase her stock with the loan and to expand her business to the nearest big business center, which will mean big business for her. This will enable her to have a steady income to support herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Abdiqadir Ismacil

texts.en: Abdiqadir Ismacil is 33 years old. He works as an IT technician at the University of Hargeisa. He needs a laptop for his work. He requested a laptop from Kaaba as a loan and now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan and he will make monthly repayments. Abdiqadir hopes to improve his IT technician skills when he gets the laptop and wants to download valuable software and video tutorials.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for work purposes

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim is a 45-year-old married Iraqi. He has five children. Rahim has a shop where he sells house and kitchen supplies. With this limited source of income, he managed to cover his family's expenses and his children's school expenses. Every year the family faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the study year for the additional expenses that are needed to cover study fees and books. With this loan now, Rahim can accommodate all these expenses for his son Murtadha and still cover the other expenses from his income.
 
Rahim is requesting a loan to pay for his son's school fees and other study expenses. Murtadha dreams of finishing school and university and finding a good job to help his family.
 
The story of Murtadha is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients that are able to get a better education.

loans.use: to pay for his son's school fees.

loans.name: Adilet

texts.en:
Adilet is a student of AUCA and here is his story.
“Every person has a lot of information in their head, some of it is known from their own experience and some from well-written resources. We develop our skills by mastering knowledge. Studying any information in detail to determine for ourselves what is now and what will happen in the future. As for me, every step is thought by myself. 
I decided to enroll at AUCA, Department of Journalism and Mass Communication. My ambition in this direction had not formed in the last year, where I studied. I was a student of New Generation Academy of AUCA. The past year has given me more motivation than I had previously had. AUCA is the best place for the development of skills. The main emphasis is that the university gives you freedom of any initiative. During my studies, I realized a few ideas and shared them with my fellow students. One was to set up an initiative group called “Media Group”, which is engaged in the dissemination of information about our academy and work on development of the command system. The group work was fertile, for which we were awarded at the end of the year. Of course, the success of this group was the effort of the entire team, but I would like to mention that it was all happening within AUCA. Now I am very happy to have been a student of AUCA, JMC department. Another opportunity that AUCA gives to every student is a Kiva loan. It is what can make dreams come true. 
I am applying for the loan as I have financial difficulties and am not able to cover my tuition fees fully.”

loans.use: To pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Aitolkun

texts.en:
Aitolkun is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Anthropology, and here is her story:

“I grew up without realizing much that good quality education determines ones’ chances in life and access to things. I opened up many things for myself once I finished high school and started to face existing structures in our society. I finished high school last year, and because of my relatively low educational background, I could not enter AUCA. 

I decided to prepare well to be able to apply the year after. During my preparations, I took classes in Anthropology. It allowed me to learn so many things about myself while reading articles about various cultures, family structures, and other social institutions. I could see and feel how gradually I started to change, and I want to breed these changes in my life. 

I believe that Anthropology will let me understand my society, as well as broaden societies we are connected with more in-depth. I hope to grow through the walls of AUCA, stand on my own feet, and be one of the contributors to the development of my society.

As all other students of AUCA, I have a very unique opportunity to apply for a Kiva loan, which will allow me to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Mustafe Mahdi

texts.en:
Mustafe Mahdi is 21 years old. He finished Admas university college, faculty of Information Technology. He needs a laptop to create IT programs. He develops databases to Local NGOs and companies. He used his laptop, but unfortunately, the laptop is not working and was damaged. He cannot pay for the laptop all at one time. He approached Kaaba MFI, and Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. 

Mustafe hopes to improve his IT skills as he has the laptop.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for work purposes.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a student of the University of Central Asia in the department of Anthropology. Below is her story.

“I finished New Generation Academy at AUCA this year, which I am very proud of. To accomplish my goals in my life, it is necessary for me to overreach an education after my preparatory program at this university. I think that AUCA is the right place to acquire a high level education. Since my childhood, I have been interested in diversity among people and cultures and I developed a great passion to learn about them. Therefore, I enrolled in the department of Anthropology. Studying in the department will give me an opportunity to express what I want to do and where I want to be in my life. My ability to know new things and use them to my advantage will surely be beneficial in furthering my education and career. I believe that if I study hard, stay focused and strive for what I believe, I will be rewarded greatly. I strongly believe that one day I will achieve my goals and reach my dreams. 
AUCA gives a unique opportunity to all the students providing them with a loan. I would like to apply for a Kiva loan, which will give an opportunity to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for her tuition.fees

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en:
Nazim is a student of the American University of Central Asia, Department of Anthropology. Here is his story:

“AUCA has been giving the best education for students who really want to study and get the best education. The Anthropology Department is the best choice for students who are interested in history and archeological and historical facts. AUCA is a great place to both study and practice. Because practice is an integral and very important part of learning in all sectors, it facilitates the acquisition of skills. All conditions which are given to the students of AUCA are to make the studies more interesting and easy. 

AUCA also gives financial aid to its students, which is a Kiva loan. I would like to take the opportunity and apply for it. The loan will enable me to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Nafisakhan

texts.en:
Nafisakhan is a student at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Anthropology. Here is her story:

“Anthropology is the science where students learn about religion, economics, society, politics, art, etc. There are not enough specialists in the field of anthropology in our society. I have lots of plans for the future, and the most important is to finish AUCA, Department of Anthropology. I am happy to become part of such a great university, where I will get a high quality education and will be able to contribute to the development of my country.
