I would also like to mention that AUCA not only educates its students at the top level, but also gives them financial support, so that they could make their dreams come true. I also want to apply for the loan and cover my tuition fees. The loan is given by Kiva.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Dmitrii-Victor

texts.en:
Dmitry-Victor is a student of AUCA, department of Applied Mathematics and Informatics. Here is his story.

“Applied mathematics and informatics there are 2 keywords, which I excreted. In high school I always studied hard mathematics and informatics, because I really like it. So I decided to choose applied mathematics and informatics to expand my knowledge of these subjects, to deepen my knowledge. But that is not the only reason. The other reason is to improve myself in ways my future faculty may offer me – logical thinking, programming skills. This choice of mine gives me a lot of opportunities in the future. With logical thinking, good knowing of all mathematics aspects I will be able to work not only as a programmer, but as a teacher or accountant. In general, I can choose any profession related to mathematics or informatics. By choosing this faculty I won’t meet such problems in future, as low level of employment or low salary. Studying this subject gives me a lot of improvements in myself, which is going to help not only my job, but in my life also. 

I cannot imagine my life without mathematics. Everywhere I go – I use mathematics, even when I’m driving or just walking, because it is interesting. But the level of my knowledge is not enough for me. 

I think I made the right decision enrolling the American University of Central Asia. I will achieve my goals, studying here. AUCA gives lots of great opportunities to its student, which one cannot get in any other university of our country. One of those is financial support. AUCA gives financial support to each student. Therefore I would like to take an opportunity and apply for Kiva loan. It will help me to cover my tuition fees and become who I want to.”

loans.use: To cover his higher education fees.

loans.name: Basira

texts.en:
Basira is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia (AUCA), department of Anthropology. Below is her story.

“The choice of profession is an important choice in one’s life. Because whatever activity people do in their life must bring them joy, satisfaction, and advantage. One has to know that our profession must give us a result that will contribute to the development of our society. 

"The choice of a university is, therefore, important too. The American University of Central Asia is the best university that can give me a quality education and, most importantly, here I will learn using my knowledge. 

"Anthropology is the field of my choice. Anthropology is a profession that will open lots of new perspectives and opportunities to me, as well as achieving my goals. My main goal is to contribute to the development of my country. 

"AUCA also gives an opportunity to cover tuition fees of the students, which is a Kiva loan. I have limited resources to cover my tuition. Therefore, I am applying for a Kiva loan, so that I could pay for my higher education here at AUCA.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Gaini

texts.en:
Gaini is a first-year student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration. This is her story.

"Finishing school is the beginning of the new independent life for millions of school leavers. The new world full of excellent prospects and opportunities, never seen before is open in front of them. 

But a great responsibility lies on graduates. Because of the decisions they will have to make for their future. It is easy to get lost in the great diversity of universities. I have chosen AUCA. Competition has become more and more drastic and a prestigious job will attract hundreds of candidates to apply. Only those who have a good educational background can get good job. AUCA is the best university in Central Asia. 

Graduates of AUCA have more opportunities than graduates of other universities. The approach of professors and the system of education is very different from other universities. Students really enjoy spending time at the university. Here students are given an opportunity to grow, prepare for future independent life, learn to think creatively and communicate with representatives of other nationalities and cultures. 

I passed an annual training in New Generation Academy at AUCA, which allowed me to acquire knowledge required for admission to AUCA. Among other opportunities that AUCA gives to students, one of most important is financial support. All AUCA students are eligible to apply for financial support, which is very helpful to them. I would like to take an opportunity and apply for a Kiva loan that will help me to cover my tuition fees."

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration, and here is her story:

“There are lots of people in our country that have to leave the country because of unemployment so that they can be able to earn enough money to keep their families. I do not want to be one of them, therefore, I studied hard since my childhood. I had a dream to have a magic wand, which would solve all problems connected with money. When I got older, I understood that the magic wand of a person is high education and choosing the right job.

Choosing the right university was not hard for me because I knew what I wanted to do in future. I wanted to have a business that will help me increase the financial conditions of my family, also a workplace where people can work and don’t need to leave their families. Since my childhood, I wanted to be an economist, because I think that an economist is a person who can decide every problem connected with money. However, after researching, I got confused between economics and business administration.

I studied at New Generation Academy at AUCA last year, and participated in Teenagers in Free Enterprise (TIFE), where I was the class leader. I thought an economist could be a businessman, but while studying at NGA, I understood that this is a different thing. TIFE was a great experience for me, and helped me make the right choice. After all this, I am sure I made a right choice enrolling in the Business Administration department. 

AUCA gives another unique opportunity to its students, which is a Kiva loan. I would like to apply for a Kiva loan, which will greatly help me cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in the Jalpaiguri district of Magurmari. Her husband is 39 years old, and by profession he is a carpenter. Sabitri has taken a loan to purchase a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products like ghee, paneer, etc. 

Sabitri has received education up to class VIII (grade 8), and her husband up to class V (grade 5). Sabitri is now a mother of two children who are both receiving education. The elder one is in class VII (grade 7), and the younger one in class IV (grade 4). 

Sabitri dreams that one day her children will be established and will have a bright future. The things that Sabitri couldn’t have received during her childhood, she dreams to give to her children. For this reason, she has started her own business so that both Sabitri and her husband together can go forward with their dreams. They are really thankful to BJS for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Gulajan

texts.en:
Gulajan is a 35-year-old married woman, and her husband is 40 years old. Gulajan has received education up to class V (grade 5), and her husband has received education up to class VIII (grade 8). Gulajan is a mother of two children. The elder one is in class XII (grade 12), and the younger one is in class V (grade 5). 

Gulajan lives in a small village in Dhupguri. Her husband is a businessman, but not a successful businessman. Due to lack of capital, there were no means to purchase things for their business. Moreover, both children are going for higher education, so bearing all the cost along with daily requirements was becoming too difficult for them. 

Then Gulajan thought to do something so that everything works fine. She came to learn about BJS and the loans that BJS offers, so she plans to buy goats so she can sell milk and milk products to the market. Gulajan has purchased the goats in the hope that the family can have a bright future and can overcome all the hazards.

loans.use: to purchase goats for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Laili

texts.en:
Laili is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. The eldest one goes to school in class VII (grade 7). Her husband is 35 years old. Laili has received education up to class V (grade 5), and her husband has received education up to class VIII (grade 8). 

Laili lives in the small town of Dhupguri. Both Laili and her husband run a jute business. They make different jute items like bags and home decoration items. Jute items depend on the quality of the jute. Good-quality jute has a high cost, and the selling of good-quality jute is also high, as it looks very decent. So, both Laili and her husband have planned to make jute items with good-quality jute. 

Thus, Liali has applied to BJS for a loan so that they can purchase good-quality jute and sell the items in the market. With the help of the BJS money, they hope to expand their business to sell more jute items in the market. 

Laili also dreams to give a good future to her children, and with the profit that they will have, she will build a Pakka house (made of bricks and cement) of her own.

loans.use: to buy materials for making jute crafts.

loans.name: Prembala

texts.en:
Prembala is a 39-year-old woman with two children. Her husband is 45 years old, and both of them have passed class VI (grade 6). Her husband has a computer shop and sells computer accessories. Prembala’s elder child goes to class VII (grade 7).  

The earnings from selling computer accessories are not enough to run a family. According to Prembala, sometimes it becomes very difficult to arrange for sufficient food for three meals each day. Then she thought to do something on her own, but to do something, she needs capital. Then she came to know about BJS and has taken a loan to cultivate vegetables on a plot of land and sell the vegetables at the market. 

She dreams to cultivate more of a variety of vegetables in the field with the profit money. She is thankful to BJS for helping her.

loans.use: to buy seeds for vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Saheba

texts.en:
Saheba is a 22-year-old married woman. Her husband is 25 years old. Saheba is the mother of only one child, who reads in class I (grade 1). She lives in the small town of Dhupguri. 

Saheba is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer. Saheba wants to help her husband in his potato cultivation and in expansion of their family business. The field in which she is standing is currently used for rice, but will be used for potato cultivation after the rice crop is finished. 

Saheba always wanted to be with her husband in every respect so that their family runs smoothly and their child is not affected by poverty and ignorance. They always wish to give their best to their child. For this reason, they have taken a loan from BJS so that they can go ahead with their future. They are thankful to BJS.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Reginaldo

texts.en:
Reginaldo is 31 years old. When he was 13 years old, he started working with locksmiths, and he liked it a lot. For that reason, he always studies the job and wants to improve his work day by day.

He worked at another locksmith's business for a long time, but his dream is to have his own business. Unfortunately, when he was 22 years old he suffered an accident and was in a wheelchair for some time. Since that moment his family (parents, wife and his young child) have been very important for financial and emotional support.

This loan is to buy a welding machine, a drill and a sanding machine to start his own business and fulfill his dream of being a locksmith.

He appreciates the help of all.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine, a drill and a sanding machine.

loans.name: Maycon Douglas

texts.en:
Maycon, 18 years old, has a beautiful, sorrowful and inspiring story. When he was a child he was abandoned by his parents. He has lived a difficult infancy because he lived in many houses, with many people (his uncles, grandfather, and grandmother, for example).

When he was 16 years old he was adopted by his uncle, because the uncle wanted to give him an education, help him learn a profession, provide better quality of life and care for Maycon.

Now, Maycon has a profession: industrial painter. Maycon is a good lad, he has a girlfriend and is a very responsible worker. This loan is to start his own industrial painting business. He will use the money to buy an air compressor and a paint gun.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor and a paint gun of high production.

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald is a first time borrower of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. (MDI), and he is applying for a loan of three million shillings (3,000,000). 

He is married with two children.  Donald rents in Entebbe near the airport where he has a cattle fattening business.  He is also a public servant and works with the Entebbe air forces. 

Donald says he has a ready market for his cattle and he is projecting demand to be high mainly during the Christmas season.  He is hampered by inadequate capital so he is applying for a loan in order to buy more cattle to fatten which he hopes will be ready to sell by that time so that he will be able to raise more income and won't have to depend on loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Living in Banteay Meanchey province, Phal is 47-years-old and blessed with four children, two schoolchildren and two little kids who are too young for schooling. He earns a living from his occupation as a school teacher. To supplement the family’s income, his wife sells desserts in school.  Phal is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is now seeking a loan in order to cover his school fees as he wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Law. He hopes to get a good job after graduation so that he can support his family and especially so he can keep his children in school.

loans.use: to cover his school fees.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Ou Chrov Dristrict

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem is a rural villager from Kampong Speu Province's Borset District where crop farming is a popular business in the neighborhood. She is 59-years-old and has six children, two of whom are still in school. Rem is a rice farmer and has been doing this for 41 years. Rem is able to save up to three US dollars per day from her current business after deducting the expenses. 

This is Rem’s fifth-cycle loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The previous business loans, which she successfully repaid, helped her to sustain her living conditions as well as gradually helping her business. In this loan cycle, she is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fees for four years for her son. Rem very much hopes that this loan will enable her to send her son to university. This will also help her son to obtain a higher education background so that he can get a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fees for four years.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is 46-years-old and blessed with six children, two of whom still rely on her as they are in school. To struggle for a living, she does rice farming on a two hectare area as the main source of her income with the support from her husband. It is the business that she has had for 28 years. This is the first loan for Mom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Therefore, she will spend her entire loan to cover the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to continue her studies in order to obtain a bachelor degree majoring in Finance and Banking.

loans.use: to cover the tuition fees for her daughter .

location.town: Prey Veng province, Bar Phnom district

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives in Montserrado County in the capital city of Liberia, which is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She 36 years old and single with two children, aged 9 and 17 years old. The children are in school and live at home. 

For the past year, Gloria has been selling charcoal at the community market. She started this business with help from her mother, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends eight hours per day on her business, and she uses the bus most of the time to get her goods to her shop. She is a business-minded person and likes her business because it gives her more profit. 

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to expand her sales. She wants to get more money and live a good life.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to expand her sales.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a third time borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI) and she is applying for a loan of 600,000/=. 

She operates a small bar on Kamwokya-Mawanda road, one of the outskirts of Kampala city where she also lives.  Annet says this has enabled her to take care of her family. Her major challenge is inadequate stock in her small bar but she is constrained by financial inability so that is why she is applying for the loan. Her future plans are to work hard, to increase her bar stock and move to a better location that is more strategic.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is 42 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. Abdurazzok is her husband. They have three children they love very much named Abdumanon, Khursheda ,and Abdy. They live together in a big house.

Aziza sells children's clothes. She stores her merchandise in a local market and acquires her goods in shopping centers in the city. She makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. She began working this way over 11 years ago because she needed to earn money. Currently, her partner helps her to purchase her merchandise. She is asking for a loan of $3,000 USD to buy children's clothes for increasing working capital.  

This is her second loan with IMON, and she is grateful for its financial support in helping her to realize her plans. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Magsad

texts.en:
Maqsad has been married for 25 years. He is 51-years-old.  He has changed his business and now he is a taxi driver. His family lives in Mahmudlu village of Fuzuli region. For the last 20 years, Maqsad and his family have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land in Fuzuli city.  Maqsad’s wife is a housewife. His four daughters are married. Fikrat’s eldest son got married this year and works as a vendor at the market.  His youngest son studies one course.

He has applied to Kiva partner Komak for a loan. Winter is coming and he needs 650 AZN in order to buy new wheels and an anti-crash chain.  It will be his second loan from Kiva and he is thankful to Komak and Kiva for the loans.  He wants to build a new house in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new wheel, and an anti-crash chain.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.en:
Hortencia is 43 years old and married. She has four children, aged 22, 21,10 and 7 years old, whom she supports. She was introduced to the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology by a KADET officer.

Hortencia has a retail shop. She has been in this business for five years. The business is located in Msoloni.

In her business, she earns a monthly income of 6,100 Kenyan shillings. She is taking her first loan of 20,000 KES, which she intends to use to add stock to her business. She will buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, detergent and toothpaste.

Hortencia will use the anticipated profits to expand her business by making it a wholesale shop. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business and live a better life.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, detergent and toothpaste to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is married and has four children. They both live in a five bedroom apartment house in Bamenda in the Northwest region of Cameroon.  He has faced many challenges in life, including inadequate finances to start up a business of his own and cater for his family's needs, sickness, and death of family members.

With this new loan, he will invest in buying more piglets, fowl, and farming seeds. He holds a positive view of this business succeeding because he has been doing it for a long time and the demand for pigs and fowl is high. In addition, the waste of the fowl and pigs will be used in the farm to increase yield. With this business activity, the community will benefit from pig and fowl waste (manure) which will be used for farming. They will also benefit from the availability of fowl and pigs, which they will buy at moderate prices during occasions such as death celebrations and marriages. 

With the profit from this loan, Lucas will cater for his family's needs, ensure his children's education, expand his poultry and piggery farming, and also save some money to undertake a bigger investment. He prefers loans from GHAPE because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals, as well as the fact that social needs of members are catered for at GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy fowl, piglets, and farming seeds.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en: Joweria is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She has one additional family member (a sister). She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for seven years and works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of  1,700,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, beef, fish, bunches of green bananas, rice, beans, flour and charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to get permanent residence. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, fish, beef, bunches of green bananas, rice, beans, flour and charcoal.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with seven children and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members (a niece and brother). She operates a retail shop from the market and sells her goods to all kinds of people on credit. She has been in this business for two years and works seven days a week.  She gets additional income from selling second-hand clothes. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, beans, rice, flour and  cooking oil. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to also build a residential house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her shop.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, beans, rice, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with two children and all her children go to school. She has one additional family member (a grandmother). She operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables from home. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a credit basis. She has been in business for two years and she works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water and charcoal. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of tomatoes, onions, cabbage, passion fruits, pineapples, and sweet bananas. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler of fruits and to educate her children to university level. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, cabbage, passion fruits, pineapples and sweet bananas.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Abu. He is single and has five children, aged 19, 17, 14, 10 and 9. 

In 1991, Abu established his business selling beer, stout, soft drinks, wine, etc. He is now running a full-time bar. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant and adequately provide for his children’s needs. 

Working six days a week, 12 hours a day, he earns about 2,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leone every month from this business. He would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL to buy some drinks. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1,500,000 SLL. Abu is hardworking and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy some drinks

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is married with six children and four of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop and she sells her goods to all kinds of people on retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for six years and works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bag of sugar, beans, salt, boxes of soap, rice, flour and cooking oil. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked retail shop and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for both the shop and her family.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, beans, salt, boxes of soap, rice, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Sokhen, 30, is married with a school-aged child.  Being a responsible mother and a good homemaker, she puts much effort into managing her household and taking care of her child. She also sells Khmer noodles with soup in her village to help generate income to support her family. She has been in this occupation for nearly six years and earns a net profit of $2.50 per day.

Sokhen would like to buy a house for her family's personal lives because she doesn't have one at present. She has saved money daily for her dream. 

To help her achieve her dream, she has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Cambodian riel to supplement her savings and buy a house to give her family a better place to live. 

In the future, she hopes to get involved in other businesses to earn enough to provide for her family. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she would like to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a house to give her family a better place to live.

loans.name: Namutebi

texts.en: Jane is single with two children and none of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (grand children). She operates a canteen selling samosa, fried cassava, and chapatti.  She has been in this business for 10 years. She works seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 700,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy baking flour, cooking oil, spices, cow peas, a bag of charcoal, and other snacks. Her major business challenges include seasonality, ever increasing prices of baking flour and cooking oil, and defaulters. She aspires to get a fridge to sell soft drinks. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is married with seven children and two of her children go to school. She has no additional family member. She operates a retail shop and sells her goods to all kinds of people on retail. She has been in this business for 3 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from tailoring. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 800,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy sugar, beans, rice, flour, and cooking oil. She aspires to own a wholesale shop and also to buy a plot of land. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with four children, all of whom are in school. She takes care of additional family members (niece). She sells second hand clothes at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for 8 years. She works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her customers to reach out to her, and ever increasing prices of used clothes. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with six children; one of her children goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (grand children). She sells second hand clothes from home on retail basis. She has been in this business for 15 years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and transportation. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes for resale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is married with eight children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She sells local Gin on retail basis. She has been in this business for 15 year. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy jerrycans of local Gin. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to educate her children to university and also to invest in used clothes. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local Gin for resale.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy is married with two children and both her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business of selling rosaries and religious books. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rosaries, bibles, candles, and other religious books. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works in mobile markets and sells on retail basis only six days out of every week. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. She aspires to get a permanent business premise. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more rosaries, bibles, candles and other religious items for resale

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette is married with four children; three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 7 years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. The family resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Chynarkan

texts.ru: Чынаркан 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Чынаркан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чынаркан занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чынаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынаркан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чынаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку авто.
texts.en: Chynarkan is 43, married, and raising 2 children together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and raises livestock for a living, having started 15 years ago with 10,000 somoni worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has 2 dairy cows and 10 sheep on her farm, while her monthly income has grown to roughly 5,000 somoni.  To further develop her farm, she is seeking a loan of 50,000 somoni to buy sheep.  She plans on using any extra money that the loan will allow her to make to save money for a new car.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Devota

texts.en: Devota  is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through selling shoes and running a restaurant. She moves door to door selling used clothes and works seven days out of every week selling on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of getting a permanent business activity. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and  school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Musim

texts.en:
Musim  is married with three children and only one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling GNLD home care products and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cosmetics, syrups, energy drinks, and immune boosters. She generates additional income through working as a teacher.  

She works at the market and at times walks door to door selling home care products. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to get enough profit to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, syrups, energy drinks, and immune boosters.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana de 37 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus cuatro hijos de 20 años, 15 años, 14 años y 6 años de  edad los cuales se encuentran estudiando.  Ana es muy trabajadora y emprendedora que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante. Se dedica desde hace 14 años a la venta de sorbetes (helado de sabores). Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que desea invertir en más producto con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cajas de sorbete, vasos y cucharas para incrementar la venta del mismo y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old and resides in her own home with her four children (ages 20, 15, 14, and 6), all of whom are studying.  She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who tries very hard to help her children get ahead.  Ana has been selling sorbets (flavored ice cream) for 14 years.  This business is her main source of income, so she would like to invest in more products so that she can improve her earnings.  

Ana is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the purchase of cases of sorbet, glasses, and spoons in order to increase her sales and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cases of sorbet, glasses, and spoons.

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is 39 years old, from Nakuru. He is married to Maureen who is a housewife and they are blessed with three children aged 16, 9, and 4 years old.

He is a quarry miner, a business he has been running for the last 15 years, and a loan will enable him to buy quarrying tools like a mason's hammer, a cape, chisels, drills, a wedge plug, and spades.

loans.use: To buy quarrying tools like a mason's hammer, cape, chisels, drills, a wedge plug, and spades to be used by laborers working at his quarry

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
Jhunu, about 40 years old, is the group leader of a four-member group from Burat, M. Rampur, Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. She is running a grocery shop. Her family is comprised of four members including her husband and two sons aged about 22 and 20 years. The member standing first from left with her hand forward is Jhunu. Her husband helps a lot in her business to earn their livelihood. Jhunu is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her efforts.

Jhunu, along with three other members of her village, formed a group and this is her third loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing business.  At present, her family income is Rs 8,500 per month, which is not sufficient to manage her family and to keep pace with the present society.
 
To improve her living conditions and earn some extra income, she wants to take a loan.  With the loan, she will add some grocery items like rice, dal, potatoes, onions, wheat, sugar, tea etc. to her existing business. She has a dream of being a grocery wholesaler in her small town.

The other three members are Satya, Padmini and Tilottama who have a grocery shop, a medicine shop and a TV and Refrigerator repair shop, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase rice, dal, oil, sugar, tea, potatoes, onions, soap, washing powder, etc for the grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of carrots and eggplants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more irish potatoes, beef, cooking oil and sausages

loans.name: Nay

texts.en:
Nay works hard to support her family of 15 members. She is 57 years old and lives with her husband and some children in a rural village in Siem Reap province. Nay helps her husband generate a daily income by running a small store selling miscellaneous products including vegetables. She has been doing this for nearly 10 years. 

As of now, she has requested a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to increase her inventories in her store to satisfy her customers. She will buy sweets, snacks, shampoos, vegetables, etc. In the future, Nay would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sweets, snacks, shampoos, vegetables and other miscellaneous products to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 44 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store like cereals, chocolate drinks, soft drinks, milk, juice, noodles, etc.

Janet has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, chocolate drinks, soft drinks, milk, juice, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like cereals, chocolate drinks, soft drinks, milk, juice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en:
Mamlakat is married and has three children who are 8, 5 and 2 years old. She always wanted to provide them with a good education, and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Mamlakat decided to start a new business with animal husbandry. She studied at the course called "To Get Ahead" of the women's organization and got enough skills about business. She will manage the business alone. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy cattle for organizing a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Kanykei

texts.en:
Kanykei is a student of AUCA, in the department of Anthropology. Here is her story.

“Nowadays, choice of profession plays the main role in one’s life. One should enjoy their job, therefore they should choose the right profession. I am interested in anthropology, because I loved history while studying at high school, and I also love working with people. My studies at New Generation Academy in AUCA greatly impacted my choice. AUCA gives a great opportunity to learn anthropology. The professors are highly qualified. I would also like to study archeology as part of anthropology because it is more about the mode of life and culture of ancient civilizations based on preserved remains of their life existence. Anthropology is also a creative profession, because you need to use your imagination and abstract thinking to recreate the pristine view of the world of the past. My goal is to study humans at physical, psychological and social aspects. 

"Another opportunity that AUCA gives to its students is loans. I would like to apply for Kiva loan, which will help me to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education in anthropology.

loans.name: Bobodavlat

texts.ru: Бободавлат женатый молодой человек в возрасте 29 лет. Он родом из Шахритуса. Бободавлат начинает собственный бизнес по купле и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Для начала он берет кредит, чтобы закупить несколько голов скота. Бободавлат планирует откармливать бычков в течение нескольких месяцев и затем продавать на местном скотном рынке. У Бободавалата в наличии имеется 2 коровы, они использовались для нужд семьи. Но сейчас он  присоединит их к бизнесу. Бободавлат надеется, что его ждет успех!
texts.en: Bobodavlat is a young, married 29-year-old from Shahrituz.  He is in the process of starting up his own cattle-trading business, and is hoping to get a loan to stock up on cattle.  He plans on fattening bull calves over a few months, and then selling them at a local cattle market.  He currently has 2 cows which his family uses for their own needs, but will be using them to help his business get up and running when the time comes, and hopes that his business will be successful.

loans.use: buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 39-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling animals with her husband for past 15 years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

At present, she has one buffalo and two goats. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 25,000 [Pakistani rupees] to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Appolinarie

texts.en: Appolinarie is 47 years old. She is married with six children. She sells empty jerricans and has been in this business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more empty jerricans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more empty jerricans to sell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is in her late forties, and is married with four children. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo Western, a rural area in Sierra Leone. She started her business because she wanted to be independent.  

She has been in this business since she got married, and sells glass cups, knives and food containers within her community. She says that the main problem to her business is improper business location.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Mikha

texts.en:
Mikha is from the village of Orbeli. He is married to Ella and they have two infant children. Mikha is 31 years old, and earns a living through his agricultural business. Specifically, he breeds two cows, a pig and grows walnuts and grapes on the family-owned land. The family lives in poverty and gets small-sized social assistance from the local government. 

In order to generate income and feed their children properly, Mikha and Ella decided to start a clothing trading business in their village. With the loan received from Kiva, Mikha will purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices at the capital city market, and Ella will sell the items with a price mark-up among community members.
 
Since there are not many clothing stores, their business will have a high demand. They will invest the profits in the same business and develop it. The couple will earn additional income and purchase all the things needed for their children. They await your support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothing for starting a new clothing trading business.

loans.name: Wiclif

texts.en:
Wiclif is a 27-year-old married man with two children, aged 4 and 2, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

His main business is selling agricultural produce, which has helped him in supporting his family. His main challenge is unreliable suppliers, while his dreams are to venture into commercial agriculture and educate his children up to the University. Wiclif is requesting a loan to buy rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is 48-years-old and lives at West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and has four children aged between 20 and 30 years old. 

Kumba described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past three years she has been selling soap in the local market. She sells six days a week from 8am to 9pm, and she likes how fast her customers buy from her. She started this business by selling for her mother. She uses a taxi to get her stock.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap for her business. In the future she plans is to build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business.

loans.name: Geghanush

texts.en:
Geghanush is an experienced agronomist from Aknalij village, in Armavir region. She lives with her son and daughter-in-law. 

Geghanush works in the private sector. The salary that she gets is not enough to meet her family's needs. To cover her family's needs, Geghanush is engaged in breeding livestock, including cows, pigs, piglets and hens, and in the cultivation of greens and alfalfa. Her son helps her sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

As their needs are growing day by day, Geghanush needs to expand her agribusiness to be able to effectively meet her family's needs. She needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase wheat seeds, to buy fertilizers, to buy six pigs and to purchase some forage for the livestock. She has previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Geghanush was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Geghanush and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, to buy fertilizers, to buy six pigs and to purchase some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Yervand

texts.en: Yervand is an experienced agronomist from Metsamor village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife and son. To take care of his family's daily needs Yervand is engaged in the cultivation of tomatoes, onions, and greens. His son helps him to sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Yevand needs to make some investments in it. He needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase cellophane and bottles for building a greenhouse, to buy tomato seeds, to purchase some fertilizers, and to make previous credit repayments. Yervand and his family members will highly appreciate the goodwill of lenders and will be thankful to them for helping to collect the loan amount needed.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane and bottles for building a greenhouse, to buy tomato seeds, to purchase some fertilizers, and to make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Odette  est une conseillère du collectif de crédit  « Bon Berger », senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 42 ans  et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est sans emploi, toute, il réalise  parfois de petites commissions sur la vente de parcelles. La cliente est  sociétaire d’un kiosque (une vendeuse de divers).  Elle installe son kiosque  à un point de vente animé de son quartier. Elle commença ses affaires avec  l’assistance de son familier. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 6 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les divers (2sacs de farines, 2 sacs de sucres, 2 sacs de savon Omo, 1 bidon d’huile de table, allumettes, 2 box de bonbons, 2 box de biscuits, 1 casier de Fanta, 1 carton de jus, 1 box de lotion, savon de toilette, etc.). Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et acheter une parcelle.  La vente en crédit et les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The customer, Odette, is an advisor to the "Bon Berger" loan association and a senior entrepreneur who is both experienced and dynamic. She is 42 years old and mother to six children who are all studying. Her husband is unemployed although he sometimes makes small commissions on selling plots of land. The customer is a shareholder/member of a stall (selling a variety of products). Her stall is set up in a lively place in her neighborhood. She began her business with the help of her family. Later on she benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been carrying out this activity for six years. 

This new loan will be used to buy a variety of products (two sacks of flour, two sacks of sugar, two sacks of Omo soap powder, one container of table oil, matches, two boxes of candy, two boxes of biscuits, one crate of Fanta, one carton of juice, one box of lotion, soap, etc.). 

She would like to educate her children, expand her business projects and buy a plot of land. Selling on credit and foreign exhcange losses are the challenges for her business. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for making women who are not able to borrow from banks more autonomous, particularly during this critical period of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products (two sacks of flour, two sacks of sugar, two sacks of Omo soap powder, one container of table oil, matches, two boxes of candy, two boxes of biscuits, one crate of Fanta, one carton of juice, one box of lotion, soap, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lanyon Atchadome Group

texts.fr: Monsieur Yawo né en 1962 est chauffeur de profession. Marié, il a 06 enfants en charge dont 04 scolarisés. En plus de sa première activité, il stocke du maïs pour revendre en cas de pénurie et fait aussi l'élevage des porcins. Il a démarré en 2003 exerce l'activité à Aného(Localité située à environ 50Km de la ville de Lomé) et s'approvisionne à Anfoin(une localité située à 15Km  d'Aného). Il est aidé par 02 personnes et sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Le profit l'aidera à acheter plus de porcins et stocker des sacs de mais. Il espère aussi assurer la santé et la scolarité des enfants. Mr Yawo fait partie d'un groupement dont il est le responsable constitué de femmes et d'hommes. La plupart sont dans le commerce, dans la culture du manioc, piment ... Ils espèrent eux aussi comme leur responsable assurer un bon avenir à leurs enfants tout en rendant pérenne leurs activités.
texts.en:
Yawo was born in 1962 and is a driver by profession. He is married and has six children who are dependants; four of them go to school. Aside from his main activity, he stocks corn for resale during periods where there is a shortage of it, and he also raises pigs. He began his business in 2003 in Aného (a town which lies around 50 km from Lomé) and gets his supplies in Anfoin (a town which is 15km away from Aného). He is helped by two people and is requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy more stock. 

The profit will help him to buy more pigs and stock more sacks of corn. He is also hoping to be able to provide for this children's health and schooling costs. Yawo belongs to and is in charge of a group made up of women and men. The majority of them are traders or growing cassiva, chilis...Like their leader, they also home to ensure a good future for their children, while also maintaining their businesses in the long term.

loans.use: to buy products (second-hand clothing, shoes, rice) and work tools.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a first time borrower from Ugafode microfinance ltd (MDI), applying for a credit facility of five hundred thousand shillings (500,000). He is married with four children with a residential house in Kawempe, a trading centre near Kampala city.  John is a poultry farmer and a motor cycle taxi rider. This has enabled him to make an income to look after his family by providing school fees for his four children who attend school and for other necessities.

John says that he has a ready market for his chicken and eggs, but has inadequate capital to buy poultry feeds which are layers and boilers mash.  Thus he is applying for a loan to solve this. Furthermore, he says he has plans to pay off his loan and apply for subsequent loans to make his poultry business sustainable.

loans.use: To  buy poultry feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and raise them for resale in the market.

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es: María, a sus 46 años, es una mujer casada y madre de 3 hijos. Se dedica a atender su propio negocio, una miscelánea que tiene ubicada en una zona muy comercial del municipio donde reside. Su trayectoria en el sector comercial independiente comenzó debido a las dificultades económicas por las que atravesaba su familia, su primer trabajo como independiente fue con una pequeña chaza ambulante con la que caminaba alrededor de la plaza de mercado poco a poco la demanda de productos fue aumentado, abriéndose paso al crecimiento de su negocio, un tiempo después pudo arrendar un local y allí comenzó a vender ropa, accesorios para el hogar, juguetería y ropa de segunda mano, haciendo de su negocio lo que es hoy en día. Su empuje, empeño y dedicación la impulsan a buscar nuevas posibilidades para salir adelante, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (juguetes, ropa, artículos para el hogar, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse con más variedad de productos para satisfacer la demanda que incrementa en la temporada de navidad que se aproxima; todo esto dará como resultado un incremento en la entrada de recursos económicos con los que continuará apoyando a su esposo para solventar las necesidades del hogar. María seguirá esforzándose para llegar a cumplir el sueño de montar otro negocio en un municipio cercano, para generar mejores ingresos y brindar a su familia una estabilidad económica para disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She runs her own business, a general store located in a very commercial area in the municipality where she lives. She started working as an independent merchant due to economic problems that the family was facing. In her first job as an independent she walked around the market place carrying a portable food stall. Little by little the demand for her products increased and allowed her business to grow. After some time she was able to rent a place where she started selling clothes, kitchen utensils, toys, and second hand clothes. This eventually made her business what it is today. 

Her drive, endeavor, and dedication push her to find new ways to progress. This is why she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy wholesale merchandise such as toys, clothes, kitchen-ware, etc. That way, she will be able to stock her business with a greater variety of products in order to satisfy the increasing demand during the upcoming Christmas season. The result will be an increased income with which she will continue supporting her husband in covering the household expenses. María will continue struggling to achieve her dream of opening another business in a nearby municipality in order to improve her income and offer her family economic stability so that they can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en: Kamo is a farmer from the Metsamor village of the Armavir region. He lives with his wife, daughter and son. With the help of his family members, Kamo is engaged in breeding a livestock of pigs, piglets, hens, and turkeys, and in the cultivation of greens and alfalfa. Kamo knows the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is a very important source of income for the family. As life is getting more expensive with time, it becomes more difficult for Kamo to cover the needs of his family. To be able to more effectively meet the family's needs, Kamo wants to expand his agribusiness a little bit. A loan of USD 3,000 will support him greatly enabling him to purchase cellophane and bottles for building a greenhouse; to buy tomato and cucumber seeds; to purchase fertilizers; and to buy two calves. Kamo and his family members will be grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill and support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane and bottles for building a greenhouse, to buy tomato and cucumber seeds, to purchase fertilizers, and to buy two calves.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is an experienced farmer from the Verin Artashat village of the Ararat region. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and two-year-old grand-daughter. Ruzanna’s son works in the government sector and is currently the main breadwinner for the family. To assist her son in earning a living, Ruzanna is engaged in breeding a livestock of pigs and hens, and in the cultivation of peach, apricot, pears and grapes. The family realizes the agricultural products in the local market. They have a special refrigerator for fruits, where the fruits can remain fresh for a long time.  They keep the fruits in the refrigerator and sell them in winter, when the prices of those fruits are much higher. To continue the agribusiness in a sustainable way and develop it further, Ruzanna needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase a piece of land which she can use for horticulture. She and her family will be grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill in helping them develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land, which she can use for horticulture.

loans.name: Annman

texts.en: Annman is an experienced farmer from the Mkhchyan village of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband. Annman's husband is working in the private sector. She and her husband are engaged in agribusiness for a long time. They have six greenhouses where they cultivate onion and several flowers, and realize those pruducts in the local market. The family is also engaged in the cultivation of peaches and apricots. Agribusiness is an important source of income for the family. Some of their greenhouses are currently in poor conditions and need to be renovated. Annman needs a loan of USD 2,500 to be able to renovate the greenhouses, and to purchase flower seeds. She and her husband highly rely in the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to renovate the greenhouses, and to purchase flower seeds.

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en: Pendo is 32 years old, a female and married. She has four (4) children aged 14, 10, 8 and 4 years old respectively who she supports.  Pendo was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer.  She runs a grocery business which has lasted for three years now which is located at Msoloni.  In her business she earns a monthly income of KSH.8,000. She is taking her first loan of KSH.20,000 which she intends to use in adding stock to her business: vegetables, tomatos, potatos, coconuts and cabbages.  Pendo will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and have a bigger business.

loans.use: To buy stock: vegetables including tomatos, potatos, coconuts and cabbages to sell to her customer.

loans.name: Soknem

texts.en: Soknem lives in the Baray District of Kompong Thom Province. She is 29 years old and married with a lovely child. Presently, she has been running a business of providing a clothes laundering service from her own home. She said that this business allows her to have enough time with her family as she just works from her home. From this, she is able to make approximately USD 5 per day, which goes for her daily meal and other family expenses. To share responsibility for the family, her humble husband is employed as a construction worker and earns a daily wage. A major challenge for her husband is travelling to the workplace, because they don’t have their own motorcycle yet. Hence, her husband must spend for motor-taxi every day. In this regard, she is seeking for a loan to buy a motorbike to facilitate their travelling needs. She is very thankful to all kind lenders who always support her family at the time they are experiencing financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to facilitate their travelling needs.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is 34 years old, male and married.  He has seven  (7) children aged 14, 12, 10, 8, 6, 5 and 3 years old respectively who he supports.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and he sells seafood. He has been in this business for five years which is located at Majenjeni.  In his  business he earns a monthly income of KSH.8,000.  He is taking his first loan of KSH.15,000 which he intends to use in adding stock to his business by buying more seafood.  Evans will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to educate his children and expand his business .

loans.use: To purchase more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Khop

texts.en:
Khop is 45 years old and a widowed mother of three children. They all live with her in a small house in Siem Reap province. She has been in agriculture for years, farming and raising poultry at home. The income generated is barely enough to feed the family, so her oldest daughter helps generate income by working as a paid worker. Every day her daughter must spend money for a motor-taxi to her workplace because they don’t have their own motorcycle yet. To reduce unwanted expenses, she would like to acquire a loan which enables her to buy a motorcycle to fulfill their needs. This will be her second loan cycle with HKL, and the first cycle with Kiva. 

This loan will be a great help for her family. Her dream is to see other children getting a good education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to fulfill their needs.

loans.name: Clara Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora Clara esta reingresando al grupo de crédito Las Caleras, le gusta esta forma de créditos por la unión y solidaridad que existe entre todas las socias y a su vez los créditos les ayudan en sus negocios. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió, de paisajes hermosos gracias a su geografía accidentada, su gente al igual que las socias son mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras que día a día laboran para mejorar su estabilidad económica, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora Clara tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 11, 10, 8 y 5 años que están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora como carpintero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá.
Doña Clara labora desde hace 3 años como empleada privada, trabaja de lunes a viernes en turnos rotativos y en su casa se dedica a la crianza de pollos los que vende en pie o pelados. 
Su crédito lo va a invertir para iniciar con su meta que es tener una tienda y va a comprar víveres. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Clara is returning to the communal bank "Las Caleras".  She likes this type of credit because of the union and solidarity of all its members and the help the loans give to their businesses.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place which enjoys a cool climate, beautiful scenery because of its geographical location, and its people are entrepreneurs and hard workers just like the communal bank members.  They work hard every day to improve economic stability while maintaining the culture and traditions of their villages.

Clara, 30, is married and has four children, ages 11, 10, 8 and 5 who attend school in the city.  Her husband is a carpenter and they lives with her mother as they do not own a home.

For three years Clara has been working for a private company from Monday through Friday on a rotary shift.  At home she raises chickens to sell.

She plans to use the loan to start a grocery store.  Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en: Korpo lives in Sinkor.  She is 43 years old and is married with four children aged between 3 to 18 years old. Only three of her children are in school and live at home. For the past four years she has been selling red oil by the gallon in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending ten hours each day on her business. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and this method of selling is from her mother.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business.  Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Shola

texts.en:
Shola, aged 54, is married and lives in Bala-Bahmanli village of the Füzuli reion with her family. They are internally displaced persons from their native land, Füzuli city, for 20 years. She has three children – two daughters and a son.

She has a few cows. Shola prepared dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt etc) which she sells in the local bazaar to her neighbours and earns some money. Today she needs 1,100 AZN, to repair the stall for her cows which is in danger of falling.  

She is thankfull to Komak and Kiva for their help. She wants to buy a few cows and to increase her business in the future, so that her monthly income will increase and she can help her children to have a good education in the future.

loans.use: to repair her stall.

loans.name: Hawa Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is 56 year-old Hawa.  She is a widow and has one child aged 33 years. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her because she looks after them while attending school in the city as their parents are living in a province where facilities for education is very poor . In 1987, Hawa established her local food stuff business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in providing a livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hour days, she earns about 600, 000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase bags of beans and rice for resale. In the future, Hawa plans to build a dwelling and continue to improve on her business. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of  beans and rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María desde hace 3 años forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Caleras, le gusta esta forma de créditos por la unión y solidaridad de todas las socias quienes se ayudan mutuamente en cada necesidad. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió, de paisajes hermosos gracias a su geografía accidentada, su gente al igual que nuestras socias son mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras que día a día laboran para mejorar su estabilidad económica, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora María tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ah concebido 3 hijos  mayores de edad, dos de ellos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente,  uno de sus hijos está estudiando en la universidad, su esposo no se encuentra en el país ya que a emigrado en busca de mayores oportunidades de trabajo, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.
Doña María se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años y labora de lunes a sábados. Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa para continuar creciendo en esta actividad. Su meta es tener su propia boutique.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the communal bank "Las Caleras" for three years.  She likes this type of credit because of the union and solidarity of all its members and the help the loans give to their businesses. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place which enjoys a cool climate, beautiful scenery because of its geographical location, and its people are entrepreneurs and hard workers just like the communal bank members. They work hard every day to improve economic stability while maintaining the culture and traditions of their villages.

María, 48, is married and has three adult children, two of whom work and help out economically.  One of her children goes to the university.  Her husband emigrated in search of more work opportunities.  The house she lives in is rented.

María has been selling clothing for three years, Monday through Saturday.  She will use the new loan to buy clothing so she can continue with her business.  Her goal is to have her own boutique.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
La Señora María esta en el grupo de crédito Las Caleras desde hace 11 años, tiempo en el que ha consolidado la amistad con todas los miembros del grupo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió, de paisajes hermosos gracias a su geografía accidentada, su gente al igual que nuestras socias son mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras que día a día laboran para mejorar su estabilidad económica, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora María tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ah concebido 3 hijos de 25, 18 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo está en el colegio y su ultima hija estudian en la escuela, su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, la casa en la que vive es de familiares.
Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la crianza de pollos, los que vende de pie o pelados.
 El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en el alimento para los mismos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the communal bank "Las Caleras" for 11 years which has enabled her to make friends with all the members of the group.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place which enjoys a cool climate, beautiful scenery because of its geographical location, and its people are entrepreneurs and hard workers just like the communal bank members. They work hard every day to improve economic stability while maintaining the culture and traditions of their villages.

María, 45, is married and has three children, ages 25, 18 and 8.  Her eldest son works and helps out economically, the second child is in high school and the youngest in elementary school.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic.  They live in a house that belongs to relatives.

María is a homemaker but contributes to the household economy by raising and selling chickens.

She plans to use the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed.  Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Faith In Action Group

texts.en: Bondu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Bondu was born in Tankoro, in eastern Sierra Leone 47 years ago. She is married to a miner and the couple has three children, who are attending primary and secondary schools. Bondu sells market food – rice, cooking oil, beans, flour, groundnuts, etc. and has been doing business for many years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to order more stock for her food market business.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nuevo Amanecer está conformado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por la comunidad de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que goza de hermosos paisajes, verdes campos gracias a la vegetación del sector y los cultivos de su población, su arquitectura es antigua pero con la mezcla de lo moderno. Su gente al igual que las socias quienes son personas amables, gentiles y alegres, dan todo de sí para alcanzar el bienestar de sus familias y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, su mayor orgullo es que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Mercy, se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Nuevo Amanecer, le gusta formar parte de este grupo ya que todas son solidarias y se han consolidado como una familia.
La Señora Mercy tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ah concebido una hija de 3 años, su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de unos familiares.
Doña Mercy se dedica a cuidar de su hija pero para apoyarle a su esposo en la economía de la casa se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cuyes, cerdos y ganado, también se dedica a la agricultura que es para la venta y consumo de su hogar. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes y en el alimento para animales para continuar creciendo en esta actividad. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
Las fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" is comprised of eight women who live in the community of Zhidmad in Cuenca.  It is a place of beautiful scenery and green fields, thanks to the vegetation and crops grown in the village.  The architecture is a mix of old and new.  The local people, just like the communal bank members, are kind, gentle, cheerful people who do all they can for the well-being of their families and to give their children a better future.  Their main source of pride is that they maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

One of the members of the group is Mercy.  This is her fourth loan with her friends and colleagues of the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer".  She enjoys being in the group because all the members are supportive and they have become one big family.

Mercy, 20, is married and has a three-year-old daughter.  Her husband works for a private company and they live in a house with relatives.

Mercy takes care of her daughter but also helps her husband with the household economy by raising animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and cattle.  She also works in agriculture for home consumption and for commerce.

She plans to use the loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed so she can continue with her business.  Her goal is to have her own home.

The small photos are of two members who were unable to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. Julia se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito El Crédito, le gusta esta forma de crédito porque les ayuda a mejorar y crecer en sus negocios. Vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica la misma que le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y mantiene viva la cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres.
La Señora Julia tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes, su esposo labora en el negocio familiar, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.
Doña Julia se dedica al comercio de ropa americana, trabaja de domingo a domingo en su propia boutique, el negocio tiene desde hace 15 años y labora sin horario fijo.
El dinero de su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa. Su meta es de seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is participating in her third loan with her friends and colleagues of the communal bank "El Crédito".  She likes this type of credit because it helps improve and expand her business.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which is known for its architectural beauty and has been designated a World Heritage Site.
