Its people are kind and gentle and maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Julia, 54, is married and has five adult children who are married and live independently.  Her husband works in a family-owned business and they live in a rented house.

Julia sells American clothing and works Sunday to Sunday in her own boutique.  She has been in business for 15 years and does not have a fixed work schedule.

She plans to use the loan to buy clothing.  Her goal is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Shauri

texts.en: Shauri is 27 years old, female and married.She has three children 7, 6 and 2 years old respectively who she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by the Kadet officer and she is a fishmonger. She has been in this business for four years and it is located at Mjanaheri. In her business she earns a monthly income of KES10,000. She is taking her first loan of KES 10,000 which she intends to use to add stock to her business by buying more fish. Shauri will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and live a better life.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббату 43 года. Она с мужем, сыном и дочерью живет в городе Конибодом. Мухаббат решила заняться бизнесом по купле и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Ей в этом бизнесе нравиться то, что она сможет сама контролировать свой бизнес. Она сама будет ухаживать, кормить и поить коров и быков. Муж и сын будут помогать ей по перевозке сена для животных. У них имеется 0,08 га собственного участка орошаемой земли, на которой посеяны огородные культуры и корм для скота. Сейчас у Мухаббат большой запас сена. Она берет кредит, чтобы закупить пару голов крупнорогатого скота и начать деятельность по откорму и продаже скота.
texts.en: Muhabbat is 43 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter in the city of Konibodom.  She has decided to start buying and selling cattle.  She particularly likes this type of professional activity because she will be able to manage her own business.  She will personally take care of her cows and bulls, giving them feed and water.  Her husband and son will provide help, as they will transport hay for the cattle.  Muhabbat's family owns 0.08 hectare of irrigated land on which they grow garden vegetables as well as feed for the animals.  Muhabbat currently has large supplies of hay.  She is taking a loan in order to buy two head of cattle and start fattening and reselling cattle.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin owns Mister Fruit Cup, which he describes as the only “gourmet” fruit cup business offering healthy fast food and snack choices presented creatively.

All his life, Justin has tried to eat healthily and has incorporated fruit cups into his diet. Adding his creative skills, Justin opened his business almost two years ago to benefit his community and is currently searching for a part-time employee.

Before hiring, Justin needed money to fund operations and marketing. After a trip to his credit union, Justin was referred to Accion Texas Inc. for the opportunity to borrow at an immensely lower interest rate. He says the loan will allow him to buy necessary tools to market and produce his dream.

From his South American tropical cup, which is filled with tropical fruits, to the mélange of chocolate-drizzled fruit and berries nestled in a waffle bowl, Justin’s creations aren’t just unusual.  They are art.

Offering a menu of seasonal fruit and an array of toppings, Justin’s fruit cups are made to order and may be accompanied by one of his many fruit drinks. 

Whether it is dessert or a healthy snack you’re craving, Justin’s menu has enough to satisfy any appetite. Check out his website to view the current items on his menu: http://misterfruitcup.com/

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools to market and produce his dream.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn is 37 years old and lives in a rural village of Pursat province. She is in the farming business, primarily growing rice on around two-hectares of farmland. She has a common-law relationship with her spouse and has three children, who are attending school. She has been doing farming since a young age when she helped her parents. 

Phorn aims to see her family living a healthy lifestyle and tries her best to increase their personal hygiene in living. That’s why she has requested a KHR 4,000,000 loan that will enable her to buy materials needed to build a latrine and pay for labor costs. Having a latrine to use in the household, she can promote the family's health and keep her family from spreading pollutants into the surrounding environment. Thanks to lenders for making loans in a program like Kiva via its partners, HKL is able to help low-income people gain access to sanitation and personal hygiene. For this water loan product, HKL has provided Phorn a special interest rate and more suitable loan terms than its general products.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build a latrine and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Kadijatu

texts.en: This is 46-year-old Kadijatu. She is married, and has 3 children aged 26, 18 and 9 years. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her for schooling  In 2009, Kadijatu established her grocery business. She began her business because she wants to develop herself and family. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Kadijatu requires a loan in order to buy more drinks of different kinds for resale. In the future, Kadijatu plans to build a house on her own. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of drinks for resale

loans.name: Binti

texts.en: Binti is 38 years old, a female and married. She has six children; 22, 20, 18, 15, 13 and 8 years old respectively, whom she supports. She runs a grocery business which has lasted for six years now and it is located at Mbuyu wa Kusema. In her business she earns a monthly income of ksh 5,640. Binti was introduced to KADET Ltd by the Kadet officer; she is taking her first loan of ksh 10,000 which she intends to use to add stock to her business: tomatoes, potatoes, coconuts and cabbages. Binti will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and have a bigger business.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock for her store

loans.name: Heriberto Esteban

texts.es: Heriberto de 44 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos de 15 años y 8 años y una hija de 13 años de edad. Para él  y para su esposa lo más importante es que sus hijos estudien y puedan sacar una carrera que les permita tener mejores condiciones de vida. Heriberto es agricultor y desde hace 19 años trabaja como empleado en una finca cerca de su comunidad. Su principal patrimonio es su saca que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir y desea mejorar poco a poco. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dentro de su vivienda para lo cual comprará hierro, ladrillo, cemento, lámina, arena y grava. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y poder dar a su familia mejor condición habitacional.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 44 years old and lives in the house he owns together with his wife and their children, two sons aged 15 and 8 and one daughter aged 13. What matters the most to him and his wife is for their children to study and pursue careers that allow them to improve their living conditions.

Heriberto works in agriculture and is an employee of a property close to his community since 19 years back. His main asset is his house, which he has put a lot of effort into building. He hopes to improve little by little, and is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to build another room in his house. He will buy iron, brick, cement, corrugated steel, sand, and gravel. 

He hopes that he will be able to count on this support so that he can give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy iron, brick, cement, corrugated steel, sand, and gravel to build a room

loans.name: Christiana's Group

texts.en:
This group of three women are from Teshie. The women live in the same neighborhood and share many common activities. They are active in commerce.

The group representative, Christiana, is 34 years old. She is a married woman with one child, a girl. She is very dynamic and serious in her work. She is active in selling ceramic products and has good experience in this area. She is standing to the left in the photograph.

With this new loan she intends to buy one big box of ceramic products to resell to customers, because it works well and she will be able to generate a lot of income.

With her profits she supports her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy one big box of ceramic products to resell to customers.

loans.name: Ya Alimamy

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Ya Alimamy.  She is married and has 4 children aged 30, 28, 26 and 23 years old. She has 2 additional dependents, who are her sales assistants.  In 2003, Ya Alimamy established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband to take care of the home. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,600,000 SLL. Ya Alimamy requires a loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal for resale. In the future, Ya Alimamy plans to purchase two TVC motorbikes for commercial use and to get more income. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of  charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is from Sardarapat village of Armavir region. He lives there with his wife and 82-year-old mother. Near the village where Hamlet and his family live, Hamlet owns a small space where he provides auto repair service to locals. Hamlet has been involved in this activity for more than 35 years. 

Currently because of the high cost of living, Hamlet isn't able to purchase tools and equipment that he needs for providing the service. That's the reason Hamlet has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Hamlet will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing auto repair service

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey comes from Mworora cell and he deals in coffee planting and trade. He is a married man with seven children. Out of the seven children, four of them go to school. He requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 for buying manure for his coffee plantation and some to pay school fees. He hopes to harvest 10 bags of coffee from his own plantation after applying the manure. This will help him continue educating his children with out any problem and also stay in his coffee business. His major challenge is inadequate capital to invest in his coffee trade business and because of the limited piece of land. He is confident this will soon be history.

loans.use: To purchase organic manure

loans.name: Iris Del Rosario

texts.es: Iris de 51 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su familia desde hace 49 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años y es su principal fuente de ingresos. Iris es una mujer muy admirable ya que a pesar de su edad es muy activa y visionaria, siempre está pendiente de buscar oportunidades para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de maíz que es el principal insumo para su negocio y así poder ofrecer las ricas tortillas a un mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Iris is 51 years old and has lived with her family in their own home for 49 years. For ten years she has sold tortillas, which is her main source of income. Iris is described as a person to admire because, despite her age, she is very energetic and has a lot of ambition. Iris is always looking for opportunities to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

Iris is requesting this loan from Kiva and the field partner to buy corn. She says that this is the main ingredient she uses in her business, and she hopes to be able to sell her delicious tortillas to more customers.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last one year. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is a mother of three children; one of her sons also assists her in running this business. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Fina

texts.en:
Fina lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Fina is married and has one child. Both she and her husband have been farming for 6 years. Her husband has been practicing bee keeping and they have a tree plantation. Fina is looking forward to bee keeping as it will generate her good income.

This is Fina’s first loan and she intends to use the income generated from beekeeping to pay college fees for her children. Fina’s hope for the future is to establish a commercial apiary.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Alhassan. He is married, and has 2 children aged 15 and 10 years. In 2000, Alhassan established his transportation business. He began his business because he wants to become self employed and get means to provide support for his family. Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, he earns about 900,000SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000SLL in order to purchase motor vehicle parts to repair his vehicle. In the future, Alhassan plans to become a vehicle dealer and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy is 56 years old. He is married and has five children; three of them are married and the other two are attending school. He, as well as other villagers, is dedicated to his farming business; their common crop is rice. He has about two-hectares of farmland, on which he grows rice seasonally. He has been doing this for years and is able to earn a moderate income to provide his children with their basic needs.

Dy aims to see his family living a healthy lifestyle and tries his best to increase their personal hygiene. He would like to have a latrine in his home because there’s not one yet. Therefore, he has requested a KHR 4,000,000 loan that will enable him to buy materials needed to build a latrine and pay for labor costs. This loan will improve his general living conditions, promote the family's health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. Thanks to lenders making loans through a program like Kiva via its partners, HKL is able to help low-income people gain access to sanitation and personal hygiene. For water loan product, HKL has provided a special interest rate and more suitable loan terms than its general products.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build a latrine and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 50-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk for many years. She has one cow and one buffalo, whose milk she uses for selling to the people of her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Maryam has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. In this way she will be able to grow her sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is 40 years old, a married woman and a mother of four. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past two years. She  knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy a stock of thread along with packs of zippers and buttons in different colors. She expects an increase in her earnings. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread along with packs of zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Gull

texts.en: Gull is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store for a period of about two years. She has good communication skills and counts a good client list. She makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store

loans.name: Marjorie Marisol

texts.es:
La Señora Marjorie se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito El Crédito. Vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica la misma que le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y mantiene viva la cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la unión y compañerismo que existe entre el grupo.
La Señora Marjorie tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos de 19, 16, 14, 12 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda económicamente, dos están en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora en una mecánica, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
A Doña Marjorie le gusta mucho cocinar por lo que se dedica a la venta de viandas, se levanta muy temprano para prepara los alimentos, lleva un año en este negocio, le va muy bien y espera continuar creciendo, trabaja de lunes a viernes. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de víveres. Su meta es de continuar creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
This is Marjorie’s second loan, alongside her friends and fellow members of the El Credito group.  She lives in Cuenca, a city known for its architectural beauty and named as a World Heritage Site.  Its people are friendly, gentile, and maintain the life of culture and traditions of their fathers.  She likes her group because of the unity and camaraderie.

Marjorie is 38 years old, is in a common law marriage and has five children, ages 19, 16, 14, 12, and 8.  Her oldest son works and helps her financially.  Two attend high school and the two youngest attend the local school.  Her husband works as a mechanic and they all live in a rented house.  Majorie likes cooking very much, and sells food.  She gets up very early to prepare the food and has had this business for one year.  Things are going well for her and she expects to continue growing.  She works M-F.

She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients.  Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Gulam  Sughran

texts.en: Gulam Sughran is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She needs to improve her business so she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 32, deals in the business of buying and selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. 

Nasreen has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000. This will help her to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 40 years old, a married woman and a mother of three. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure so she started stitching clothes to support her family for a better future. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support their entire family. Her daughter also assists her in completing orders of her customers on time. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors. It will allow her to complete the orders on time. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 49-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she has requested a loan of Rs 45,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Abida wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 26 years old and single. He lives with his mother, two brothers, sister-in-law, and nephew. Karen is of Armenian origin but his family has lived in Georgia for a long time. The family breeds cattle: three dairy cows and four calves. Karen’s mother produces dairy products for selling as well as for family consumption. 

 The existing funds are not enough for the family of six. In order to generate more income, Karen decided to purchase a second-hand car to use as a taxi. He will transport passengers from his district to the capital city in return for a service fee. The local people mainly use a taxi service to connect with the capital city and Karen’s service will have high demand. A loan of $ 4,000 will help him to start his taxi business. Karen is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure his family members with better living conditions. This loan will be a great support for the family. Karen is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been engaged in the business of milk selling for a period of about five years. By now, she has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 55,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about it. 

Francis is married and has three children. Both he and his wife have been farming for six years, and they currently have an orange plantation. Francis is looking forward to bee keeping as it promises to be a good source of income.

This is Francis’ first loan, and he intends to use the income generated from bee keeping to expand his cultivated land. 

Francis hopes to establish a commercial apiary in the future.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Residing in the Kampong Leng District of Kampong Chnang Province, Kim is 41 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom still depends on her and who is still in school. Kim has struggled to make a living through farming and weaving mats. 

Kim has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, she is applying as a first-time borrower with VisionFund for a loan to pay for the tuition fee for her son. She hopes to keep her son in university until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Leng District

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 32 years old, a female, and married. She has two children, 8 1/2 and 5, who she supports. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer, and she has a retail shop which she sells malimali (household items). She has been in this business for four years; it is located at Ngala phase 5.  She earns a monthly income in her business of ksh. 5,250. 

She is taking her second loan of ksh.40,000, which she intends to use to add stock to her  business by buying buckets, basins, plastic shoes, plates, cups, and sufurias (cooking pots).

Caroline will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by making it into a wholesale shop. 

Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of buckets, basins, plastic shoes, plates, cups, and sufurias to sell to her buyers.

loans.name: Kossar

texts.en:
Kossar is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been running a business selling milk for the past six years, with the support of her husband. 

Kossar has become famous for providing good quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of profit. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her fifth loan cycle, and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

Kossar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her, and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Dorcas is a single mother, and has one child. She has been farming a tree plantation for six years. She is eager to start bee keeping as it will be a good source of honey for domestic use.

This is Dorcas’ first loan. She plans to use the income generated from bee keeping to pay school fees for her child. Dorcas hopes to establish a commercial apiary in future.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Hy

texts.en:
32-year-old Hy works hard every day to help her family get ahead. She is a farmer who works on her own land in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. Her parents taught her as a young girl how to work the land. She grows different crops on the same land based on the season and the demand of the market. 

Her husband contributes his income by working as a baker. Every day her husband must spend money for a motor-taxi to his workplace, because they don’t have their own motorcycle yet. To reduce their unwanted expenses, she would like to acquire a loan which would enable her to buy a motorcycle to meet their needs. This loan will allow them to save enough for their family and help their children in their education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to meet the family's needs.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult, and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food, from a wild mangrove forest and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives. 

Francis is married and has three children. Both he and his wife practice farming, and they currently have a tree plantation. They have been farming for nine years. Francis is looking forward to starting bee keeping, as it will generate him good income.

This is Francis’ first loan with Honey Care, and he intends to use the income generated from bee keeping to expand his cultivated land. 

His hope for the future is to save up money to expand his quail business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
At the age of 30, Salma is a married woman and a mother of one child. She runs a business selling wood which is used for the purpose of furniture making. She offers various types of wood in different sizes, and has become famous by providing good quality wood in her community. Salma operates the machine at home with the help of her husband. She is trying hard to fulfill the needs of her family members.

 It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she has applied for a loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase another wood cutting machine, to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend a part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase another wood cutting machine

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of running a beauty parlor for three years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time, she has established a regular list of customers so that she makes enough to contribute to the family income.

She needs to deal with more customers regularly. To do this, she requires hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the investment of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 37 years old and married.  She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. 

She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not meet the expenses of their household with the educational needs of children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has now requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more reels of thread, along with packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

Shazia expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more thread, along with buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Maphombe, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. 

Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Ruth is widowed and has seven children. She has been farming for 35 years. She is currently growing mangoes on her land, as well as some other food crops such as maize. Ruth is excited to start beekeeping because she wants to "understand the benefits of bees."

This is Ruth's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to buy food. In the future, Ruth hopes to save up enough money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. 

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she is requesting a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her mid 50s, is married and the mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. 

For the last 10 years, she has been running her gari (cassava flour) business, where she works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. She lives in Teshie-Ghana, and this is her sixth loan request. She will use the loan to buy three sacks of gari to resell.
 
Mary used her previous loans to build her gari business gradually and repaid all her loans successfully. She used the profit to help pay school fees and household expenses. She dreams of improving and upgrading her gari business.
 
Mary will take this loan with her colleague, Anita, and they will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of gari to resell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has three children, ages 20,17, and 16 years. 

In 1995, Fatmata established her business selling ladies' shoes and used bags.  She began her business so that she would be self-reliant and not a liability to her husband. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 850,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more ladies' shoes and bags. She hopes that this loan will enabled her to increase her profit by SLL 500,000. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to rent a shop at the heart of the town so she can be accessible to customers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy ladies' shoes and bags.

loans.name: Fata

texts.en:
Fata lives and works in Sinkor.  She is 41 years old and married to house builder. She was in school till the seventh grade. 

Over the past six years, she has been selling pepper, rice, oil, etc., in the local market in order to help her husband with home expenses.  A challenge she faces is the rainy season. She started this business with some money from her husband. She says that earnig some money helps in her home and  makes her happy about her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, etc., for her  business.  She wants to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, etc., for her  business

loans.name: Noemi Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Noemi está en el tercer crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito El Crédito, le gusta esta manera de créditos ya que le da la oportunidad de tener más sociabilidad con sus amigas y vecinas al mismo tiempo que tienen para invertir en sus negocios. Vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica la misma que le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y mantiene viva la cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres.
La Señora Noemi tiene 36 años de edad, está divorciada pero en su unión  conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Noemi labora de domingo a domingo como empleada privada pero en horarios rotativos, pero desde hace 2 años vende cosméticos en su tiempo libre.
Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de oferta ya preparándose para la temporada navideña. Su meta es tener su propio negocio como una cafetería.
texts.en:
This is the third loan that Noemi is taking out alongside her friends and colleagues at the Credit Group. She prefers this type of loan because it gives her the opportunity to socialize with her friends and neighbors while, at the same time, investing in their businesses. 

She lives in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is known for its beautiful architecture, which is why it is a cultural heritage site. Its people are friendly and kind and they keep the culture and traditions of their parents alive. 

Noemi is 36 years old. She is divorced but has two children, aged 16 and 14, from a common law relationship. They currently study in a school in the city. She does not own a home, so she rents. Noemi works from Sunday to Sunday for a company, but her schedule rotates. 

For the past 2 years, she has sold cosmetics in her spare time. She will use this new loan to purchase cosmetics to sell, as she is already preparing for the holiday season. 

Her goal is to establish her own business, such as a cafeteria.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Irfana

texts.en:
Irfana, age 30, is a very talented lady who excels in her work of stitching clothes. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. She has attained regular list of customer, most of whom are her neighbors in the local community. She earns enough to contribute in the family income. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of threads along with packs of zippers and buttons in different colors to meet the increasing demand. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads along with packs of zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Fátima María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades tales como: la artesanía y comercio en general.
Aquí vive la señora Fátima, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 12 y 10 años, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido realiza transporte de personas en una camioneta.
Doña Fátima con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta a las personas que habitan por su sector. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana en las mañanas ya que en las tardes tiene que ayudar a sus hijos en las tareas  de la escuela, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Los productos compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva más de 7 años con esta actividad la cual le da lo necesario para los estudios de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que vive en la casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales Communal bank meets twice a month in the town of Los Corrales, which is just a few minutes from Montecristi. That city has a rich precolonial history, and most people here earn their living making handicrafts or operating retail shops.  

Montecristi is also the home of Doña Fátima, age 35, married, and the mother of three sons, who are 14, 12, and 10. The two older boys are in high school and middle school, and the youngest in elementary school. Doña Fátima's husband works as a chauffeur and transports passengers in a van.  

Doña Fátima wanted to earn her own income and be able to help her husband pay the family's expenses. She works selling a wide variety of clothing door to door to her neighbors. Doña Fátima works four days a week in the morning and has to help her children with their homework in the afternoon. She sells on credit, collecting payment on weekends, and buys clothing in Guayaquil when she needs to replenish inventory. Doña Fátima has sold clothing for seven years, earning the money she needs to pay for her children's education.

This loan is for the purchase of pants, shirts, blouses, and other garments. Doña Fátima has worked with the Los Corrales Communal Bank for five years and is pleased with the benefits the institution provides her. Doña Fátima and her family live in her mother's home, so one of her ambitions is to have her own home.

loans.use: Comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia, age 33, deals in a business of animal sales and purchase. She has been running this business for the past six years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They have five children and make a good amount of income to bear their expenses. One of their children is also shown in the photo.

For the improvement of business, Samia contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to purchase another calf. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. 

They buy animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, bring them up and sell them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Ghulam  Jannat

texts.en:
Ghulam Jannat, age 41, deals in a business of animal sales. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PRK 20,000 to purchase another calf. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg lives in the village of Gandzani with his wife, retired parents, and two children. He is 35 years old. 

Gevorg is running the agricultural business for the family. They own two dairy cows and 30 sheep. Gevorg sells milk and produces cheese, with the sheep milk for selling as well.

He is very hard-working and experienced farmer with a great desire to enlarge his farm and generate more income. He has requested credit to purchase an additional 30 sheep. He will produce more cheese with their milk and increase profits.

In the future, Gevorg plans to reinvest part of the income in his sheep-breeding business for its further development. The other part of the increased income will be used to improve the daily living conditions of the family

loans.use: to purchase 30 more sheep and enlarge his farm

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Khom is married and 56 years old. She has a family of nine members. Four of her children are married and live separately, so only three are living with her and her husband. Their home is located in Bakan district, Pursat province. 

She is a farmer. She owns nearly two hectares of farmland, on which she grows and harvests rice to sell in the markets. Through her hardships, she is able to cover the costs of living and send her children to school. She has been engaged in this occupation since 1980 with the full support from her spouse.

Right now, she is applying for a loan to build a latrine because she doesn't have one for the household yet. Hence, she has requested a KHR 1,200,000 loan that will enable her to buy materials needed to build a latrine and pay for labor costs. This loan will improve their general living conditions, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. Thanks to lenders for distributing their funds in a program like Kiva via its partner, HKL, to help low-income people gain access to sanitation and personal hygiene. For a water loan product, HKL has provided her a special interest rate and more suitable loan terms than for its general products.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build a latrine and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Khumor

texts.ru: Хумор 58-летняя жительница района Яван. Она живет с мужем, тремя сыновьями, дочерью, невесткой и внуками. Ее муж пожилой больной человек и не работает уже. Один сын и разведенная дочь находятся на заработках за пределами страны. Младший сын является студентом. Сама Хумор как свои односельчане занимается выращиванием коров и быков, а также посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Семья Хумора очень большая и обеспечение семьи становится все труднее. Во благо семьи Хумор планирует начать собственный торговый бизнес. Она считает прибыльным делом продажу детской и женской одежды. На свои сбережения Хумор уже приобрела торговую точку. Чтобы закупить товар она обратилась за кредитом. На сумму от кредита он хочет закупить коллекцию осенне-зимней детской и женской одежды. В бизнесе ей будет помогать сын-студент. За покупкой товара в город она будет ездить вместе с ним. Хумор верит в успех бизнеса и заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Khumor is 58 years old and lives in Yavan.  She lives with her husband, her three sons, her daughter, her daughter-in-law and her grandchildren.  Her husband is an elderly man in poor health, who cannot currently work.  One of her sons and a daughter, who is divorced, are working abroad.  Her youngest son is a student.  Khumor, just like most of her neighbors, raises livestock and grows vegetables.  Khumor's family is very large and it is becoming harder to provide for everyone.  To support her family, Khumor is planning to start a retail business.  She considers the sale of children's and women's clothing to be very profitable.  Using her savings, Khumor, had already bought a stall at the market.  

In order to purchase goods for resale, she has asked for a loan.  She wants to use the loan to purchase a collection of fall and winter clothing targeted to children and to women.  In this business, she will receive help from her student son.  They plan to travel to the city together to purchase the merchandise.  Khumor believes in the success of this business and thanks you for your support in advance.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fall and winter clothing to launch her new retail business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 44 years old, a female and married. She has five children aged 18, 15, 13, 10 and 8 years old who she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by the KADET officer and she has a retail shop. She has been in this business for two years and the business is located at Mpeketoni town. In her business she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her third loan of KES 40,000 which she intends to use in adding stock to her  business by buying more clothes and shoes. She repaid her previous loan of KES 25,000 successfully. Catherine will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by making it into a wholesale shop. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to open another business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Zainab.  She is married and has two children aged 12 and 7. In 1996, Zainab established her ladies and school bags business. She began her business because she wanted to be of help to her husband in terms of solving domestic problems. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 750,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy ladies bags. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her profit margin.   In the future, Zainab plans to rent a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy ladies bags

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en: Emmie is a talented businesswoman from Liberia. She attended school up to 10th grade. According to her, she established her business by selling for her oldest sister in the local market then she got some money to start her own business ten years ago. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending ten hours each day on her business selling fresh fish, frozen chicken, pigs feet etc in the local market. She describes herself as a talented businesswoman.  She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish, frozen chicken, pigs feet etc. for her business. Precisely she lives in Sinkor; she is unmarried, and has four children between 1 and 14 years old, three of whom attend school.  Her plan is to build her house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish, frozen chicken, pigs feet etc. for her business.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis vive en la ciudad de Chincha, Luis trabaja como empleado del área de limpieza en una institución de su ciudad, este trabajo es su única fuente de ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, Luis cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Luis está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá solventar los gastos de estudio de sus pequeños hijos y poder realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y poder brindarle a sus hijos las herramientas necesarias para la educación de sus hijos y poder luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the city of Chincha. He works as am employee in the area of cleaning in an institution in his city. This job is his only source of income to be able to get his family ahead. Luis thinks that it is going well for him at his job because he is responsible.  

Luis is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to pay for his young children's education expenses and do some improvements on the house where he lives. In this way, he can improve his quality of life and be able to offer his children the tools they need for their education and fight to make his dream come true: to give his children a profession.

loans.use: to do home improvements.

loans.name: Mosafar

texts.ru:
Мосафар 25 летняя замужняя женщина. У нее один ребенок. Мосафар с семьей живет в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ее муж зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги такси. Сама Мосафар занята в сфере торговли. Вот уже 4 года как Мосафар на рынке города продает женские одежды и сумки. Ей в бизнесе помогает мать. Для развития бизнеса Мосафар собирается обновить ассортимент товара и закупить сезонные одежды. Чтобы реализовать задуманное Мосафар берет кредит для приобретения коллекции осенне-зимней женской одежды и сумок.
   В будущем она хочет расширить бизнес и построить собственный магазин для продажи женской одежды и сумок.
texts.en: Mosafar is a 25 year-old married woman.  She has one child.  Mosafar lives with her family in the city of Qurgan-Tube.  Her husband makes a living as a taxi driver.  Mosafar works in the retail field.  For the last 4 years, Mosafar has been selling women's clothes and handbags at the city market.  She is receiving help with her business from her mother.  In order to advance her business, Mosafar is planning to renew the assortment of her merchandise by purchasing seasonal clothes.  To realize this goal, Mosafar has applied for a loan to purchase a collection of fall and winter clothing for women and handbags.  In the future, she plans to expand her business by building her own store for the sale of these items.

loans.use: to purchase a collection of fall and winter clothing for women and handbags

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim is a 31-year-old married woman with two dependent children. She has a few pieces of land and grows rice to earn a living. She has learned to do this since she was a very young girl living with her parents. Her husband also helps her in the same business to maintain a better production. This couple has been in this business for more than 10 years, and together earn approximately $10 per day.  

Since HKL provides a very special interest rate for water loan product, Sarim was encouraged to build a latrine for the household. For this reason, she has requested a loan of USD 2,000 that will enable her to buy the materials needed to build a latrine, buy latrine accessories and pay for labor costs. This loan will improve her general living conditions, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She thanks lenders for distributing their funds in a program like Kiva via its partners, HKL to help low-income people gain access to sanitation and personal hygiene.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build a latrine, buy latrine accessories and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 33 years old and married.  She has four children 12, 10, 7, and 4 years old, whom she supports.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer, and she is a fish monger. She has been in her business for three years.  It is located at Malindi. In her business, she earns a monthly income of KES 6,750. 

She is taking her second loan of KES 15,000, which she intends to use in adding stock to her business by buying more fish. Her previous loan of KES 10,000, she paid back successfully.

Joyce will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her  hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to expand and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to her cutomers.

loans.name: Caterin Yuliana

texts.es: Caterin proviene de una familia humilde que vivía en un pueblo al sur de la región antioqueña pero, por iniciativa propia, a sus 20 años de edad, decidió trasladarse para la ciudad en busca de nuevas oportunidades para salir adelante; luego de radicarse y con la dificultad para encontrar empleo, se le presentó la opción de crear su propio negocio y fue entonces cuando comenzó con una pequeña sala de internet, poco a poco fue adquiriendo productos de papelería y fue incrementando su clientela y, aprovechando la ventaja de estar ubicada en una zona cercana a un colegio por lo su negocio se fue fortaleciendo y ahora, ofrece también helados, ropa y películas para video juegos generando los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y velar por el bienestar de su hijo de 8 años de edad. Caterin es una mujer pujante, activa y perseverante, siempre está en busca de nuevas opciones para seguir avanzando y, encuentra en un segundo ciclo crediticio la oportunidad de aumentar su capital de trabajo, solicita el dinero para comprar surtido de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, camisas, blusas, camisetas, entre otros), así se abastecerá para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, especialmente en la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, donde sus ingresos tienden a aumentar. De esta manera , Caterin desea seguir luchando con empeño y dedicación para llegar a cumplir su sueño de comprar un local propio en el que pueda ejercer su labor y, generando mayor rentabilidad, comodidad y mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar para ella y su amorosa familia.
texts.en:
Caterin comes from a humble family that lived in a town in southern Antioquia, but decided at age 20 to move to the city in search of opportunity to improve her life. After settling there and struggling to find work, Caterin had the chance to start her own business, opening a small internet cafe, then gradually acquiring paper goods and adding customers. Caterin is fortunate that her shop is located near a high school, which has helped the business. She now also sells ice cream, clothing, films, and video games, earning enough income to help her husband meet the household budget while caring for their eight-year-old son.  

Caterin is an ambitious, dynamic, and persistent woman who is always looking for new opportunities to get ahead. This is her second loan and affords her the chance to increase her working capital. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase sufficient wholesale inventory (jeans, shirts, blouses, jerseys, and other garments), to meet her customers' demand. This is especially important with the Christmas holiday season approaching, when her customers tend to have more income to spend. Caterin thus hopes to keep striving with commitment and determination to meet her ambition of purchasing her own site for her business. She also hopes to boost her income and improve quality of life and living conditions for her and her loving family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise (jeans, shirts, blouses, jerseys, and other garments)

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en:
Pathani is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education. She with her husband (the man shown in the photo) has been doing work of agriculture for many years. They grow various vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, Pathani applied for a loan of PKR 35,000. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately help in generating more cash. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Bebe

texts.en:
Bebe lives at Sinkor in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 23 year old and single with a 3-year old child who is in school and lives at home. 

Over the past year, she has been running a table market where she sells cosmetics. She started this business with help from her older brother and learned this way of selling from him. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics for her business. She wants to get more money to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Hendrica

texts.en:
Hendrica lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passionfruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Hendrica is single, and has been farming for four years. She is currently tending to a tree plantation on her land, and hopes to expand her crops soon. Hendrica is excited to start beekeeping, as it will give her good, natural honey for use at home.

This is Hendrica's first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her beehives to buy even more beehives. In the future, Hendrica hopes to grow her beekeeping business significantly.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, a sus 58 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que surgió de la necesidad de adquirir recursos económicos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar, pues no tiene hijos que le colaboren económicamente y sólo vive con su esposa quien le colabora atendiendo el negocio. Allí trabaja todos los días desde las 7:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm, ofrece todo tipo de productos de la canasta familiar y además distribuye insumos y productos desechables para negocios de comidas rápidas, así genera los ingresos para el sustento diario. El titular se caracteriza por ser un hombre pujante, organizado y trabajador, aún sin importar su edad él manifiesta que se siente productivo y útil. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (lácteos, cárnicos, productos desechables, huevos, pan, entre otros), esto le  ayudará a aumentar la variedad en sus inventarios y satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus compradores, lo que le permite ser más competitivo en el mercado local. Esto se verá reflejado en el aumento de sus ingresos con los que podrá continuar sustentando a su familia y seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de ampliar la tienda y aumentar el portafolio de productos para ofrecer, generando mejor rentabilidad para sus finanzas personales, con la que quiere garantizar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y disfrutar una vejez más tranquila al lado de su amada esposa.
texts.en: Julio, at 58 years old, makes a living working in his own business - a grocery store that he started because he needed to earn money in order to cover basic household costs.  Julio does not have any children who can support him financially and he lives only with his wife, who helps him by working in the business too.  Julio works in the shop every day from 7am until 9pm.  He offers all types of staple goods and sells supplies and disposable goods to fast food restaurants.  So, with this work, Julio earns an income to cover daily costs.  Julio is strong, organised and hard working, and, despite his age, he still feels productive and useful.  Julio is currently applying for a loan to buy stock (dairy products, meat, disposable goods, eggs, bread, and more) in bulk.  This will help him to increase the variety of stock he offers, and to satisfy his customers' needs and wants, allowing him to be more competitive in the local market.  This will be reflected in an increase in his income, which he can use to continue supporting his family.  He can also continue toward his goal of expanding his shop and adding more products to the variety of stock he already offers.  More stock will result in more profitability for his personal finances and, with this, Julio wants to guarantee a better quality of life for his family and to enjoy his old age at his beloved wife's side in peace.

loans.use: to buy stock (dairy products, meat, disposable goods, eggs, bread, and more) in bulk.

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Habiba, who is in her early 30s, is married with four children. Three of them are still going to school and one has finished school.  She has been running a business selling second hand clothes and fabrics for one year now. She works from 10am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Habiba's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more and better second-hand clothes.  During this time she started selling fabrics door-to-door delivering to her special customers.  She is very hardworking and is really happy with the loan.  She appreciates Kiva for supporting her group with this precious loan.  Now she can take a special loan.  She used the profit to pay school fees and managed to buy a plot of land.  She will use this loan to buy more second-hand clothes and fabrics to resell. She dreams of building her own house.

Habiba will share this loan with her loan group "karibu view" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes and fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo, con 56 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, cuando se vio obligado a conseguir el sustento por cuenta propia cuando pasaba por una difícil situación económica; esto lo llevó a montar una venta ambulante de papas fritas en diferentes presentaciones que vende a las afueras de una institución educativa, pues vio en esta labor una buena fuente de ingresos; sus principales clientes son los estudiantes y las personas que transitan por el sector y, poco a poco ha logrado ser reconocido y, con los ingresos que recibe ha sacado adelante a su único hijo, pues la responsabilidad recayó totalmente sobre él después de la separación con su esposa. Su perseverancia, empuje y dedicación lo motivan para solicitar el crédito con el que desea realizar adecuaciones del carro ambulante (pintura) y comprar insumos al por mayor (papas, aceite, gas propano), de esta manera podrá cambiar la imagen de su puesto de trabajo, cambiando la perspectiva de los transeúntes, lo que le permitirá atraer nuevos clientes, además tendrá materia prima disponible para satisfacer la demanda de sus productos; todo esto le dará la oportunidad de continuar con su labor y mejorar los ingresos para seguir apoyando a su hijo con el sustento diario y la educación, lo que él significa tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 56 years old and has had his own business for about 15 years. He says that he started his business when he was going through a difficult financial situation and realized that he had to find a way to make a living on his own. He started selling different kinds of potato chips from a cart because he saw the potential in it to earn a good income. Bernardo says that he makes his sales in an area around an educational center, and that the majority of his customers are students and other people who pass by the area. He says that little by little he has become well-known, and with the income he earns he has been able to provide for his son, for whom he has had sole responsibility since separating from his wife. 

Bernardo is requesting this loan to make improvements to his food cart such as painting and to buy supplies such as potatoes, oil and propane gas at wholesale prices. Bernardo hopes to improve the appearance of his food cart in order to attract new customers. He also wants to have more supplies to meet the demand for his products. Bernardo says that the loan will allow him to continue with his business and improve his income, so that he can continue to provide for his son, pay for his education and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make improvements to his food cart such as painting and to buy supplies such as potatoes, oil and propane gas at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anitah

texts.en: Anita is 29 years old, she has two children aged 2 and 6 years, She also takes care of her late brother's children. She basically has a retail shop and rentals. She began this business to support her family. She will use the loan to buy iron sheets. Her clients are people in town, She hopes to expand her business. She is hard working and God fearing.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and it is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Sandra is single and has no children. She is currently tending to tree plantations on her land, and has been farming for three years. Sandra likes beekeeping because it will give her a source of honey for home use, and because it provides a good income. 

This is Sandra's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to start a small restaurant business. Sandra's hope for the future is to expand her business into catering for groups and events.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen es una mujer emprendedora con 25 años de edad, madre de una bebé de 7 meses de nacida y comerciante independiente. Luego de la separación con su ex esposo, se vio afectada por una crisis económica larga y difícil, sin embargo supo sobrellevar la situación y hoy en día se dedica a trabajar como empleada en una empresa, además alterna su empleo con la venta de mercancía de manera independiente, ofreciendo artículos como ropa y accesorios, electrodomésticos pequeños,útiles escolares, juguetería, entre otros, de esta forma ella genera los ingresos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar y para velar por el bienestar de su pequeña hija. Su esmero, empuje y perseverancia le han permitido lograr los objetivos que se propone, por ello, solicita el crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayo (ropa, electrodomésticos pequeños, juguetería) con el fin de abastecerse para la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, en la que sus ventas e ingresos tienden a incrementar, así podrá satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, mientras realiza sus labores. Karen desea seguir avanzando con ambas actividades, pues se empeña en generar un ahorro programado para cumplir el sueño de adquirir su casa propia, en la que le pueda brindar una estabilidad económica a su bebé y disfrutar de mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Karen is 25 years old and an enterprising woman.  She is a mother to a seven month old baby, and she is an independent businesswoman.  After her separation from her ex-husband, she faced a long period of financial problems.  However, she was able to overcome the situation and, today, she makes a living working for a business and also selling merchandise independently - she sells clothes and accessories, small electrical appliances, school materials, toys, and more.  With this work, Karen is able to cover household costs and look after her young daughter.  With care, with a strong will, and perseverance, Karen has been able to achieve her self-imposed goals.  She is now applying for a loan in order to buy merchandise (clothes, small electrical appliances and toys) in bulk so that she can stock up for the fast-approaching Christmas season, when her sales and income usually increase.  With this stock, Karen will be able to satisfy her customers' needs and tastes and continue to work.  Karen wants to keep progressing in both her job and with her business.  She is putting in the effort to save up in order to achieve her dream of owning her own house.  With a house, Karen can offer her baby more financial stability and can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes, small electrical appliances and toys) in bulk.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida es una señora emprendedora de 44 años de edad, casada y madre de  2 hijos, ella curso primaria completa. Su hijo de 13 años de edad está cursando el primer año de secundaria y el hijo menor de 9 años estudia el segundo grado de primaria.  Ella vive  con sus 2 hijos y su esposo.
Aida desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de café, también siembran maíz y frijoles para el consumo de su familia, ella y su esposo tienen mucha experiencia en esta actividad. Ellos caminan 10 minutos para llegar al lugar donde pueden tomar transporte el cual se tarda 4 minutos para llegar a su destino donde esta ubicada su finca, luego ellos comienzan su labor de abonar y limpiar sus cultivos, juntos se esfuerzan para que no hayan obstáculos que impidan obtener una excelente cosecha ya que sus ingresos los obtienen de la venta de café, su producción la venden a los intermediarios que llegan a la localidad.
Por lo que  ella necesita financiamiento para la compra de abono y 4,000 plantas de café para resembrar parte de su finca que no está cultivada y que no lo han hecho por falta de capital de trabajo. 
Aida sueña en un futuro ampliar su casa de habitación para darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, ya que ella en su niñez tubo muchas limitaciones y no desea que ellos vivan la misma situación, además ansía brindarles educación universitaria para que ellos sean profesionales y tengan un mejor futuro, confía que sus hijos le ayudaran económicamente en su vejez. Estos planes consideran que los lograra mejorando su finca para obtener excelentes cosechas y por ende generar mayores ingresos para su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Aida is an enterprising woman. She is 44 years, married and the mother of 2 children. She finished primary school. Her 13 year old son is in the first year of secondary school and the 9 year old is in the second grade of primary school. She lives with her 2 children and her husband. For 15 years, Aida has worked in agriculture, growing coffee. She also grows corn and beans for her family's consumption. She and her husband have a lot of experience in this activity. She walks 10 minutes to get to where she can get transportation. It then takes her 4 minutes to get to where her farm is. Then they start their work fertilizing and weeding the crops. They work together so that there are no obstacles in the way of getting an excellent harvest, since her income comes from selling coffee. She sells what she produces to intermediaries who go to her community.  

She needs the loan to buy fertilizer and 4,000 coffee plants to re-plant a part of her farm that isn't cultivated due to a lack of capital. Aida dreams of expanding her house in the future so her children can have a better quality of life. She had a lot of limitations in her childhood and she doesn't want them to go through the same thing. She also wants to offer them a college education so that they can have professions and a better future. She trusts that her children will help her financially in her old age. She thinks she will achieve these goals by improving her farm to obtain excellent harvests and therefore more income for her home that needs it so much.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee plants to plant on her farm.

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru: Махфират проживает в столице, в городе Душанбе. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Махфират у себя дома занимается шитьем и вязанием на заказ. Около двух лет услуга швеи является основным источником дохода для Махфират. Она шьет платья на заказ на старой машинке. Этой машинке много лет. Махфират шила на ней, потому что другой машинки у нее не было. Сейчас она хочет расширить свою деятельность. Махфират просит кредит, чтобы приобрести современную швейную машинку. Благодаря кредиту процесс ее деятельности и качество ее сшитых платьев улучшится, что способствует увеличению ее клиентов и дохода.
texts.en: Makhfirat resides in the capital city of Dushanbe.  She is 47 years old.  She is married and has five children.  Makhfirat runs a business out of her home of sewing and knitting items to order.  For approximately two years, sewing has been Makhfirat's main source of income.  She sews and tailors dresses using an old sewing machine, which has seen many years.  Makhfirat uses this machine because she does not have a newer one.  Now, she wishes to expand her business.  Makhfirat is asking for a loan so she can purchase a modern sewing machine.  The new machine will improve the workflow process and the quality of the dresses, which will help her get additional clients and to increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Here is Janice from Liberia.  She lives in Sinkor, and she is 40 years old and divorced. She was in school till the eighth grade. 

From 2001 she has been selling used clothes in the local market in order to help her children at home. A challenge she faces is the rainy season. She started this business with a little money from her mother. She says handling her own money makes her happy about her business.
