loans.use: to purchase cassava, plantains, and palm oil to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. 

Abena is married and has seven children. Her husband works in maintenance. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Abena wants to use her loan to buy more fish to sell, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits in her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a widow and has five children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman.

For the past nine years Efua has sold cassava and palm oil in Asafora near Cape Coast. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Efua devotes her income to providing for the entire family.

Efua is applying for a 600 GHS loan through CRAN to buy additional cassava and palm oil, so helping her to improve her business. As she would like to adapt to changing customer demand, she plans to use her anticipated profits to diversify the products she sells.

loans.use: to buy additional cassava and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama sells maize in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years.  As a divorcee with one child, Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her child is able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married, with four children. She received some schooling till the end of junior high school. 

Currently, Abena sells plastic bowls and cooking utensils, at Bimponaso (near Twifo Praso). She has been involved in this business for five years now. Her husband is a mechanic. Abena’s income goes towards helping her husband pay the family's general expenses.  

Abena  will use the loan to buy more plastic bowls and cooking utensils to sell. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise,  Abena plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets

loans.use: to buy more plastic bowls and cooking utensils   to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 35 years old and married. She has two children, aged two and ten years. She runs a business, selling domestic products in Tombo, in the Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. She started the business because she wanted to improve the condition of her family. She's been in this business since after the war. She sells items such as glass cups, knives, and food containers, to people of her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is a poor business location.

Esther requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone. She will use the loan to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers, for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers, for resale.

loans.name: Edgardo Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael tiene 19 años de edad, vive junto a sus tíos en la zona rural de Pomahuaca, donde su población se dedica al comercio de frutales y agricultura, dicho distrito pertenece a la Jaén que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte el Perú.

Hace un año, brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros mediante una mototaxi, cuenta con movilidad propia y es conocido en la zona por el traslado a escolares a su centro educativo, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para comprar repuestos para su vehículo que le van a permitir trabajar con mayor seguridad y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ismael is 19 years old and lives with his uncle and aunt in the rural part of Pomahuaca. Its population works in agriculture and selling fruits. The district belongs to Jaén which is located in the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

Since one year back Ismael is offering transport services by the means of a motorcycle taxi. He owns his own vehicle and is known in the area for driving children to their schools. He has requested a loan of 500 PEN in order to buy vehicle parts. This will allow him to work more safely, thus continuing to generate an income and support his family.

loans.use: to buy vehicle parts

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married to a farmer and has two children. She went to school up through junior high. For the past three years Victoria has sold yams in Bimponaso near Twifo Praso. Her income goes towards supporting her family.

Victoria is applying for a 400 GHS loan through CRAN to increase her existing stocks of yams. With her anticipated profits she plans to venture into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing stocks of yams

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana has received no formal education. She specializes in selling salted fish, in Bimponaso (near Twifo Praso). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. Christiana is married and has six children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Christiana wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory level, which will enable her to sell a greater quantity of salted fish. In the long term,  Christiana plans to reinvest future profits into her business, which will help her to expand the business and satisfy the rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory level, which will enable her to sell a greater quantity of salted fish.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married to a farmer and has five children. For the past twenty years she has sold soap and palm kernel oil in Asafora near Cape Coast. Her business has grown substantially over the years. Her profits normally go towards covering the family’s general expenses and paying for her children’s school fees.

Ama is applying for a 1,000 GHS loan through CRAN to buy additional soap and palm kernel oil to sell, thus increasing her profits. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits in her business, so helping her to meet the needs of rising customer demands.

Even though Ama grew up in poverty and with no education, this has not stopped her from working to achieve her dream of a better life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy additional soap and palm kernel oil to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married with 7 children. She has received some schooling until the end of primary grade six. Currently, Ekua sells fried fish, gari, kenkey, and other food stuffs at Bimponaso (near Twifo Praso). She has been involved in this industry for about 4 years now. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.  Ekua will use the loan to increase her existing capacity of fried fish, gari, kenkey, and other food stuffs. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Ekua plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: increase her existing capacity of fried fish, gari, kenkey, and other food stuffs

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooked wheat in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Esi is single without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooked wheat. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooked wheat

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells fish in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about five years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have seven children.  Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Efua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Dankey

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Dankey, from Waterloo, in the Western Area region of Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children. In 2003, Kadiatu established her firewood business. She began her business, because she needed to create income to support her household. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Dankey requires a loan, in order to buy more wood to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Dankey plans to change her business to a big provisions shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to resell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. Esi is married and has six children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for twelve years. Abena is married and has five children. Her husband works as an electrician. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Abena will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Even though Abena grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Abena is an entrepreneur. She sells doughnuts in Asafora (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began two years ago. Abena is married and has two children. Her husband works with printing presses. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of doughnuts. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of doughnuts.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a small-scale seamstress at Bimponaso (near Twifo Praso). She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school  graduate. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Mary has been working as a seamstress for close to 4 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of fabric and an additional sewing machine, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of acquiring her own shop, hence helping her work from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fabric and an additional sewing machine

loans.name: José Abel De Jesús

texts.es:
José de 66 años, debido a la condición económica de su familia, solo pudo estudiar hasta un 4º grado, ya que tenia que trabajar todos los días y con mucho esfuerzo estudiaba; luego solo se dedico al trabajo agrícola pero hace unos años por iniciativa de sus hijos, continuo con sus estudios  en la nocturna y trabajaba en el día, logro sacar hasta un 7º grado. Después, ya no pudo seguir porque se le era mas difícil el trabajo. Es casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, 5 de sus hijos, ya son mayores de edad y han formado sus propias familias y dos de ellos están estudiando uno en bachillerato y el otro en primer año de universidad. Ellos dos son los que dependen exclusivamente de él.

José se a dedicado a trabajar la agricultura desde muy pequeño, ya que su padre le enseño esta labor. También, se dedicaba a trabajar como jornal cuidando animales bovinos. El trabajo agrícola lo realiza en las épocas de invierno los cultivos los realiza a 5 kilómetros de su casa, cuando se va al terreno uno de sus hijos lo traslada a mitad de camino, luego tiene que caminar porque no pueden ingresar vehículos, madruga y se queda si es posible toda la semana en el lugar solo lleva lo necesario en alimentación para mantenerse todo el tiempo que sea necesario.
Sus hijos le ayudan en ocaciones para el pago de mosos, pero no le ayudan directamente en el cultivo.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para la compra de insumos agrícolas; abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mosos y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo, se espera favorecer mejor el cultivo de maíz y lograr tener al final de la cosecha una mayor producción y tener mejores ingresos para su familia

Espera para el futuro, darles el estudio a sus hijos si es posible hasta que egresen de  la universidad, con el préstamo  tendrá mejores ingresos y la ganancia de la producción de maíz la utilizara para comprar mas ganado de repasto.
texts.en:
José is 66 years old. Due to the economic condition of his family, he was only able to go to school through 4th grade. He had to work every day and put a lot of effort into his studies. 

Later, he only spent his time in agricultural labor, but a few years ago through his children's initiative, he continued his studied at night and worked during the day. He completed through 7th grade. Afterwards, he was not able to continue because his work became more difficult. 

He is married and his wife works on household chores. Five of his children are grown up with their own families. Two of them are studying: one in high school and the other in the first year of university. These two depend exclusively on him.

José has earned his living working in agriculture since he was very young, when his father taught him this work. He also worked for wages taking care of cattle. 

He does agricultural work during the winter and plants his crops five kilometers from his house. When he goes to the territory, one of his sons takes him halfway, and then he had to walk because vehicles can't enter. He goes early in the morning and stays, if possible, all week, only taking what's necessary in food to stay all the time that is needed. His children help him sometimes with paying wages, but don't directly help with the crop.

The credit will be used to buy agricultural inputs: composts, fertilizers, workers' wages, and to prepare the land for the crop. He expects to improve his corn crop and achieve, at the end of harvest, a better production to have better income for his family.

He hopes for the future to give his children education, if possible so they enter university. With the loan, he will have better income and he will use his earnings from the corn to buy more cattle pasture.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs: compost, fertilizers, payment for workers, and to prepare the soil for the crop.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling plantains and yams, in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. Aba is single, without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family.

Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will enable her to sell greater quantities of plantains and yams. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her to expand the business and satisfy the rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of plantains and yams.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Even though Araba grew up in poverty and without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Araba is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her kenkey in Asafora (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began fifteen years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their six children. 

Araba has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her kenkey. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty kenkey. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘kenkey’.

loans.name: Tayorma Group

texts.en:
Doris is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Doris sells shoes and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Doris will use her share of the loan (1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy a large quantity of shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is divorced and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Esi is a successful businesswoman. She sells palm kernel oil in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about sixteen years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Esi uses her income to provide for the entire family. Esi will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of palm kernel oil, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of palm kernel oil, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Bimponaso (near Twifo praso). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for 5 years. Esi is married and has 6 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  Esi wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo in eastern Freetown. She is married and has three children.

For the past twenty years Kadiatu has sold palm oil and cassava bread from her home. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. seven days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to enlarge her business.

Kadiatu is applying for a 800,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more palm oil to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to grow her business and improve her living standards. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo, the eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed with 5 children.  For the past 25 years, Salamatu established her retail business alongside a coal nut and palm oil business at her house. She began her business because she generates her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the slow purchasing power of the customers.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, coconut oil and coal nuts to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, coconut oil and coal nuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Adwowa did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Adwowa prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) in her village of Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have nine children. Adwowa uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Adwowa will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales. Adwowa wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa is a widow and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman.

For the past forty years Adwowa has prepared and sold banku, a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn or cassava that has been cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish dough. She normally sells her banku in Asafora near Cape Coast. As the sole breadwinner in the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Adwowa is applying for a 500 GHS loan through CRAN to buy increased amounts of maize and cassava to make more banku. With her anticipated profits she plans to diversify into different types of products so she can meet more customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy increased amounts of maize and cassava

loans.name: Naana

texts.en: Even though Naana grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Naana is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Asafora (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began ten years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. Naana has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her ‘Kenkey’. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. With the new profits from her expanded business, Naana wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is divorced and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Esi is a successful businesswoman. She sells bread in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Esi uses her income to provide for the entire family. Esi will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of ingredients thus aiding her to improve her bread sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of ingredients thus aiding her to improve her bread sales.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Abiba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream. Currently, Abiba sells maize porridge and bread at Bimponaso (near Twifo Praso). She has been doing so for about 15 years. She is married to a farmer and together they have 6 children. Abiba uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Abiba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize and flour, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Abiba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize and flour, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Jesus Romeo

texts.es:
Jesús de 32 años de edad, soltero sin hijos, es originario del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. El sauce se caracteriza por comida típica como la cuajada, borona, queso. Jesús es un hombre trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente solo pudo cursar sus estudios de secundaria, y no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económicos, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar contabilidad pública.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad la venta de fritanga en su casa de habitación, la fritanga es la venta de comida típica como los tacos, gallo pinto, manuelitas, enchiladas, carne asada, maduros, tajadas. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para carne, arroz, platanos, cremas, frijoles, verduras, repollos para la elaboración de la comida, y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jesús agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jesús is 32 years old, single, and has no children. He is originally from El Sauce, which is located in the north of the country. El Sauce is characterized by typical foods such as milk curd, borona, and cheese. Jesús is a hard-working and responsible man with a great drive to succeed. Unfortunately he was only able to complete middle school and didn't get the opportunity to study at university, but he would have liked to study public accounting.

Thanks to his efforts and his will to get ahead he runs a business selling fritanga in his home. Fritanga is typical food such as tacos, gallo pinto, manuelitas, enchiladas, roast, plantains, and fried plantain. He spends around 10 hours a day offering his services. The purpose of the loan is to buy working capital and to stock his business with food products such as meat, rice, plantains, sour cream, beans, vegetables, and cabbage for preparing dishes; as well as to improve his income in a not-so-distant future. Jesús is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they offer people with scarce economic resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to buy working capital and stock his business with food products for preparing dishes

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Hawa from Waterloo, Eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 12 years and 25 years. 

Twenty years ago, Hawa established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business twelve hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children’s school fees. 

In the future, Hawa plans to change her business to a big provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Nana from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children ages between 13 years old and 25 years old. In 2003, Nana established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Nana requires a loan to buy more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Nana plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: María Salvadora

texts.es:
María de 29 años,  logro estudiar hasta un bachillerato, luego sus padres ya no le pudieron dar los estudios, para un nivel superior, posteriormente se acompaño. Su compañero de vida,  se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, uno de sus hijos esta cursando un segundo grado y la otra es una infante. 

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos, al cuido de animales de granja y también le ayuda a su compañero de vida en la agricultura. Cultiva, 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz, esto lo realiza debido a necesidad que presenta su familia y le ayuda a su compañero de vida, cuando le va ayudar tiene que madrugar, ya que los terrenos los tienen a 2 kilómetros de su casa, para preparar los alimentos para su compañero y las personas que van a trabajar.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para favorecer los cultivos de 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz que tiene su compañero y también en la crianza de unos pollos de engorde.

Ella espera para un futuro, mejorar su pequeña casa y darles el estudio a sus hijos hasta donde sea posible, y anexarle una parte mas a la galera, para que pueda tener una mayor numero de pollos de engorde.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old. She completed high school, but later her parents weren't able to give her higher education and she later accompanied them. 

Her life partner earns a living in agriculture and raising livestock. One of her children is studying in second grade, and the other is an infant.

María works in the home, taking care of farm animals and helping her partner with agriculture. She grows 10,500 square meters of corn, which she does due to her family's need. 

She helps her life partner--when he goes to the fields, he has to get up early because the fields they have are 2 kilometers from the house. She prepares food for her partner and the other people who are going to work.

She will use the loan to support the 10,500 square meters of corn crop that her partner has, and also for raising some chickens to fatten. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her small house, give her children education as far as is possible, and add another part to the gallery so she can have a larger number of chickens to fatten.

loans.use: to support 10,500 square meters of her partner's corn and fatten some chickens.

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu is 30 years old. She is married to a teacher and the couple has 1 child who is attending primary school. 

For 10 years now, Kadiatu has been selling clothes/cloth, etc. Together, they are requesting a loan of 4,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (800,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy clothes/cloth in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy clothes/cloth in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Na God Dae Gee Ii Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Na God Dae Gee II” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Sia is the featured leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a diamond miner, and the couple has three children. Sia has been a businesswoman for seven years now; she sells market-food such as tomatoes, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy tomatoes, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is married with 6 children. She has received some schooling until the end of middle form 4. Currently, Rebecca sells provisions in Bimponaso (near Twifo Praso). She has been involved in this industry for about 3 years now. Her husband is a farmer. Rebecca’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Rebecca will use the loan to increase her existing provision capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Rebecca plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing provision capacity

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: After graduating Vocational school, Eunice decided to set up her own ‘Wakye’ selling business (Wakye is a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She prepares her ‘Wakye’ on her own and proceeds to sell it at Bimponaso (near Twifo Praso). With over 5 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Wakye’. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a teacher) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their 4 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Wakye’.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Vida decided to set up her own ‘Gari’ selling business (Gari is a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava). She prepares her ‘gari’ on her own and proceeds to sell it at Bimponaso (near Twifo Praso). With over 4 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Gari’. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their 3 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Gari’.

loans.name: Oneness Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Oneness” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Patrick.  Patrick is age 33; he was born in Tankoro in eastern Sierra Leone. His wife is a businesswoman, too. His three children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For six years now, Patrick has been selling bags, belts, etc. With this loan, he is going to buy a large quantity of bags, belts, etc. to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bags, belts, etc. to add to his business.

loans.name: Development Iii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Development III” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Fatmata is the featured leader of this group. Fatmata is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children who are attending primary school. Fatmata sells market food – palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. and has been doing this business for 8 years now. With the help of this loan, Fatmata will buy palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: G.s A.m.s Group

texts.es:
El G.S A.M.S está conformado por tres integrantes madres solteras, con  siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Originarias de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de salir adelante. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar una carrera, la cual las obligo a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad sus sueños más deseados es poder trabajar y  sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos y brindarles un futuro mejor y luchar porque sean profesionales.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del g.s  es Heidy y tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos como rubor, labiales, lápiz de ojos, desmaquilladoras, anti ojeras, cremas hidratantes, perfumes, body. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto de forma ambulante, y en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cosméticos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s A.M.S agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
GSAMS is made up of three single mothers who have seven children they are responsible for. They are native to Nagarote, located in the western part of the country. 

These women are characterized by being hard-working, responsible and wanting to get ahead. Sadly, due to a lack of resources, they weren't able to study a career, which has forced them to work from a young age. 

Currently, their biggest dream is to be able to work and improve the lives of their young children, giving them a better future and struggling for them to become professionals.

Thanks to her effort and desire to succeed, the coordinator of the G.S. is Heidi. Her job is selling cosmetics, such as blush, lipstick, eyeliner, makeup remover, anti-dark circles, moisturizers, perfumes and body. 

She works at her business for eight hours every day, offering her products by walking, and in her house. The goal of the loan is to invest in capital and stock her business for the buying and selling of cosmetics so she can earn better income in the near future. 

The GSAMS group is grateful for the assistance Kiva investors provide to poor people and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to invest in capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of cosmetics such as blush, lipstick, eyeliner, makeup remover, anti-dark circles, moisturizers, perfumes and body.

loans.name: Good Women Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Good Women” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 3,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from Kiva lenders in order to boost their respective businesses. With this loan, they will be able to add more inventory to their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.
 
The featured leader of this group is Kumba. Kumba is 33 years old. She was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda, in northern Sierra Leone. However, she is currently residing in Koidu, together with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a miner ,and her children are attending primary and secondary schools.  For 15 years now, she has been selling clothes/cloth. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of clothes/cloth to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes/cloth to add to her business

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 25 years old and lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is married and has one child. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, who makes an income of $2 each day.

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Ny is requesting a loan of $500. She will use the loan to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help reduce her family's expenses. In the future, she would like her husband to become a construction foreman, increasing his income.  In addition, she wants to send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Cenit

texts.es: Cenit, de 53 años de edad, está casada y vive en compañia de su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Cenit se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, la cual está implementada en un espacio muy bien  acondicionado en su hogar, lleva más de tres años en está actividad, siendo muy concurrido por los vecinos de la zona, a los cuales atiende de manera amable y con mucha alegría, para esto cuenta con la ayuda de su hija, en la atención cuando ella no se encuentra ò se va a realizar compras para la bodega. Considera rentable su negocio por la constante demanda de sus productos y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta  su actividad pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para pagar los gastos de su casa,  le da tiempo para apoyar a sus hijos, en criar a su nieto cuando está fuera de casa en su trabajo, nos comenta que tiene muchas ganas de ampliar su negocio y variar mas los productos que para así poder tener mas ingresos. Con el préstamo de 1800 nuevos soles, comprará productos comestibles en general para surtir su bodega como arroz, azúcar, aceites, fideos, entre otros, considera que a mayor variedad su negocio tendrá mas acogida.
texts.en:
Cenit, 53 years old, is married and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. 

Cenit earns her living selling food products, which takes place in a very good space attached to his home. She has been doing this for more than three years and is very popular with the residents in the area, who she attends in a friendly and happy manner. For this, she relies on the help of her daughter for care when she is not present or leaves to make purchases for the store.

She believes her business is profitable because of the constant demand for her products and the good returns she gets. 

She likes her job because it allows her to have income to pay household expenses and gives her time to support her children in taking care of her grandchild when she is away from home and at work. 

She said she has a strong desire to expand her business and vary the products more to have better returns. With the loan of 1,800 new soles, she will buy food products in general to stock the store, such as rice, sugar, oils, noodles and more. She believes that with more variety, her business will have better reception.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, sugar, oils, noodles and others.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is 24 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Irbid, with his two sisters and his parents. Yousef is in his first year, studying for a Diploma in Civil Engineering. He also works at a cafe. He is planning to continue his study until he gets his Bachelor degree. The degree will enable him to find a better job after graduation, so he will start earning a better income to help his family financially. Yousef doesn't currently have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees, for his Civil Engineering studies

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is 25 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is in the military. Amal is studying for Bachelor of Math 4th year. She is planning to continue her study and to work in her study field after graduation to start helping her husband financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Amah

texts.en:
Amah is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She works in a small factory with a monthly salary which she uses to support her family. She assists her husband who works in a medical company to cover house hold expenses. 

Amah is applying for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase a laptop to use for her career. By taking this loan, Amah will be able to prepare reports and documents. She and her husband hope to improve their living standards. Amah appears in the photo with laptop bag.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to use for her career.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 22 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his six siblings and his parents. One of his brothers is in the military. 

Abdullah is in his fourth year, studying for a Bachelor of Law degree. He is planning to continue his studies to be able to find a job in his study field after graduation, so he can start earning a better income to help his family financially. 

Abdullah doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Subheyeh

texts.en:
Subheyeh was born in 1958. She is married and lives at a sector in Jordan called Wihdat; her husband is a mechanic. 

Subheyeh has been selling blankets for a year. She started selling a small quantity of blankets to her neighbors and close friends, and she found it profitable and a good financial support for her family. 

Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her profit and income. But she doesn't have enough money to do so, so she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Sereena

texts.en: Sereena is 22 years old. She lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Salt, with her two sisters and her parents. Her father works in a governmental entity. Sereena is in her first year, studying for a Bachelor of Management Information Systems. She is planning to continue her study and to work in her study field after graduation, to start helping her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees and pursue her Bachelor of Management Information Systems degree

loans.name: Enas

texts.en: Enas is 18 years old. She lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat, with her three siblings and her parents. Enas is in her first year of studying for a Bachelor of Accounting degree. She is planning to continue her study and work in her study field after graduation, to start helping her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees and pursue her Bachelor of Accounting degree

loans.name: Naela

texts.en:
Naela was born in 1981. She is single and lives with her family and four siblings at a sector in Jordan called Deiralla. 

Naela has been working at her mini market for a year. She started selling a small quantity of foodstuffs to her neighbors and close friends, and she found it profitable and a good financial support for her family. So she opened her own mini-market, and now she wants to stock it with food products and other products to raise her profit and income. 

But she doesn't have enough money to do so, so she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more food products for her mini- market

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Ángeles” está  conformado por 14 socios responsables y dinámicos. Isabel de 57 años es viuda con 02 hijos independientes. Isabel cuenta con un kiosco la cual ofrece golosinas y comidas, siendo sus mayores clientes vecinos de su zona. Se siente feliz pues con su esfuerzo ha podido mejorar su vivienda y mantener su negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de golosinas y bebidas. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda. El grupo “Los Ángeles” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Isabel se encuentra en la parte posterior es la cuarta del lado izquierdo, viste blusa celeste. En la parte superior lado derecho se encuentra  Charlie la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo
texts.en:
The group “Los Ángeles” (The Angels) is made up of 14 responsible and dynamic members. Isabel is 57 years old. She is a widow with two independent children. 

Isabel has a small stand which offers candy and food. Her main customers are neighbors from her area. She feels glad because through her efforts, she has been able to improve her home and maintain her business. 

Her most recent loan will be used for the purchase of candy and drinks. Her greatest wish is to complete the construction of her home. The group “Los Ángeles” is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they have offered. 

Isabel is in the back, fourth from the left, wearing a sky-blue blouse. In the top part on the right is Charlie, who wasn’t able to come on time because of work.

loans.use: to purchase candy and drinks.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is 24 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Salt, with his three siblings and his parents. Hani is studying Geometrics and Space Engineering and is in his fifth year. He also works at a supermarket. He is planning to continue his study until he gets his Bachelor degree, to be able to find a better job after graduation. He expects to start earning a better income and helping his family, financially. Hani doesn't currently have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees and pursue his Bachelor degree in Geometrics and Space Engineering

loans.name: Daves Samir

texts.es:
Daves es un joven de 18 años que vive en distrito de Parcona, Ica; Perú. Daves es un joven muy trabajador, para poder tener ingresos y seguir adelante trabaja como empleado en una empresa de transportes de la ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que le va bien n su trabajo porque es responsable y puntual.

Daves está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cama ortopédica para su abuela, ya que ella sufre de dolencias en la columna, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su abuela, así poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Daves is an 18-year old young man who lives in the district of Parcona, Ica (Perú). Daves works very hard to earn money and get ahead. He is an employee at a transportation company in the city and works for approximately 10 hours a day. He thinks things are going well at work because he is responsible and punctual. 

Daves is grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy an orthopaedic bed for his grandmother, who has back pain, and to improve her quality of live. He wants to keep working towards his big dream: "To have his own house".

loans.use: to buy an orthopaedic bed.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en la comunidad Oyotun, donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y cultivos de yuca, arroz, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, en la parte posterior de su domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para comprar de animales pequeños, luego engordarlo y venderlos a mejor precio y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 36 years old. She lives together with her two children in the community of Oyotun, where the population works in the business of young animals and farming yucca and rice. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Perú. 

She works raising and selling livestock behind her house, and she has requested a loan of 1200 nuevos soles for the purchase of young stock. Later, she will fatten them and sell them at a better price, and in this way continue generating income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase young animals.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and has five children between the ages of one month and 12 years old. They all live at home and only four attend school.

Annie was unable to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman. For the past three years, she has been selling red oil in the local market. Now she faces no problems, she sells every day and spends 12 hours with her business. She started this business with  a little income she received from her husband. 

Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel was born in 1966. He is married and lives with his wife and four children in a sector of Jordan called Baqaa. One of his sons is currently working at a bakery and the rest of the children are students. 

Adel has been working at his blacksmith workshop for nine years. He is the only supporter for his family and he is trying his best to provide his children with the best education. He is planning to expand his business to raise his profit, in order to be able to cover his family's needs. 

To do so, Adel needs to buy new machines for his workshop which he doesn't have enough money for. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his shop.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hija en la zona rural de Pomahuaca donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y cultivo de frutales, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de animales ovejas, chivos, cerdos, asnos y también se dedica al cultivo de cacao, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para abonar su finca y de esta manera tener una buena cosecha, la otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Roberto, age 54, lives with his wife and daughter in the rural area of Pomahuaca.  The population there devotes itself to selling small animals and growing fruit.  It is two hours from the city of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He sells animals like sheep, goats, pigs, and donkeys.  He also grows cacao.

He has requested a loan for 2,500 nuevo soles to fertilizer his farm.  This way he will have a good harvest.  He will use the other part of the money to buy sheep in order to continue selling them to his customers.

loans.use: to buy sheep and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Nardino Aminadab

texts.es:
El joven Nardino de 26 años,  logro estudiar hasta un bachillerato, luego decidió viajar hacia los Estados Unidos y se dedico a trabajar  y adquirir algunos bienes; posteriormente se regreso a su país.  Su compañera de vida, se dedica a trabajar como enfermera, su hija es una infante de 10 meses de edad.

Él por su parte, se dedica al cultivo de 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, esta actividad se la enseño su padre; quien también se dedica a trabajar la agricultura, lo ha hecho desde que estaba muy pequeño; debido a que estudiaba y a la vez trabajaba con su padre. Luego, se dedico al comercio de ganado, esta actividad se la enseño un amigo con el que actualmente trabaja en los tiangues. También, se a dedicado a la crianza de pollos de engorde y  la crianza de bovinos de repasto. En la época agrícola tiene que madrugar, ya que los cultivos los tiene a dos kilómetros de su casa, también ordeña dos vacas lecheras antes de dirigirse a dicho lugar.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados en la compra de una vaca lechera, 300 pollos de engorde y  concentrados para los pollos.

 Espera para un futuro, tener su propia casa donde puedan vivir con su familia, ademas ampliar mas la galera donde tienen los pollos y poder criar mas, ademas espera  seguir estudiando para cursar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Nardino, 26 years old, was able to complete high school. He decided to travel to the United States to work and obtain some assets. Afterwards, he returned to his country. His life partner works as a nurse and they have a ten-month-old daughter.

Nardino cultivates 14,000 square meters of corn. His father, who also works in agriculture, taught him this activity. He’s done this since he was little because he studied at the same time as he worked with his father. Then, he worked in the cattle business. A friend, who he currently works with in the market, taught him this activity. He is also involved in raising and fattening chickens and in breeding cattle for grazing. When working in agriculture, he has to wake up early since his crops are 2 kilometers from his house. He also milks 2 cows before he heads out.

This loan will be used to buy a milk cow, 300 chickens to fatten, and chicken feed. In the future, Nardino hopes to have his own house where he can live with his family and be able to expand his chicken pen so he can raise more. He also hopes to keep studying so he can complete a university degree.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow, 300 chickens to fatten, and chicken feed.

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: Rebeca de 32 años separada con 02 hijos aún dependientes, actualmente  es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal  “Las Tres Marías” conformada por 06 mujeres responsables, dicho grupo pasan a su 10 ciclo. Con los deseos de superarse y contar con un negocio propio  Rebeca inicia su negocio, la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad en su vivienda. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito para la compra de abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas.  El anhelo de Rebeca es de crecer más su negocio. El grupo “Las Tres Marías” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Rebeca  se encuentra sentada y viste chompa ploma.
texts.en: 32 year old Rebeca is separated and has 2 children who are dependent on her. She is currently a member of the loan group "The Three Marías", which is comprised of 6 responsible women and which is in it's 10th loan cycle. With the desire to overcome problems and have her own business, Rebeca began her business selling staple goods from her home. With the goal of continuing to improve, she requested a loan to buy groceries, candy, and drinks. Her great desire is to grow her business more. The group "The Three Marías" is grateful to the people who made possible this loan and promised to keep working well. Rebeca is seated in the photo and wears a grey sweater.

loans.use: to buy candy, groceries, and drink.

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en:
Gharam is 21 years old. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with her five siblings and her parents. Her father is a retired man. 

Gharam is studying for a Bachelor of English Language, fourth year. She is planning to continue her study in order to work in her study field after graduation, to start financially helping her family since they are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Fredesbinda

texts.es:
Fredesbinda tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo, en la zona rural de Zaña, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura ya que las tierras son muy fértiles y comercio de animales menores a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores, en la parte posterior a su domicilio desde hace 05 años y ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de animales pequeños y posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a mejor precio en su distrito y comunidades aledañas, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fredesbinda is 33 years old and lives with her husband and son in the rural area of Zaña where people work in agriculture because the land is fertile and raise small animals. The area is 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Perú.
She works raising and selling small animals behind her home and has been doing his for 5 years. She has requested a loan of $1,475 to buy small animals and then fatten them and offer them for a better price in her district and surrounding communities. This will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals: ducks, hens, guinea pigs

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is 21 years old. He is a single man living in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Adnan is an employee in the government sector getting a low salary, which is barely enough to cover his family's needs. He works hard to access financial resources easily. 

He has requested a loan of YER 100,000 to help cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him with his homework and reports. This will ensure a better future and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop to support his work.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Sra. Ángela de 57 años de edad, casada con hijos mayores de edad e independiente. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  la venta de mercadería en general como pantalones, camisas, vestidos, shrot, toallas, camisolas, ropa de cama, ropa de niños, ropa interior. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su mercadería, actividad que la desempeña en un lugar especifico de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Ángela agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
57 year old Angela is married with two grown children. She is originally from Leon, a place in the west of the country. She can be characterized as being responsible, hardworking, and with a great personal desire to overcome problems. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she was obliged to work from a very early age to help with the household expenses. 
Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, she has a business selling general merchandise such as pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, towels, camisoles, bed clothes, kids' clothes, and underwear. She works about 8 hours a day, and does this from a fixed place. The goal of the loan is to have business capital to invest in supplying her business buying and selling merchandise so that, in the not-to-distant future she can have better income. Angela is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help that they offer to people who have scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: for business capital and to supply her business buying and selling merchandise such as pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, towels, camisoles, underwear, kids' clothes, bed clothes.

loans.name: Maen

texts.en:
Maen is 19 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with his five siblings and his parents. 

Maen is studying for a Bachelor of Nursing. He is in his first year. He is planning to continue his study, in order to be able to find a job in his study field after graduation, to start earning a better income, so he can financially help his family. 

Currently, Maen doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is 21 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq, with his seven siblings and his parents. 

Emad is studying for a Bachelor of Earth Sciences degree. He is in his second year. He is planning to continue his study, in order to be able to find a job in his study field after graduation, to start earning a better income, so he can financially help his family. 

Currently, Emad doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Yesenia Marisol

texts.es:
Yesenia de 35 años, vive junto a sus pequeños hijos los cuales tienen las edades de 9- 7 y 4 años.
Ella tiene un nivel académico de bachillerato general y preparada en cosmetología, la cual es la actividad que ejerce actualmente y vive junto a su esposo.


Desde hace 2 años ejerce la actividad de cosmetóloga, es propietaria del negocio y lo aprendió en una academia de cosmetología en la ciudad.

El préstamo será invertido,  para comprar arena y cemento  para la remodelación de su vivienda, para ejercer una mejor presentación en su negocio.


Planea tener un negocio que le permita la sostenibilidad de su familia y que le permita otorgarle a sus pequeños, una buena educación y una vivienda que reúna las condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 35 years old, She lives together with her young children, who are 9, 7 and 4 years old. She has a general certificate and is trained in cosmetology, which is the work that she does currently. She lives with her husband.

For 2 years, she has worked as a cosmetologist. She is the business owner, and she learned this is at a cosmetology academy in her city. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of sand and cement for remodeling her home in order to have a better presentation for her business. She plans to have a business that will allow her to support her family and to give her little ones a good education and a home that meets her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase sand and cement for remodeling her home in order to have a better presentation for her business.

loans.name: Veronica Rosario

texts.es:
Veronica tiene 50 años y vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ella trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, abarrotes y bebidas como cerveza y gaseosas, para Verónica su negocio es muy importante ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que ella es madre de 2 hijos a los cuales ama muchísimo.

Veronica esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como cervezas al por mayor y también productos de bazar, así ella podrá ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y poder hacer realidad su sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Verónica, 50, lives in the city of Chincha.  She's the mother of two children whom she loves a lot.

Verónica works in her small business selling clothing, groceries, and beverages such as beer and soda.  Her business is very important to her because it's her only source of income for paying her household expenses.

Verónica's grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy more merchandise for her business, such as beer wholesale and products for her store.  This way she'll be able to sell more products to her customers and achieve her dream of finishing building her house of quality materials.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is 29 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Madaba, with his one brother and his parents. 

Emad is studying for a Bachelor of Social Work degree. He's in his third year. He is planning to continue his study in order to be able to find a job in his study field after graduation, to start earning a better income, so he can financially help his family. 

Currently, Emad doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia was born in 1991. She is married and lives in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat. Her husband works for a governmental entity. 

Dalia has been selling clothes for one year. She started her business selling a small quantity of clothes to her neighbors and close friends. She found it to be profitable and a good financial support for her husband. 

Now, she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profits and income. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fawaz

texts.en: Fawaz is a 23-year-old, married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has gone through some hardships in his life. However, because of his dedication and desire to get ahead in life, he has been able to overcome these difficulties and make progress, together with his family. He owns a spice shop where he offers basic consumer goods for sale. He has been operating his business for two years. He started his business with a small grocery store, then he sold it to his brother and was able to establish a spice shop. Recently, his inventory of merchandise has diminished considerably. With the intention of increasing the quantity of products that he offers, he wants to buy more food products to display for his customers. However, he does not have enough capital to make all of these purchases. For this reason, he requested a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. This loan will allow him to buy different kinds of spices in order to expand his business. In the future, he would like to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of spices in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha was born in 1977. She is married and lives in a sector of Jordan called Deiralla, with her husband and four children. Her husband works for a governmental entity. 

Maha has been selling blankets for one year. She started her business selling a small quantity of them to her neighbors and close friends and she found it to be profitable and a good financial support for her husband. 

Now, she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her profits and income. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en: This is Tamer’s second loan cycle from Ryada. His previous loan helped him to develop his business and had a positive outcome. His sales also increased. Today, Tamer is planning to keep on developing his business to make sure that his children will have the best living and education, and at the same time, to ensure that his customers are satisfied. He wants to use this loan to purchase a microscope for accurate maintenance.

loans.use: to buy more electronics and maintenance tools.

loans.name: Mutaz

texts.en: Mutaz was born in 1989. He is single and lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with his parents and three siblings. Mutaz has been selling mosaics for one year. He learned how to make them while working at the Scholars palace in Jordan. Then he started making them by himself at his house and selling them. He found this project profitable and now he needs to buy a larger quantity of raw materials and tools for his project such as pigments, paint with various colors and hammers in order to expand it successfully. However, he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy pigments, paint with various colors and hammers for his business

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is 21 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his 4 siblings and his parents. His father works as a taxi driver. Murad is studying in his 3rd year of his Bachelor of Accounting. He is planning to continue his studies to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en: Maram was born in 1991. She is single and lives with her family and 3 siblings in a sector in Jordan called Sothern Ghour. Maram has been working at her mini-market for 6 years. She started her project selling a small quantity of food products to her neighbors and close friends, and she found it profitable and a good financial support for her family. So she opened her own mini market and now she wants to buy the products that her customers requested and to buy a refrigerator where she can keep cold drinks. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more food products and a refrigerator for her business

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Because Raeda is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture.

Raeda is a married woman who lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt with her 5 children and her husband. Her husband is a retired man.

Raeda’s oldest son is studying Bachelor of Air Conditioning and Refrigerating 2nd year, and he works at a governmental entity. He is planning to continue his studies to find a good job in his study field after graduation to start helping his family financially, as they are currently facing financial crisis which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Raeda applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her sons' upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 29 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife and two daughters. 
He takes photos for weddings, birthdays, and any occasion that the customers want. This activity is his only financial income. He earns $708 monthly.
Mohammad asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a new video camera and another one for photography pictures. 
Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new video camera and another one for photography pictures.

loans.name: Hazim

texts.en:
Hazim is a 29-year-old; he is from Gaza. He intends to start his new business, a garage for repairing cars and selling car oils.
